text:
Aromas are very malty - a mix of several different aromas though all of them individually quite mild - bread, dried plums, roasted coffee, toffee. Very little hop presence.

Color is a somewhat dark reddish brown. Large tan head.

Mild to moderate sweetness; low level of bitterness.

Medium bodied; average carbonation; slightly high alcohol level is not too apparent; finish is medium to long, sweet and malty.

Overall its not bad - there are a fairly wide variety of aromas. However they are all very mild and they blend together in a bit of a muddled way.
Темный, плотный, пена грязно-с во вкусе карамел& хлеб, ириски, трава.

This one pours a real nice thick black with a medium head and aromatic notes of coffee, toffee, cocoa. The taste is smooth, malty and round with a lot of velvety chocolate flavor hanging with a little coffee bean and smoke. Great stuff. Good for making pickles in anticipation of Pickleas Cage XX: A 20th Anniversary Cage-abration while listening to thee best show, too.

Typical doppelbock aroma and flavor of nuts, toffee, molasses, and a little touch of iced tea. Clear brown in color. Ive never been a huge fan of the doppelbock style, but this is a pretty good effort overall. Quite drinkable and clean palate.

Pours with an attractive thin light brown foam. Color is cloudy Coca-Cola. Quite fresh aroma has mämmi and faint dried plum, raisins and dates. Some cooked flour. Palate is well balanced, although quite yeasty and floury. Taste is bready and rich in dark malts. The finish has a long lasting bitternerness and dryness. Quite interesting. Ive known Weihenstephaner only from their wheat beers, but this displays that the brewery is versed in other beer styles as well. The Korbinian retains qualities familiar from Weihenstephaners wheat beers (like smoothness and elegant taste and aroma), but does in a different style. I find that the Korbinian is not that enjoyable (even if its a good beer) on its own, but I imagine that it would be amazing when paired with the proper foods.
Such a great beer that I actually enjoyed the otherwise uncouth act of burping this beer up as a second opportunity to enjoy it!

Ar: Fairly clean; some raisins and toast; a very refined, dried-flower aroma. Ap: Deep chestnut red; clear; medium light tan head with moderate-low retention, leaves a motley collection of tiny, small, and medium bubbles. T: Deep, rich maltiness with a very clean background alcohol impression; clean toast and raisins; silky, cake-like sweetness; relatively low but firm bitterness. P: Medium body with very high carbonation, lending a mostly creamy texture; finish is medium-dry. O: Rich and full, a big doppelbock with a lot of flavor; the heat is a bit too noticeable at times; good, clean yeast profile, really letting the malt and body shine.
A full bodied flavourful beer, sweet malt, plum hint of chocolate. Nice tingle on the tounge from the carbonation
Bottle. Clear dark brown color with small tan head. Aroma - Plums, earth, grain. Taste - Sweet, brown sugar, coffee, malt, bread.

From Decervecitas. In Bavaria glass. Watching Los Soprano 6x14-15. My favourite doppelbock with difference. Perfect feel. Brown sugar, caramel, toffe, figs,all in perfect armony, in just the adequate amount
Notes of chocolate, burned brown toast and chewy toffee. hint of some dark fruits too. smooth mouthfeel, fairly spicy taste - cloves, corriander. chocolate and banana too. fantastic beer!

.5 L brown bottle in a lager glass. 
Dark red-brown body with excellent clarity and a good, light brown head. 
Medium-full-body with near medium carbonation. 
Aroma: dark dried fruits, toffee and some alcohol esters. 
Flavor: hints of dried plums and figs, toffee, roasted nuts, brown bread and chocolate. Approaches 8. 

Overall: a standard bearer for the style.

500ml bottle pours cola brown with deep red tones and a thin off-white head. Aromas of chocolate, caramel malt, dark fruits and bourbon. Flavours of roast malt, brown sugar, cola, molasses and herbal characters. Skilful balance of sweetness, saltiness and bitterness.

500 ml bottle. Pours a mahogany brown color topped by a large, dense tan head. Wonderful roasted malt nose has notes of dark toffee, baked beans, brown bread and toasted pecans. First sip is sweet roasted malt, more toffee, dried dark fruit and toasted pecans. Rich and flavorful, with subtle herbal hops in the smooth complex finish.

Sampled at the Bräustüberl Weihenstephan in Freising.
Medium and lasting brown head. Clear brown color. Huge malty aroma with dried fruits and syrap. Small sweetness and a mild bitterness. Fine firm body.
Donkerrood, helder, redelijk wat schuim. Aroma van kersen, intens fruitig, moutig. Smaak is zoet, ietwat bitter, moutig. Koolzuurtinteling, goede nasmaak. Lekker!
50cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. Belles notes maltées et fruitées.

Bottle->dimpled mug. Dark brown with moderate lite beige head. Great looking beer. A: dark sweet malt, lite figs, biscuit. T: sweet malt, brown sugar, molasses, slightly bitter end. Very malty but not too heavy. Good.

Muddy, walnut wood color, with an off-white layer of dense cream. Pungent aroma of dark dried fruits: figs and rum-soaked prunes are at the forefront. Layers of milk chocolate and licorice appear under the heavy fruitcake aroma. Caramel and maple syrup provide an unctuous sweetness to the nose. On the tongue, Korbinian is rich and balanced. Chocolate and coffee marry with sweet vanilla bean, and light spicy notes. Finishes on a slightly bitter note of roasted hazelnuts and coffee. Smooth, oily texture that hides the alcohol well. Korbinian feels like a polished stone, with edges that have been smoothed away over generations.

500ml bottle. Pours dark amber-brown with a creamy beige head. Aroma of caramel, dark fruit, and roast. Taste is caramel, roasted malt, nuts, brown bread, brown sugar, and dark fruits. Medium to full body. Finish is malty with some earthy hop bitterness. Very nice.
Bottle. Pours clear brown with low head. Aroma is brown sugar, malts. Taste is sweet, with notes of sugar canes, roasted malts, and smoothness

0,5l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop, Bratislava, Pours dark brown liquid, small creamy tan head, Aroma: plums, raisins, molasses, caramel, cocoa, Taste: heavy sweet, light to medium bitter, light sour, very malty, raisins, plums, caramel, slighlty metallic off taste, Palate: full body, soft to flat carbonation, oily mouthfeel, medium long caramel fruity aftertaste, Overall: fine, enjoyed.

Intense caramel, dark, sweet, roast malts, light cough syrup, biscuit, molasses. Clear, very dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. More, dry, caramel malts, biscuit, dark malts, lively carbonation, medium bodied, dry and bitter finish. Nice Doppelbock, great aroma, rich and intense malts. Bottle from La Botica de la Cerveza, Malaga.
Butelka 0,5l. Barwa mahoniowa, ładna piana. W aromacie świetnie, karmel, owoce, głównie w kierunku śliwki i wiśni, bardzo przyjemnie. W smaku karmel, chleb, ale nie aż tak przyjemnie jak w aromacie.
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2017 .5l bottle @Harry?s. Pours deep dark reddish with medium head. Aroma is syrup, dark malts, dried fruits, plums. Flavor is mostly same. Well balanced. Niiiice!
Caña BärBerlin (Oviedo) Aroma maltoso, oscura color marrón, fuerte pero con final dulce

bottle poured in mug. Dark color with creamy mildly tanned head that lingers a little. Aroma are toffee, nuts, well balanced with caramel and roasted malts with a sweet presence. Taste is sweet, barely bitter but intense, toffee, coffee, caramel. Full bodied. World class beer really. first Weihenstephaner ive tried, gonna look for more for sure

500 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 2/16/2016. Pours crystal clear dark reddish brown color with a 1-2 finger dense khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, toasted biscuit, brown bread, nuttiness, light chocolate, raisin, plum, fig, date, apricot, apple, herbal, light pepper, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of huge caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, toasted biscuit, brown bread, nuttiness, light chocolate, raisin, plum, fig, date, apricot, apple, herbal, light pepper, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light herbal/spicy hop and roast bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, toasted biscuit, brown bread, nuttiness, chocolate, dark fruit, herbal, light pepper, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop flavors; with an awesome malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light increasing dryness from lingering bitterness as well. Amazingly clean lager flavors, with minimal yeast notes present. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, and lightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is well hidden with a mild warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic doppelbock. All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the ABV. Rich malt complexity with complimenting underlying fruity notes; and balancing noble hop character. A highly enjoyable offering, and classic style example.

Bottle. Dark Reddish-Brown in colour. Very Malty; lots of toasty/roasty bready malts, caramel, toffee, chocolate, hints of coffee and nuts. Very Fruity; dark fruits, raisins. Spicy. Hoppy; some grassy hops. Warming alcohol. Sweet toasty malty fruity throughout. Very drinkable. Nice beer! (2011-12-29)
Sötét, vörös árnyalatú sör. Illata kicsit a szőlőre emlékeztet. Íze szerintem fenomenális. Az édesebb sörökhöz tartozik. Igazán harmonikus kis sör.

0.5l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is malty, caramel, raisins and plums. Taste is sweet with caramel, some chocolate and fruity notes, mostly raisins and plums. Overall its very good beer.

Bottle. Pours mahagon brown with small beige head, stays. Aroma: sweet, caramel, toffee, chocolate, bread soup with rasin, butter. Taste: sweet, caramel, toffee, bread, milk chocolate, nuts, dark berries. Medium body. Nice.

Appearance: dark red, brown, clear, beige, well standing head. Aroma: bread soup with raisins, caramel. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, Palate: lively, medium body, creamy, astringent, light bitter finish.
clear mahagony liquid with tan head. aroma of bread with butter and caramel. tastes same, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
color marron bastante oscuro, buena densidad, aroma a frutos secos, mucha malta tostada, caramelo, una cerveza para disfrutar, gran doppelbock.

Bottled. The body is almost black with a small brownhhead. The aroma is salty with prunes and raisins and molasses. The taste is extremely full with more fruits and it tastes like its been lagered a long time.
Pours a near black from a bottle, tan head. Sweet, molassesy aroma, similar flavor but with roasted chestnuts and toasted pumpernickel. Pretty good beer.

APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso, con algunos destellos cafés y rojizos a contraluz. Corona de espuma color marfil de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas.

AROMA: dulce, notas a costra de pan, caramelo, azúcar morena, miel, frutos oscuros como dátiles y ciruelas, frutos secos como nueces y ligeramente plátano.

SABOR: similar al aroma, nuevamente las notas a costra de pan, caramelo, miel y azúcar morena es lo que destaca, atrás de ello quedan los frutos oscuros maduros como dátiles y ciruelas, en menor medida higos, frutos secos como nueces y cierto gusto a plátano muy ligero pero presente. En el retrogusto queda un amargor ligero, no astringente y que queda ligeramente la presencia de los sabores dulces y de frutos oscuros en boca.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio, mediana baja carbonatación. Muy ligera sensación calurosa en garganta al pasar el trago pero no es agresiva.

RESUMEN: excelente y compleja doppelbock

Average frothy tan head with medium retention.
Clear dark brown colour.
Aroma is molasses and brown sugar over a toasted malt backbone.
Low bitter, medium sweet, caramel.
Watery palate.

Bottle of... scent of plums figs and raisins. Dark brown with lingering carbonation and head. This taste awesome. Very complex beer with hints of chocolate,nuts, and a sweetness to this great beer. Smooth and silky on the palate. Overall this beer is the bomb.
Mämminen makumaailma, hurmaava tuoksu. Kaunis katsella ja nautinto maistella. Ja vielä raikas.

Very dark coppery brown, modest light brown head. Aroma is rich toffee and plums. Flavor is toffee and dark fruit, then some chocolate, mostly sweet but a little hop bite. Smooth carbonated mouthfeel. Nice, richly flavored beer.

500ml bottle. Clear, mahogany colour with ruby glimmer and average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Slightly toasty, dark malty aroma with a nuttily touch, notes of malt lozenge, some toffee. Taste is toasty and nuttily dark malty, notes of malt lozenge, some toffee, hints of raisin, well hidden alcohol; full body, soft palate, fine, prickling carbonation.

Dark brown with little brown head. Aroma is dark dried fruits, toffee, brown sugar, a bit roast, mocha. Taste is umami, a little salt, lots of brown sugar sweetness, a bit roast bitterness. Very rich and tasty. Long finish of more of the same, full body, low carbonation. A bit too heavy, even for a Doppelbock.

Pours reddish brown from the bottle and leaves a thick, creamy head that gently subsides. Aroma is a heady concoction of caramel, molasses, and dark fruit. Classic double bock. Overall sweet with chocolate notes and a light bitterness at the finish. Body is thick and lightly oily, but this is far from the heaviest bock Ive tried. Both Ayinger and Andechser are heavier I would say. No trace of the 7.4 ABV. Could go well with food but this one is a pleasure to sip on its own. Excellent.
500ml bottle. Dark brown. Short white head. Notes of plum, coffee, earth and toasted grains. Lovely mouthfeel, well poised, thick, not too sweet. Pretty much what I was hoping for.

Donker amberkleurig, crèmekleurige schuimkraag, vrij helder, veel koolzuurparels zichtbaar. 
Aroma: Moutig, brood/biscuit, geroosterd, donker gedroogd  fruitig, rozijnen, karamel, cacao. 
Smaak: Chocolade, geroosterde mouten, ook iets graan zoetig,  noten, hout, karamel, geroosterd brood, donker fruit, licht kruidig en een lichte hopbitter. 
Een kleine alcohol warmte is er ook maar mooi op de achtergrond. 
Medium body tot volle, zacht mondgevoel, afdronk is warm, kruidig en bitterzoet. 
Een klassieker en heerlijk!
This was yummy. From Genes. Woody, dried fruit, malt, minerally aroma. Some roastyness. Serving: Bottle
Klares dunkles rotbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, süßlich, Röstaromen, leicht fruchtig, Backpflaumen, Rosinen, etwas nussig, Schokolade.
Perfect appearance and palate. Coco and cereal aroma with some roasted nuts in the taste.
Heel aardig bokbier. Lichte smaak van koffie en cacao, mss iets van rozijnen. Warm en toch fris. Goed bier.

Pours ruby black with a thin head. Substantial cling. Aromas of milk chocolate, raisin and toasted bread. Flavors are roasty toasty malts, milk chocolate, raisin, and toasted bread. Creamy mouthfeel. Unbelievably smooth. Lovely!
Bottle 50cl. Small light brown head leaving. Clear dark red brown color. Aroma is oak, sherry, caramel, cookies. Taste is very sweet with wood and wine.

Robe ambrée couleur caramel, carbo moyenne, petit collet de fines bulles.
Aromes cereales, caramel, banane
Douce, presque onctueuse, tapisse le palais de notes caramelisés. Malgre ses saveurs sucrés, son equilibre general reste excelent avec laddition de notes epicés et terreuses.
Le savoir faire de Weihenstephaner est incontournable

Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and caramel. Little fruitiness as well. Dark to red colour with a small, lasting White head. Slightly transparent. Taste is sweet at first with lots of caramel and sugar, but gains a nice roasted accent. Also tones of liquorice and fruit in there. Alcohol sometimes peeks through in the taste. Aftertaste is roasted, slightly bitter but still with lots of caramel in it. It is however not as sticky as expected, considering the sweetness of the beer. Palate is nice and oily, just as it should be. Wonderful doppelbock, in short.

Bottle acquired from YantarCoast. Huge thanks. Deep ruby, tall dense beige head. Perfect lacing. The nose is bready, vinous, dried fruit, chocolate. Medium body. Oily. The taste is a copy of taste. Enormous smoothness. Light bitterness. Great pleasure drinking this.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

One pint, 0.9 fl. oz. bottle. Pours a dark copper wth a frothy pinpoint tan head that recedes quickly. Aroma: caramel, toast, fresh hazelnuts. Clean fermentation. Medium carbonation. Flavor: caramel, molasses, figs and dried plums. Alcohol warming. Grainy malt sweetness fades to a pleasing dry finish. Not heavy or cloying. Liquid bread; most satisfying.

Bottle. Dark amber, clear with medium sized white head. Lots of malty, caramel, bready notes mixed with dried fruits, medium sweet, really tasty. Medium to full body, creamy texture, moderate carbonation, quite dry in finish with medium herbal bitterness. Really good, classic doppelbock.

Bottle. Dark brown almost black a bit reddish color with medium tanned head. Aroma has dark fruits, raisins, malt and caramel. Taste is malty sweet with long quite sweet aftertaste. Flavors of malt, dark fruits, raisins, caramel. Very nice extremely smooth aftertaste that warms nicely.

Превосх& креплен& темное пиво, хороший винный аромат и сбаланс& вкус, прекрас& Алкогол& 7,4%, но его почти не чувству& и пьется пиво очень легко. В послевк& легкая сладост& ощущает& Срок годност& до 07.06.17. (Bottle 0,5/ 7,4%)
Excelente oscura, robusta, balanceada, mucha banana, chicle, aroma levemente ahumado. Mucha personalidad.
500ml bottle from averibeers.com. Dark brown with a low head. Aroma is dark, brown sugar, raisins. Taste - caramel, walnut confiture, with rather sweet aftertaste.

Draught at Biergarten 1040, Tel Aviv. Deep amber with beige head. The aroma has notes of prune, cookies, caramel and dried fruits, a bit creamy. Sweet flavor with lots of prune, dried fruits, caramel, raisin, some spiciness, bitterish, very complex. Medium to full-bodied. Excellent.

Aroma is quite nice, figs, licorice, dark fruit, malt, caramel, more in your face than Celebrator. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head, too dark to see through. Taste is figs, caramel, roasted malt, toffee, then a weird wheat, dark fruit, good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, weird wheat and dark fruit aftertaste. Overall, its real good but just a touch off point.
0,5l fles gedeeld met lion. BRuin met een volle creme kraag. best zoet met banaan, caramel en graan. Body is wel vol met een iets plakkende afdronk.
500ml bottle from aPivo.ru. Pours dark brown with a medium-sized beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, toffee, brown sugar, raisins. Taste is malty, caramel, vanilla, hint of alcohol.

Color marrón oscuro casi negro con capa de espuma de un blanco sucio (casi marrón), de más de un dedo de grosor, persistente, cremosa. Poca carbonatación. Cuerpo medio. Aroma a malta tostada y a alcohol (moderado). Sabor a malta tostada, profundo, y caramelo. Muy completa y disfrutable.

Bottled. pours fairly dark brown, borderline black, tan head. Aroma is vanilla, fig (very figgy), toffee, dark fruit, Id call it prune. Flavor is mostly some figs, toffee, prune, sugar. Really nice. I
This is a favorite beer. Wonderful blend of fruitiness and nuts. Always good.

0,5 L, served in dimpled mug. Poured a dark brown with a two finger tan head. 
Aroma: Banana, malt, caramel, coffee. Taste: Chocolate, overripe banana, coffee, vanilla, raisins, dates, bread, licorice, plums, burnt toffee. I was quite surprised by the sweet malty goodness of this brew. Very malty, sticky mouthfeel. No bitterness at all. Medium carbonation. A medium body with a very malty, sweet finish. Absolutely delicious doppelbock! I am falling in love with Weihenstephan...what a top class brewery! Prost!

500mL bottle. Pours a dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, hazelnut, and molasses. Taste is of caramel, malt, and wine with a light smokiness and a sweet molasses finish. Thick, creamy mouthfeel. Low carbonation.

Lukt: humle og malt.
Utseende: Mørk brun nesten sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt skum.
Smak: Frukter, rosin, malt og krydder.

Aus der Flasche getrunken. Gut im Glas anzuschauen. Aber geschmacklich nur guter Durchschnitt.

Flaska köpt i Freising hos Weihenstephaner. Tuff resa hit över ett överhettat München. Nåväl i humpen ska den. Mörk och fint skum. Underbar maltton med russin på toppen. Fin fyllighet i munnen. En stor dubbelbock !

16.9 bottle poured into mug. Nearly opaque dark brown appearance with beige lacing. Aromas of caramel, dark fruit, bread and malt.Taste is outstanding. Malt hits the tongue first, followed by very sweet caramel, maybe some roasty chocolate. Thick and creamy mouthfeel with plenty of carbonation.

0,5 l bottle
Appearance: Brown body with a high and dense head, with ok retention. Aroma: Bread, Caramel,plums and a hint of metal. abit faint off here and there. Don;t know what it is.
aste: Sweet, raisins, plum, caramel, grapes, toast, bread, with some bitterness and warming alcohol.
Low carbonation,above moderate body.

Backlog rating.

Bottle from Market Street Wine Shop, Uptown. Pours cola-like with a nice, large, soft tan head. Aroma is slightly smoky, earthy, with some leaves and grasses. Flavor is sweet smoke, peat, buried fruit. Tasty!
Bottle, 500 ml, shared with JFK10000. Pours brown, medium beige head. Sweetish, malty, caramel, bit of chocolate, dried fruit, nice. Medium bodied.

Cloudy brown colour with a perfect cremay head. Really nice in glass.
Roasted malts, caramel and sugar aroma, dark fruits.
Intense palate.
Very good doppelbock

the aroma of caramel malt, vanilla, toffee, brown sugar and molasses... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of burnt sugar, raisin, molasses, red wine and dark fruits... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Thick, dark brown to black beer with a creamy, beige head. 

Nose: Caramel malt, hazelnut, brown sugar, toffee, hops, raisin and prunes. 
Taste: Molasses, brown sugar, caramel in the taste to, rye bread, chocolate and hazelnut. 
Mouth: Full body. Thick and creamy. Sweet but bittersweet ending. 

This is sucha a good beer! I just love it!

Bottle from World Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is molasses, sorghum syrup, burnt sugar, maybe some boiled raisins. Taste is molasses and chewy malt candies. Rich and sweet but balanced especially in the finish that mellows out nicely.
Tap. Brown, clear, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, & long finish.

Bottle pour to cup. Roasted coffee, bitter chocolate, molasses aroma. Cola color, slightly copper. Rich molasses, burnt sugar, subtle anise. Well balanced body. Alcohol comes out more as it warms up. Amazing beer.
Enjoyed multiple times. Lots of toffee, dried fruit and cake character, yet very smooth and balanced, fairly dry finish. Love it, a true German classic!

0.5l bottle.

Brown with a hint of red. Tan head and little lacing. Little carbonation. Sweet taste.
Bottle at home. Pours pitch black with medium sized tanned head. Aroma has dark fruits, caramel malts and alcohol. Full bodied with lively carbonation. Heavy sweetness, light to medium bitterness.

Bottled. pours fairly dark brown, borderline black, tan head. Aroma is vanilla, fig (very figgy), toffee, dark fruit, Id call it prune. Flavor is wow, fig, toffee, prune, sugar. Really nice. I havent had this one in a while, and honestly, Im happy to revisit it. Really good doppelbock.
Nagy, tömör, bézs, tartós hab, sötétbarna szín. Édeskés, karamelles illat. Íze édes, karamelles, enyhe keserűvel és mérsékelt szénsavassággal. Testes, jól összerakott, finom sör.

Pours black, slightly translucent with a small tan head. Sweet malty aroma with plenty of brown sugar and syrup. Taste is very malty, lots of bread, quite sweet. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Pretty good beer.

Bottle. Thanks Davido. Nice Belgian almost aroma, nice maltiness, chocolate cocoa, ovaltine. Taste is more fruity, smooth, brown and rich. Wheaty. Definitive Dubbel character. (what on earth was that supposed to mean?)
Bottle @ home, split two ways. Murky brownish pour with a huge head. Notes of overripe fruits, bananas, caramel and some yeasty notes.

Bottle shared. Thanks Davido! To steal Neils words "like a Westmalle dubbel" on the nose and palate really. Slight Belgian yeast notes and cookie malts. Light chocolate. The Belgian character about it adds something a little more to it than most doppelbocks. Very enjoyable.

Delicious dopplebock that pours to an impressive tan head, releasing a full aroma of plums, caramel, freshly turned earth and alcohol. Finish is both dry and sweet and fruity. Another great beer from an excellent brewery.

Draft. Pours dark brown with light tan head. Raisin and plum aroma. Raisin and plum with caramel in the finish. Carbonation initially followed by syrupy finish. Complex flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur brune sombre, bonne mousse beige. Nez malt noir, caramel noir, note sucre orge. Gout malt noir et toasté, caramel noir avec sucre dorge et note fruitée voir candy. Corps assez onctueux. Fin caramel et malt dorge. Superbe doppelbock bien brune
How: bottle Appearance; deep amber with a medium tanned head. Aroma: wood, black sugar, prunes, stone fruits, dark caramel. Palate: medium body, soft carbonation.

Originally rated on 9/4/08. Korbinian pours a dark amber body, thin head with minimal lace left on the glass. Aroma of licorice, caramel malts, and earth. Flavor was similar but with hints of alcohol, and dried fruit, it was a little on the sweet side. Overall a fairly good beer, even though i liked it i probably wouldnt buy again.
Bottle at Weihenstephaner Berlin (great place). Pours dark with ruby hints. Smoke, toast, figs on the nose. More figs, treacle, port even on the taste. A fantastic end to a meal. Bloody lovely.

Aroma is very malty with a toasty aroma. Appearance is a dark brown with a nice fluffy off white head. Flavor has a great melanoidin malty flavor. Bitterness is medium low, but enough to prevent the beer from being cloying. Mouthfeel is medium-full with a medium-low level of carbonation. Overall, its a great tasting dopplebock. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Ten 22. Pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Malty and nice chocolate flavors. Mild sweetness.

Aroma is malty and rich. The color is dark and clean. The taste has an appealing roasted start that leads into a smokey malt flavor with a mild sweetness followed by a pleasant and slight bitter finish. Very well balanced. On of the better examples of a true German doppelbock.

Best beer Ive ever had. There may be better, but I havent had it. Enjoyed it cool, not cold, as thats how a dopplebock should be enjoyed. I just wish I could find more than a couple bottles at a time.

Bottle at home. Black-dark brown colour, with a medium brown head, that disappears quickly. Nose is nuts, roasted malts and slight booze. Taste is low bitterness. very light sweetness. Also some nutty notes. Medium carbonation. Nice!

Dark brown color. Average carbonation. Nice aroma of rich roasted caramel and chocolate. Quite sweet. Lightly hopped. Tasty creamy body. Nice coffee and chocolate note, light toast. Very smooth. Delicious.
Fast schwarz, klar. Geruch süß, malzig. Backfrüchte. Geschmack sehr süß, aber angenehm. Dazu Röstaromen.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and mug served showing a clarified, darkest brown color, with ruby highlighting, a frothy layer of tan head froth, and foamy cling to the dots & dashes of lacing. The aroma was malty and toasty, with dark fruit as prune, and caramel sweetness. A bit less than medium bodied, with somewhat low carbonation, the taste was similar to the nose, with less dark fruit exposure, low bitterness, and sweetness that seemed to build as it warmed. Classic, and fairly tasty Doppel, but would have appreciated more body, livelier carbonation, and maybe some dryness to the finish.

Bottle recived in the European swap thanks to SinH4. Pours dark brown with a meidum sized beige head with fine retention and lace. Nose has chalc, minerals, banana, sulphur. Flavour has sulphur, minerals, banana, light caramel, green plants, wood, light metallic notes. Medium/full body, oily texture, fine carbonation, medium sweet with low bitterness. Dry and light acidic finish with roasted malt. Not as rich and full as I hoped and the metallic thing bothers me.

Pours a clear dark brown with reddish hues. Head of foam is off white and shrinks to a ring around the glass. 

Caramel and roasted malt in the nose. Deep whiffs reveal a fruity and perhaps a nutty character. 

Caramel, chocolate, toffee, a slightly tart fruitiness comes to my taste buds. Working in unison to make for a smooth and delicious beer. I have no idea how fresh the bottle is but the taste and smoothness of the body has me hooked. Excellent.
One of the best beers I have had. Very complex taste and aromas, lovely dark brown color ... whats not to like.

Bottle 50cl. Dark brown with a tiny off white head. Aroma of brown sugar and malts. Somehow it reminds me of wood too. The taste is mildly sweet and develops into a friendly bittersweet experience. Some tickling on the tongue from Co2.

500ml bottle from Saveur-Biere.fr. Pours deep dark brown with luscious tan head. Aroma is burnt sugar, caramel, dark malt. Taste is a good rich bock taste, raisins, burnt brown sugar, caramel, nutty malts. No particular Weihenstephaner yeast notes. Nice.

An excellent German beer. Nice malty dewy beer with a good roasted back end. Alcohol not overpowering.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 50 cl. Deep red, clear with a medium light brown head. Malt, caramelized and dried fruit(rasin) aroma. Nice bitter taste with a sweet malt end.
Una doppelbock muy suave a pesar de su graduación y aspecto, hasta el menos cervecero apreciaría su sabor dulce y su cuerpo maltoso que no pasa indiferente.

Dark brown turbid apparently dense. Good crown cream and foam large amplitude but half expired, and the duration is leaving traces of lace on the glass in the first drinks. Predominate aromas of malt, caramel, toast and nuts such walnuts or hazelnuts. more hidden fruity notes are also appreciated. Pretty body and carbonation that fills the mouth completely. silky, powerful entry at the beginning, with malt flavor that fills the buds along with candy, all accompanied by hints of burnt sugar, nuts and even chocolate more subtly, ending with an aftertaste of character markedly dry, medium-length, leaving a refreshing mouthfeel, without actually be cloying. perceptible alcohol almost all the time, makes an appearance in perspective.
Bottle - dark brown beer, small head. Texture is smooth, creamy. Taste is complex. Aromas of preserved plums, liqourice, dark wood ... Ending is malty, sweet, dry. Good.

500ml bottle. Have only recently tried beer from this brewery and am glad I have. This has to rank right up there with Celebrator. Only I detected a hint of cocoa, which was nice. This is a fine doppelbock which Ill be buying again.

Bottle - Clear brown colour, medium tan head, good retention and lacing. Nice sweetish aromas of caramel, milk chocolate, dried fruits, dates and some honey. Taste is sweet caramel with dried plum and brown sugar, breadcrust, some cocoa notes, no hop bitterness. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, smooth texture, sweet finish. Great doppelbock.

Bottle poured into a 19oz. pilsner glass. Great dark fruit and sugary malt aroma, good looking dopplebock brown. Produced a good but rapidly disappearing head. This is a smooth, robust, well balanced and easy drinking dopplebock. Lightly carbonated and a bit on the sweet side. Chocolaty, full bodied and creamy, it almost tastes like there is no alcohol at all included. Very good example of the style.
Chestnut brown color with cream-coloured head. Aroma of sweet malt and caramel. Taste caramel, Candy Sugar, dried fruit and Smooth.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2016 Bottle 500ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours a deep dark ruby with a tanned, dense, frothy had that was mostly lasting. Aroma is of dusty milk chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, oats, wholemeal bread, blueberries with light earthy/spice notes in the background. Flavour is sweet and amazingly smooth with an extremely light bitterness, chocolate malt balls (Whoppers), chewy caramel, roasted barley, fruit and nut toast, dried currants and a touch of allspice. Medium bodied with medium carbonation, a chewy texture and a long, progressive finish. Alcohol content is deceptively well hidden!

Small frothy light brown head. Fair lacing. Mostly diminishing. Murky reddish-brown thick body Aroma: moderate malt, alcohol, caramel, port ruby. Initial flavor: moderate sweet. Final flavor: heavy sweet (malt, caramel, nutty); long duration. Palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, very light astringent finish. Lacks balance. Little coffee in the background. 40s usd 4.5
Very dark beer, red tinges coffee coloured head sticks around. Smoky, sweet caramel aroma, quite light. Sour wheat with a caramel smoke touch. Cloying and smokey on the aftertaste.

Aroma: Strong bread with caramel notes, also a lot of dried plum and raisins, could be more intensive, light hoppy metal. Appearance: Very dark brown with ruby reflections, head is high, dense. Taste: Sweet, dense, raisins, plum, caramel, grapes, toast, bread, very very light alcohol - cognac like. Palate: Finish is sweet, carbonation is low, body is high.

Bottle as a gift from Helsinki. BB 21.12.16. Pours ruby brown with a thick light beige head. The aroma is malty sweet, nutty and caramelly, dried fruits and a bit of roast. Tastes sweet, even surprisingly so, I get notes of dark dried fruits, somewhat caramelised sugar, and at points, the hinting presence of alcohol. Roasty and perhaps even chocolaty. Not too deep or multilayered though. Very soft and smooth mouthfeel, carbonisation modest. Kind of thin. Overall a very well done beer, and enjoyable while tucked in a warm blanket with -15*C outside.
Aroma of sweet malt. Taste is sweet and malty with a well balanced bitterness that makes it almost sour. Im not an expert on doppels, but i like this one a lot!

Cola dark, dark beige head. Mildly roasted malts on the nose. Oily mouth feel which is really nice. Sweet but not too sweet (Id prefer just a bit more dry). A little liquorice and chocolate. Overall quite nice.

500 ml bottle. Pours a ruby reddish brown with a resilient beige head. Aroma is caramel, sweet, roast and fruity. Flavor is burnt caramel, big time toffee, overripe fruits. Finish is roast, some coffee notes and fruit. Medium to full body, soft mouthfeel and weak to average carbonation.
Mycket mörkt rödbrun. Doftar kokta grönsaker, pumpa och katringplommon. Söt smak med torkad frukt, mörk limpa och aningen sälta. En riktigt god dubbelbock. De Klomp 2015-10-03
Thuis, enorme zwarte paal van een fles om alleen weg te werken. Zacht stevig kastanje/geroosterd. Backlog from 2015/11/26.
From a bottle. Pours deep dark brown with a thin head, delicious and smooth, lovely roasted flavours and no hint of the alcohol. Good stuff.
Bottle from Consumers Beverages. Pours a nice brown with an off whitehead that dies to a ring. Nose is sweet and toasty. Tastes sweet, toasty, a touch bitter. Good flavour.

Dark ruby clear color with foam layer. The smell has sweet raisins flavors and a foreshadowing of alcohol. The taste is thick and gooey, with a decent fruitiness. Also is plays in the same sweetness league as crystal sugar. The aftertaste is calm and light fruity.
Bottle. Not my style. Color is brown to black with generous white to yellow persistent head. Nose is smoke, caramel and maybe honey. Taste is honey and sweet a little bit licorice.
Aroma of raisins, plums, and aged toffee. Flavors of caramel, rumcake, dates and apricots. Finishes round and smooth. Hides the abv quite well. A good warmer in the winter for sure.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. A nice and malty Bock. Nuts, quite rich. A good brew, but not outstanding.

Deep brown colour, reddish tones to the light. Off white big head, great lace.Smell of chocolate, toasted, coffee, prunes, dried fruits. Medium to full body, compact creamy palate. Taste of dried fruits, chocolate, caramel. Complex.And great.
bottle, kindly donated by pivnizub! Brown with an off-white to beige head. Full-bodied, intensively malty with roasty flavours, hints of chocolate and dried fruit.
Dark brown with nice white head. Musty barnyard funk smell. Smooth taste and nice funk and brown sugar a little dark fruit. Nice. Enjoyed.

Does Weihenstephaner make any bad Beers? Apparently not. 
This is a classic and delicious example of a Dobbelbock.
Malt bomb par excellance, with nice fruitiness and slight bitterness to balance everything out. One of my favorite German beers at the moment.

Tomada de Grifo en Cerveceria Kraken.Espuma blanca, cerveza marrón oscuro.7.4° que están bien equilibrados.Fácil de beber, agradable y potente a la vez.Aromas a lúpulo y tostados.Sabor combinado de amargos y dulces.Muy agradable de beber.Cervezon Alemán duppel bock

0,5 l NRW-Flasche aus der Brauerei in Weihenstephan. Karamell- braun, trüb, weniger Kohlensäure mit kleinem Schaumfilm, schwaches lacing. In der Nase habe ich Weizen, eher süßliche Karamellnoten. Im Geschmack malzig, karamellig, Waldbeeren, reife Pflaumen, leichte Röstaromen, wenig bitter. All diese Aromen, aber von keinem zu viel! Hohe drinkability
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 brown, clear, tan foam, bitter, light sweetness, full body, thick feel, long finish. Complex aroma. One of the very best Doppelbocks out there.

Bottle. Pours like cola - dark brown, ruby hue and a bubbly head. Aroma is rich dark fruits, raisin, grape and plum. Taste is the same - slightly sweet raisin and plum, a balanced finish. Not quite Ayinger, but a really nice doppelbock.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 nice brew; thought I had rated before; Dammit; I am going to drink more germans. this is near the top but not quite there for a great style. thankfully this is not overly sweet - nice malt, toffee, brown sugar mix. easy to drink...
I am no Lager man but hats off to this beer.Dark malty strong taste with the alcohol just appearing.Loved the head and its "endurance". Great beer.
21.11.15-0,33 Flasche( gekauft AH NL!) -Bocksampling mit Ricardo + Verena, braun mit geringer beiger Krone - Malzig, Karamell, Rosine, kaum Bitterkeit, gering karbonisiert. Guter Doppelbock.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a 500ml bottleon 21/11/2015. Pours a very dark amber/chesnut, with a biggish light tan head. The nose is super malty - rye bread, caramel, toffee, molasses. The flavour has all the features of the aroma, along with lashings of Christmas cake. This is just an absolute sweet malt bomb, with bugger all bitterness . The palate is creamy and chewy and the carbonation is soft. Very nice.

Bottle 0.5l from bro Vlada ciaoooo.Taste with cika Boban and cika Alberto left in Vranovo Serbia. 25.09.2015.Pour it clear dark brown color with small white head.Aroma tart, burned sugar.Taste of ?erbet, burned sugar, spices, vanilla and some nuts.

Bottle pour into pint glass from Discount Downtown Beverage, Dover, NH. Aroma is initially sweet yeastiness (like champagne) from the head but, once that dissipates, rich bread, caramel/vanilla/molasses, with some fruit. Appearance is clear, dark ruby red with decent sparkle, finger-width white foam head and minimal lacing. Taste is moderately sweet molasses/caramel/toffee with some alcohol. Palate is medium bodied with average texture, lively carbonation and long sweet finish. Overall, this is very solid and well crafted all around.
500 ml bottle at home. Very few head, low carbonation. With a similar taste like Brand Bock and other strong bock beer.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2016 Fles 500 ml. gekocht bij speciaalbierpakket.nl, uitgeschonken in Weihenstephan bierglas. Tht. 08/12/2015. Helder donker kastanjebruin bier met een robijnrode gloed, beige romige schuimkraag, die na verloop van tijd wel inzakt. Prachtig aroma, heel moutig en veel gedroogd fruit als rozijnen, pruimen verder ook veel nootachtige elementen in het aroma. Walnoot, hazelnoot, chocoladecake, koffie en aardachtige tonen. Werkelijk een indrukwekkend aroma deze Duitse Doppelbock. Het mondgevoel is zacht fluwelig met een lichte carbonatie, alcohol van 7,4% is nauwelijks waarneembaar, eigenlijk volledig verborgen. Wel een opvallend complex smaakpallet met zeer moutige en granige tonen. Verder rozijnen, pruimen, gebakken banaan, chocolade en een iets kruidige en aardachtige afdronk. Een voortreffelijk bier, voorlopig zelfs nog beter dan de Schneider Aventinus. Wel met de notitie dat deze fles extra lang was doorgerijpt. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 500ml. A dark chestnut beer with a medium size brown head. Aroma is of firewood, roasted malt, spices and vanilla. Taste is moderately bitter and low on alcohol. Some carbonation and astringency. Aftertaste is of roasted malt and wood with an earthy finish.

Bottle, 500ml. Clear auburn with a frothy to minimal brown head. Sweet aromas of roasted caramel, dried fruits. Medium bodied with moderate to flat carbonation. Smooth, earthy malt character with a somewhat flat finish.

On Tap. @Deutschland, Oviedo. 02/11/2015
Color marrón oscuro, sabor dulce, caramelo, maltas tostadas.buen cuerpo.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 In my opinion, it is a good doppel bock. I prefer this one instead of the andecks, but it is just a personal opinion. The taste is not so strong with a classical taste of ginger bread and not too smocked. The color and the carbonation are classical for this beer.

Très déçu.
Le nez est caramelisé mais très faible.
En bouche, le caramel "Doppelbock" (aux arômes sirop dérable et sauce soja) est présent ainsi que la levure typique weihenstephan. Le problème est que dune part les deux se marient mal (plutôt écoeurant) et dautre part, cette bière a très peu de corps, est très aqueuse et finalement assez pauvre...
Orientez vous vers la ayinger celebrator ou la andechs Doppelbock.

Look; tan top, dark brown-ruby clear body. Aroma; leaves, dark malts, sweet dark bread, cardamom, clove, yeast, nuts, chocolate. Taste; dark malts, sweet malts, cocoa, choco-liquorice, leaves, grass - leading to a malty finish with hops, leaves and nuts. On palate good body. Overall; very tasty brew. Bottle. Tanned huge head. Clear dark brown. Strong, sweet malts, raisins, bit sour and salty, liqourice, herbs.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Draught @ Bierprofessor, Eindhoven. Chestnut brown, offwhite head. Roasted malts, liquorice, bitter finish. Medium carbonation and body.
Bottle, pours dark brown with abeige head. Caramel, cough syrup, cherries, banana cream, chocolate, raisins, dark bread. Creamy, bittersweet, average carbonation, full body. Very nice.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2016

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, dark fruit, berries, chocolate, bread and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Clear/hazy red/dark brown beer with a medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, fruit, dark fruit, berries and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread and roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. What a rich sweetness with so much going on. A really rustic and authentic flavour. The appearance could have been much more opaque, but every other aspect of this beer is great.

Dunkelbraun, leicht rötlich schimmernd mit weißem Schaum. Tolle süße Malzaromen, die leicht röstig und rauchig sind: getrocknete Früchte, dunkle Schokolade, Brot, Sirup. 
Ein stimmiges, gehaltvolles Bier. Empfehlung!

The beer has a very nice apearence. The color is a dark red brown and the beer is clear. The color is beautifully dark. The beer forms a creamy soft foam. The foam has a nice almond color. The beer smells really good. I smell caramel, almond, syrup, a little roast. All beautiful dark bitter sweet aromas. There is also some fruit. The beer smells perfect for an autumn day, and it tastes perfect to. The beer is very warming. I taste also the same strong bitter flavors as there are in the smell. There is a bitter sweet taste. I mostly taste a delicious roast flavor. There is also caramel and syrup, all very nice. The sweet syrup is a perfect match for the bitter roast flavor.

Dark brown reddish color, medium beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, dark dried fruits, chocolate, bread and hint of sweet spices. Sweet and lightly dry taste has similar notes, mildly bitter finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Very enjoyable dark beer.

500ml bottle pours dark reddish chestnut brown with light red edges and a finger of head. Nose is dark fruity bread, plum, dark grain, grape. Taste is creamy, medium body, smooth, touch of nutty roast, dark bread, plum, dark fruits, toast. Finishes medium bitterness, dark malty sweetness, corn flakes, toasty dark fruit, bread, plum, crust. Delish.

Bottled. Very dark red color with big off-white head. Sweet nose. Aroma is roast, licorice, malts, roast and dried plumt. Flavour is sweet, overly sweet, hops, alcohol, licorace and plum. Finishes with sirupy mouthfeel. Changes a lot with temperature. OK, but far from perfection.

Beautiful pour, cola color, gentle carbo, dense head. A: sweet malts, cola, grass note, faint hint of cherry and licorice. Ok. T: taste is much more mature. Starts sweet, vanilla, sweet malts, with full, velvet smooth mouthfeel. Hearty bitter development with dark chocolate, gentle boozy touch, reminds a bit of cough syrup. Aftertaste is nutty, roasted malts. Great tasting beer.

Couleur brune sombre, bonne mousse beige. Nez malt noir, caramel noir, note sucre orge. Gout malt noir et toasté, caramel noir avec sucre dorge et note fruitée voir candy. Corps assez onctueux. Fin caramel et malt dorge. Superbe doppelbock bien brune
Pours with a nice head and dark red/brown colour. Very heavy malty aroma and dark caramel. Very warming and one of the best doppelbocks Ive tasted.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe - Deep cola brown body with big light tan head. Nose kicks with banana, then sweet malt, caramel, and a bit chocolate. Taste is malty, lots of caramel notes, plum and a mocha undertone. Complex and tasty. Nice.
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 Alkoi hyvin. Lopuksi tuli vähän liikaa viinaa. Väri hyvä. Vaahto hyvä. Perusmaku hyvä. Meni päähänkin. On tämä lopulta hyvä.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 50cl botlle split with a friend. Pours a dark brown/reddish colour with a small off-white head. Aroma?s of malts and chocolate and sourness of soysauce. Taste has malty sweetness to it with notes of chocolate, ripe fruits, caramel and brown sugar. Low carbonation with a creamy-like and sticky texture
Bottle. Roasted malts, dried fruits, caramel and wood. Moderate to high sweetness and mild bitterness. Complex.

Very good bock. A bit too sweet for my taste but still delicious. Nice deep brown with just enough carbonation. Flavor is complex: malt sweetness, overripe fruit, chocolate, burned malt. Sticky toffee and sirrupy in a good way. Powerful.

500ml bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Dark brown, quite full body. Aroma is sweet malt with a little chocolate. The taste adds caramel, smoke and even a hint of licorice. Palate is a lovely combination of cream and stickiness. Excellent Doppelbock, have to try it again soon!

500ml  This Kraut brew lifts , full on dark malt complexity . Soy sauce covered chocolate ,earthy hops, treacly  roasted malt,  woody  dryness . This beer squeezes the palate and then kisses it. Fucken good !
roasty, basement aromas, rotten eggs, smoke, tobacco, brown, clear, minimal head, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish.

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 3rd October 2015 and poured into a Riedel weizen glass. It poured a clear very dark brown colour with hints of ruby and a one finger chestnut coloured head that dissipated quite quickly with only light spotty lacing. Aromas are malty, treacle, brown sugar, milk chocolate and hints of vanilla. Taste was similar to the aromas, theres malt, burnt sugar, brown sugar, caramel, chocolate and a hint of dark fruit like prune. Creamy, velvety, mid to full bodied with low carbonation. Overall a very nice doppelbock from a great brewer. Just falls behind Celebrator in my book, but definitely something Id drink again.

Pours slightly reddish dark brown with a big, dense white head. The aroma features malty, a bit toasty elements: bread, bisquit, nuts. Taste is a bit sweeter than the aroma suggested; it adds caramel and dark fruitiness to malty features such as bread and rye pudding. Maltiness lasts well until the drying finish. No traces of hops appear. The palate is medium-bodied and smooth with low to average carbonation. Solid, sweetish doppelbock.

Molasses, wood and dark sugar aromas. Crystal clear medium dark brown body that breaks into deep ruby and orange colors under strong light. Full molasses taste hits on the sip but its light, not heavy. Vanilla, cream, dark chocolate and charred wood all come next along with a very slight vegetal taste and bitterness which is a good balance to the sweetness. Finishes lightly sweet with chocolate and woody flavors. Perfect balance in flavors and texture, an excellent Dopplebock.

On tap at the braustuberl. Deep dark red/brown mahogany color, clear, short thick creamy beige head, malty smell. Aroma of syrup, malt, roasted malts, biscuits,some fruity tones (cherry), carmael, candy sugar. Sweet taste with milk-chocolate notes. Body is full, creamy texture, low carbonation, sticky sugary finish. Well hidden alcohol. This one seems to be a sugarish dunkel to me. Good as dessert, i guess.

Loads of sweet malts (crystal malt?) Dark copper colored with small beige head.Very sweet and malty, a lip smacking bit of stickiness, nice feel with just the right amount of carbonation for the style. Quality stuff!

Reddish colour with a tan head, aroma is roasted malt, caramel and slightly alcohol. Flavor is pretty much the same with more sweetness out. Low carbonation and medium to full body with a sweet finish.

Pours clear brown with small off-white head. Aroma is heavy malty, chocolate, hint of coffee, toast, grass, resin, banana, light hoppy. Medium to heavy sweet, light bitter, hint of smoke and coffee in the average duration aftertaste. Lovely palate, medium to full body, creamy palate, soft carbonation.

Fra flaske på Mi2, Cardinal aug-15: mørkebrun med flott beige skum som varer. Herlig duft av ferske bakervarer, rosiner og et rødt bær eller to. "Som å komme inn i et tysk bakeri" sier Sigmund og sukker fornøyd ved siden av meg. Flott tekstur, kompleksitet og med et balansert smaksinntrykk, den blir ikke for søt. Lys sjokolade med bærfyll. Kan umulig være bra for kolesterolnivået, men jeg tar allikevel noen lange slurker.

Shared bottle at Mandag i annen, Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours dark brown with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, dark bread, malt, raisins, marzipan. Tastes very sweet, with some dark dried fruit sweetness. Almost no hop bitterness.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 31.08.15. Ebony. Fine beige head. Aroma of dark malt, brittle and dark caramel. Similar taste, also with chocolate. A hint of berries. Complex. Very good!

-Features both sweet and roasty flavours
-caramel,toffee,big plum strawberry,coffee,dates,raisins
-slight chocolate
-middling carbonation
-sweet-roasty,bready,malty finish

simply one of the best bocks out there

Dark brown colour and beige head on top. Smallish lacing sticks to the glass. Aroma has caramel malts, syrup, cocoa and some berries. Taste is quite sweet and malty. Caramel and syrup with some dark chocolate also. Really thick body and medium carbonation makes this really bold beer. Really enjoyed this one.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 Mostly black color, little bit red with nice beige head. Intense aroma of malts, bread, hint of toffee and chocolate. Taste is sweet and smooth, mixture of caramel, bread,malts, little toffee and syrup. Nice roasted malts aftertaste with alcohol warm. Amazing beer!
Nice dark red color. Sweet, chocolate aroma, bit of cherry. Smooth. Really enjoyable.
Bottle 50 CL. Pours dark reddish with big brown foamy head. Notes of caramel, fudge, toffee, roasted nuts. Well rounded easy drinkable stuff. Good.- beerbasher

Beautiful dark brown-black color with amber highlight and a big beige head. Aroma is malty-bready, but with bitter chocolate and hints of coffee. The taste is an absolute surprise, with cherries and other fruits coming through, really more cherries than prune, bitter chocolate, nuts, pleasant complex finish. Low carbonation, full body, no booze. Enormously smooth-silky mouthfeel. I love Weihenstephans Weizen products and am not convinced by their Helles, so I was not sure what to expect, but damn, this is an excellent Doppelbock with a great balance and perfect drinkability. Korbinian absolutely plays in one league with Celebrator and Andechser.
Unsurprisingly excellent. Dark brown with foamy latte coloured head. Medium body. Prunes, dried fruit, tea and berries all in there, with a strong malt base.

As a lover of Belgian beer, as long as I enjoy a German with certain reservations, especially with a pint of beer that I find excessive. German styles this is one of my favorites and this beer is a fantastic example. A pleasure.
Ich hatte etwas mehr Hoffnung in den Korbinian gesetzt, der mit Weizen und etwas Rosinen glänzt. Ein bisschen muffig, etwas fruchtig, ganz ok.

Bottle from Dilo in Bochum. The beer has got a deep dark brown colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of malt, barley and caramel. Taste of malt, barley, dark bread, dried fruits, caramel, fruits. Intense finish.

A red so dark its almost black, with a fine tan head. Aromas of toasted caramel and prunes, with a touch of smoke. Rich-bodied and seriously roasty, dry-bitterness that almost but not quite balances the sweetness. Burnt toffee and a hint of gravy. Liquorice, toffee and a herbal bitterness in the finish.

Botella. Color rojizo muy oscuro.
Aroma no muy destacado, predominando cereal tostado y pasas.
En boca gran presencia de caramelo. Resulta muy cremosa con un final ligeramente amargo. Bastante equilibrada.
El medio litro ha caído rápido...

500 ml bottle
Reddish brown clear beer with blonde head with lacing. Aroma has creamy toffeey and molassey sweetness with light roastiness and some nuts. Flavor is sweet with toffee, lightly roasted, herbal and nutty. Palate is medium full with quite heavy carbonation. Finish has mild bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet with toffee and molasses, as well as lightly roasted and herbally bitter. Quite OK for the style.
Brown with white head. Toffee, floral and vanilla. Smooth palate. Sweet, spicy and sticky finish. Overall: Excellent! Smooth and well made.

Marrom escura, espuma cremosa bege de média formação e duração. Aroma maltado achocolatado, ameixa, caramelo torrado, álcool perceptível. Paladar de dulçor médio, novamente ameixa, cereja escura, licoroso. Corpo oleoso, carbonatação leve ideal. Aftertaste duradouro, licoroso, alcoólico, adocicado, maltes torrados, framboesa, muito bom.

Aroma has a sweetness - hint of plum. Pours chocolate brown with a cream head. Teriffic lacing. Flavor is sweet malt, caramel, slight chocolate. Creamy texture. This sets the bar for what I expect a dopplebock to be.

Great dopplebock. Sweet and malty without being too sweet. Really, really well balanced. Initial aroma is strongly banana as a wheat beer should. Two fingers of foam, which then suppresses the aroma. Plenty of flavours and mostly caramel but a variety of other tastes are present. Hard to find in Brisbane, but worth the hunt on a cold winters night. Perfect with any toffee flavoured desert like sticky date pudding.
Draught @ Waterfront Ale House. Dark brown with small creamy beige head, caramel aroma, sweetish mocha taste, balanced full body, longish mocha finish. Very suave and sophisticated brew.

Bottle from Taniguchi served in a dimpled mug. It pours a deep reddish brown with a malty sweet aroma giving me plum notes. Medium bodied with a great mild malt character that gives a bitter nutty caramel flavor. A satisfyingly smooth brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One pint, 0.9 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured clear, brown, nice abundant tan head, and nice lacing all over the glass. Aroma of bread, malts and some dark fruit. Taste is malty, lots of caramel notes, plum and some grassy notes. A lot more crispier than I expected. Very drinkable, very enjoyable, very good.
500ml bottle. Dark brown color with light beige head. Roasted malty aroma, caramel, bready, fruity. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. almost medium oily body with soft carbonation

Bottle 50cl. Clear deep amber brown, good frothy beige head, diminishes slowly, fair lacing; sweet malt aroma, dried dark fruits, roasted, brown sugar, licorice; smooth taste, light heavy sweey, slighly bitter, dried fruit, toffee, spicy notes; full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste bittersweet, roasted, bit woody, light spices, light chocolate notes, bit alcohol; an excellent full-bodied and smooth Doppelbock.

Bonito color caramelo oscuro con un dedo de espuma efervescente. Aroma a caramelo, café y ciruela. En boca, tono seco y amargo a café predominante, más el resto de matices del aroma. Buen cuerpo y efervescencia alta. Equilibrada y notable.

Bottle from VP Bestillingsutvalg enjoyed at home
Dark brown, big tanned head. Smell of dark malts, dark fruits, prunes, chocolate and caramel. Medium sweet, dark fruits, prunes, chcoclate, hints of toast and caramel, nicy malty flavors, Moderate bitter finish. Nice balanced off, not too sweet. Excellent doppelbock

Deep black Amber color, a lot like a cola. Sweet malty aroma with maybe a little fruit. The taste comes on strong like a doppelbock should, but doesn't hang around to singe the tastebuds. It can't be overstated how smooth and palatable this beer is. One bottle in and this is already one of my favorites. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark brown colour with beige head. Malt, caramel, toffee, dried fruits aroma. Sweet, caramel, malt, toffee, dried fruits taste. MEdium to full body. Really good.

0,5L Bottle bought in a random beershop in Berlin - Pours a dark, dark brown color with a mahogany head. Aroma has sweet malts, licorice, chocolate, candied brown sugar, dark fruits and spices. Flavor is quite good and well balanced. The flavor/palate is slightly dusty with flavors of dark roasty malts, bread, licorice, spicy sugar, vanilla and cinnamon. This was quite a nice experience, and i would definately recommend this to any lovers of doppelbocks!

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours dark brown with a very red hue. Grey to light brown head, which quickly settles into a few spots on top of the beer. Heavy caramel and malt nose. Quite sweet. Candy, sugar, brown sugar, malt, caramel, cellar and wort flavours. Medium plus body. Medium to low carbonation. Good.
Dark reddish brown with a medium tan head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, fruit caramel and sweetness. Medium to full body with a nice balanced finish.

Horehound candy color with ruby glints in the light. A huge caramel colored head forms and performs relatively well. A lot of caramel, some prune fruitiness, and quick notes of hard candy on the nose. Full body, light richness, and mild carbonation. A bit of a smoky quality interacts with the caramel and fruit for a bolder gestalt.

Pours dark, almost black, with abundant tan head.
Low intensity aromas: toast, coffee, iron.
Soft and light, watery and medium lasting. Nice but dull. Apt to drink gallons in a row.

Out of bottle. Despite the bottle being a bit too cold, a very promising and pleasant aroma is there. Pours clear dark with small head. Taste is absolutely great, super-smooth, creamy. It is just so well balanced. My favorite double bock so far.
Wow

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 Opaque dark brown. Minimally sized beige head. Pleasantly potent aroma containing notes of chocolate, caramel, malt, dried berries and licorice. Full bodied, silky smooth, and creamy. Absolutely delectable combination of flavours consisting of chocolate, roast, caramel, malt, cherry, licorice, alcohol, and vanilla. Amazingly complex beer.

Wow. No faults here. Perhaps its too smooth? This miracle beverage pours very deep, pretty mahogany with thin off-white top. The aromas of plum, molasses, and malty goodness are about as good as it gets. Almost dont want to drink it. Yeah right...the same delightful notes carry through into the flavors. The mouthfeel is creamy and perfectly under-carbonated. I could drink this by the gallons. My only conceivable complaint? Could be a little stronger. But, thats silly.

Dark brown with orange highlights. Nose of chocolate& dark fruits. On the palate figs more chocolate earth with an autumnal sous bois quality. Mealy and rich but not at all overly sweet or heavy. Balanced and supple. Gorgeously beautiful. Love it.
Very malt heavy, as to be expected for the style. Flavors of wood, caramel, a small hint of smoke, and coffee. Good beer.

Dark brown with ruby hue, small but lasting beige creamy head. Aroma is of caramel malt, toffee, toasted bread, bready yeast. Taste is moderate sweet caramel, toffee, nuts, some dark fruit, toast, roasted and sweet bready finish. Alcohol very well hidden, a small amount of acidity in the nose and less in the taste. Medium to full bodied, bit creamy, medium carbonation.
UPDATED: OCT 26, 2015 O man, this is one hell of a beer. Malty, rye with Caramel, molasses and licorice in a balance that?s just delicious. Rich, luscious sweet, but not too much. Great!
Bottle from Beer Shop Malvern. Roasted, high ABV, earthy and minty malts totally dominate here. Excellent dynamic. Dark fruit, caramel and roasted barley included. Pretty good stuff.
Color pardo. Espuma media de color carton. Sabor a regaliz y maltas tostadas. Cuerpo medio.

0,5 l bottle from bier-deluxe, best before 28/10/2015. Clear, very dark ruby with a medium large, frothy, very slowly diminishing, tan head. Intense aroma of raisins, prunes, molasses and slight hints of chocolate. Sweetish taste of raisins, prunes and molasses, followed by even more sweetness towards the finish. Medium long, chocolatey, minimally bitter finish with a pleasant, gentle alcoholic and warming note. Full body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice sipper, but not as special as expected. Still very tasty and pleasant on the palate, but not overly complex.

Pour- dark amber with an light tan two finger head.Nose - Sweet dark caramelized sugar, roasted malts, molasses, fresh dark bread. Taste - very full and smooth. Dark roasted malt, molasses, chocolate, leaving a light, sweet coating on the palate. Overall excellent Doppelbock. Will buy again!
Bottle. Pours into a stein with a frothy dark head, aroma is malty, toffee, sweet, nutty. Taste is malty, caramel, sweet, nuts, gentle carbonation. Very nice

Dark brown colour with small head. Aroma of dark fruits, bananas, hebs, roasted malts. Taste of hops, dark fruits, bananas, roasted malts. Nice malty aftertaste which is very well balanced. Overall one of the best examples of this style.

Brown/ dark red color pour. Off white head rose and retreated to a ring and left behind spotty lacing. Aroma was of molasses, honey, malts, and roast. Taste was of molasses, burnt sugar, roast, and a caramel sweetness. Mild carbonation with a somewhat creamy mouthfeel. Overall, a very good beer, but, the dopplebock style never really works for me.

Pours deep amber-black from bottle with generous tan head. Malty aroma with hints of chocolate, plums, roasted barley. Tastes sweet, syrupy, toasty with notes of anise; finishes with strong bitterness that brings you back for the next sip. Full bodied, particularly for a lager with light carbonation. A nearly perfect production lager IMHO. Not for mass consumption but great with meals. Beer doesnt get much better than this.

500ml bottle thanks to Kyotolefty for sharing this. Pours out a dark brown with some ruby highlights a small head sitting on top. Nose is pit fruit nuttiness a touch of roast and a nice bread. Taste is more of the light roast malts some spice and the fruit.

A good brew and only 2.99. Aroma is dried fruits, plums, heavy malts, dark bread. Flavor is thick with plums, raisins, bread, caramel. Dark brown color. Not much to say except its very nicely done, well priced and is sure to be a crowd pleaser of a beer.

Flaska från Saveur-bier. Coca cola färgad, klar, cm-högt krämigt skum som snart försvinner. Söt brödig doft. Inte riktigt den krämiga munkänsla de bästa dubbelbockarna har. Men en fin smakbild med många nyanser. Massor av brödig malt i smaken men också lite torv, rostat bröd, fudge, lite anis och torkad frukt. Väldigt lätt beska. Välavvägt och mycket trevligt.

500 ml bottle, one year old.
Dark brown body, with some red reflections and a medium, creamy, light beige head.
Rich aroma of dried fruits, almond, dark berries, bread, some cherry, slight alcohol.
Taste with about the same aromas, although very malty, fortunately not too sweet, but also not as rich as the nose.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes fruity, roasty, bready.

Nice one. Not very complex, but really well balanced, not too sweet. Overall not among my faviourite Doppelbock beers, but still a great example of the style.

Bottle from beer club. Pours dark brown with a good tan head. Aroma roasted malt and taste of chocolate and nuts. Also, just a little sweetness that lingers on the pallet. Really enjoyed this one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Leżakowane do końca terminu przydatności. Kolor miedzi, piana średnia. Zapach mieszanka ciemnego słódu, karmelu, śliwki i przypraw. Smak jest zrównoważone pomiędzy słodkim i nutami przypiekanymi.

This dunkel was unremarkable. It is a strong beer, yes, but a great beer, no. The aroma revealed something slightly off, reminiscent of bret. The taste was well balanced between malt and bitter but the body was a bit less than I anticipated from the visual and olfactory clues. I was a little disappointed overall.

Pours dark brown with reddish highlights. Thick beige head dissipates quickly.
Aroma is malt, nuts, roast. On the palate, theres malt, malt and more malt, with bread, toffee, nuts, roast. Its not a particularly complex range, but it works well. A medium body and smooth carbonation, with the alcohol very subdued, makes this a very easy drinking doppel bock.

Big boozy and malty, sweet, caramel, toffee, syrup aroma. Nice color and head. Flavor is roast, brown sugar, chocolate. A little more subdued than the aroma anticipated, but really tasty, and not too sweet. Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Good doppelbock. Slightly boozy, slightly sweet, lots of flavor hanging out on the palate. Roasted nuts a sticky caramel. Not the best doppelbock Ive ever had, but certainly a great example of the style.

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma has hints of leather, vanilla, sultanas and alcohol. Body is medium and carbonation low. Taste is chocolate malts, coffee, sugary and vanilla. First go at a doppelbock. Really enjoyed
One of the best beers I have ever had. An excellent Dopplebock and it nails every category: Aroma, Appearance, Taste, Palate and the Overall.

Pour out of 500 mL bottle, dark reddish brown pour with off white head, aroma brought dark fruit, caramel, toffee, toasted bread, hints of red fruit, grain, some earthy tones. Taste is a mix of dark fruit, caramel, toffee, red fruit into some bread into dough, some toasted bread, some slight yeast, finishing bitter, slightly sweet,
Nice and great. Thick and cloudy and very delicious. Very good strong wheat one and enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours a dark brownish ruby red, thick off white smooth non-lasting head. Aroma is of dark fruits, golden syrup, milk chocolate. Taste is slightly bitter, dark fruits, burnt brown sugar, light hint of chocolate. Alcohol isn't noticeable at all. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nice

On tap at Cafe Berlin in Washington, DC. 

Opaque, near black with a 2-finger khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of raisins, caramel, vanilla, cherries, cookie dough and dates. 

Taste of toffee, raisins, chocolate, cookie dough, cherries, vanilla and dates. 

Medium body and medium/high carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from total wine at landmark VA. Not much head and v little aroma. Dark cola color but not opaque. First impression is of sweet raisins and malt w vanilla and caramel. Aftertaste mellows a bit with some herbaceous notes but still sweet w some bitterness coming through. Almost syrupy mouth feel. A bit disappointing. I was expecting more based on overall ratings. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Pours a deep brown with some dark dark amber when held to the light. The off white head is gone in a flash. Faint but pleasant aromas: caramel, bread, floral, dough, hint of vanilla, some cheese. Flavor profile is out of balance and somewhat unremarkable. Bitter and slightly sticky finish. Not my favorite Weihenstephaner.

Pours clear, dark amber with a thick, stable, foamy off-white head. Dark fruity and malty aroma with some chocolate kicks. Nice sweetish nose. Taste is smooth, mild and soft sweetish. Clear sugar notes, caramels, toffees, brown sugar, bananas, bready notes, spices, bit of dark fruits, berries, but still mainly sugary. Maybe a bit too sugary, which diminishes the smoothness a bit... But still it is flavorful, especially due to its roasty touch in combination with the wide range of tastes you can find in this brew. Finish is roasty and sweet with a small warmish kick. The brew is a bit on the thinner side of the palate. Bit watery, yet still a very syrupy and sticky mouthfeel. Carbonation is almost absent. In general this beer was quite a nice one. Its a bit too sugary to my likings, but it has a nice flavor complexity in combination with some nice roasty touches that makes this easy drinkable doppelbock quite a fine one.

500ml Bottle from Beers of Europe (£2.99) drank of Christmas:
Weihenstephan is definitely one of my favourite brewerys and personally I dont think anyone makes a better wheat beer so I was very much looking forward to this one. The beer was a nice one with plenty of malt sweetness and dark fruits coming through, sure it didnt quite match the brewerys flagship hefeweizen but it was still a very nice doppelbock with enough going for it to make things interesting. A decent beer well worth picking up but its not one of the brewerys best offerings, mainly because they have already set the bar so high.

Dark brown color with reddish hue, big tan head that quickly disappeared. Aroma of dark fruits, malts, caramel. Taste is the same plus some milk chocolate notes. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Nice and smooth. Excellent.

Bottle poured. Pours a brownish red color with a foamy tan head. Sweet vanilla and cherry aroma with some malt. Flavor is very creamy, and a lot of malt up front. Finishes sweeter with some cherry and light vanilla. Great flavor. Nice balance. Great beer.

Poured from a pint bottle into a tumbler on 01.19.14.

A: Black. Nearly opaque. Some lacing.

S: Roasty banana bread.

T: Lots of malt. Banana bread. Complex.

M: Creamy.

O: The roasty malt comes in sweet then a slight crusty banana bread takes over. The alcohol is completely hidden. This and Salvator are my favorite doppelbocks.
Sientes un ligero orgasmo cuando este brebaje se precipita desde lo alto de tu garganta, simply amazing ;)

Pours dark brown with a bare hint of red. Bubbly with a massive foamy and noisy tan head. Aroma is sharp bready malts and yeast. Taste is very smooth - rich malts, darkfruits and baked bread. Very little hop bitterness but a touch in the aftertaste with some warming. Mild carbonation. Excellent and smooth dbock. Among the best of the style.

Bottle 0.5l. Dark mahogany liquid with big beige head. Medium to full body, light carbonation. Vanilla and cherry and sarsaparilla on the nose, dark fruits and prune on the palate. Overall, well-balanced and flavorful.
Bottle 0.5l. Dark mahogany liquid with big beige head. Medium to full body, light carbonation. Caramel, overriped fruits. A bit to sweet.

Kafa sötét, tiszta rubin színe van a duplának! Habja bézs közepesen tartós viszonylag sűrű.
Illata pörkölt tökmag és méz keveréke, édes-komlós toldalékkal. (napraforgómag) Testes, karamelles, vadvirágmézes, ragacsos és nagyon édes. Minimálisan keserű, ebből (és a stílusból) következően a komló rendesen elbújtatott. Barna kenyeres lecsengés. Enyhén szénsavas.
Nekem ez veristark, fele is elég. (bok) :)

Deep amber pour, thick tan head. Nose is malt and dark fruit. Sweet. Middle washes figs and caramel over the tongue with soft carbonation. Finish bitters somewhat, but sweet malt is still the signature. Very balanced for the ABV.

Bottle shared at Craigs. Pours clear, deep amber with a creamy tan head. The aroma has rich, meaty ripe fruits, caramel, bread, fruitcake. Medium to big sweet flavor with liquefied fruits, rich bread, figs, dates. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Sugary finish with doughy brown bread, toffee, creme caramel, fig. Tasty dop.
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, bread. Taste of toffee, treacle, bread, quite sweet.
bottle at home .. copper ..t hin white lacing ... soft toffee ..dark suger dark suger nose ... dark sweet fruits ... soft toffee fruit ... light roast sugers ...
Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep reddish brown, nose is malty toffee, taste is malty, rich, sweet, light fruit.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark red brown with a thin short-lived head. Aromas of toffee, caramel. Taste is sweet. Finishes sweet.
Bottle. Dark mahogany with thin tan head. Aroma of toffee, toasted malt, and vanilla. Medium body, moderate malt sweetness, caramel, complex malt notes, hint of dark fruit, and a sweet finish.

Söt & blödig smak, mörkt sött bröd som som kavring. Sötman av både malt & alkoholen. Ganska tunn doft & lätt i kropp trots tung malt. Rätt så fin dubbelbock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cerveza de color Marrón oscuro turbio con una buena espuma duradera.
Aroma a malta oscura y dulzura de caramelo.
Sabor dulce a malta tostada con un toque de frutos secos y de chocolate.
Esta cerveza es muy equilibrada y apetecible. El final es bastante suave y deja un regusto dulce a malta. Muy buena Doppelbock. Me gusto.

Brune avec des reflets rubis limpide, mousse moyenne mais persitente beige. Nez defruits rouges : cerises, groseilles, framboises, et malté. Bouche bien maltée et sucrée, les saveurs de fruits rouges sont toujours présentes, léger côté torréfié. Légèrement amertume, corps rond, alcool discret. La meilleure doppelbock que jai goutée, elle me réconcilie avec le style !
Arômes de fruits rouges et sucre. En bouche ca goûte le sucre à crème, légère torréfaction, caramel. Le 7.4% paraît pas. Une excellente doppelbock.
Bonne doppelbock mais qui manque dun je ne sais quoi pour la rendre originale. Assez sympa mais beaucoup plus de caractère chez certains de sa catégorie.
Dark brown with tan head. Roasted coffee, chocolate, fruits. Quite sweet beer.

Pint bottle, poured into a tulip glass at room temperature.

A: Pours into the glass the color of mahogany wood or very, very dark cherry wood. Shining an iPhone light through the beer reveals bright red highlights, and columns of bubbles. The head forms a bit over a finger thick of pale beige, with good retention. Lacing may as well be a sheet of bubbles permanently etched into the glass.

S: Rich, bready caramel-toffee malt scents, wreathed with hints of chocolate. Theres what seems to be a bit of dark fruit in the nose as well.

T: Warm, yeasty dark bread fills the mouth from the first sip. Some sweet toffee slithers along the sides of the bread through the middle, and some notes of walnut and cooked raisin waft through background of the flavor palate beside a faint cocoa tinge. By the finish, there is a distinct note of hardwood, like oak or maple. No hop presence to speak of, which is perfect.

M: While full and sticky, the mouthfeel is surprisingly not quite as thick for a doppelbock as I would hope, feeling closer to a bock.

O: This is a beautiful doppelbock example, a tour de malt with virtually zero hop flavors involved. A little additional dark fruit complexity to the flavor profile, and a slightly thicker mouthfeel, and this would approach perfect 5 territory for me.
Dark brown with a light brown head. Malty aroma. Malt taste with some notes of spice. Very smooth mouth feel. Great beer!

Slight aroma. Color is as black as coffee. Smooth taste with a rich almost chocolate finish. Minimal foam/head at the top of the beer. Very good beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Niet echt een topbiertje. Het is wel een dubbelbock. Weinig schuim op het bier wat toch wel jammer is. Al met al niet een biertje waar ik snel voor in de rij zal gaan staan.

Deep roasted malt aroma thats intoxicating. Rich mahogany body with an off white head that lingers nicely. More roasted malt on the taste buds that feel smooth and rich. Sweet caramel background. Also has crisp feel to it too.

All malt. Creamy body with tons of roasted chocolate and sweet caramel with a hint of dark plum underneath. Subtle warm bread and wood show through the finish with little to no hop presence, but this is very smooth, warming and rich.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2015 Deze al een tijd geleden op maar hij beviel echt niet. 2de keer dat ik hem probeerde vond ik hem best goed te doen. Gedronken van de tap in een 0.5 liter glas van Weihenstephaner. Het is een echte dubbelbock, smaak is zwaar. Geen tot weinig schuim. Vol donker bier.

50cl bottle. Rich intense aroma: molasses, sourdough bread, plum cake. Light beige head. Dark reddish brown. Roasty, caramel edge, but flavour is mainly rich and fruity - dark, cake fruit, sherry-drenched raisins. Very light bitterness. Light carbonation. Some silkiness in the mouth. Heady in its richness and fruitiness.
Pours bitch black with a tan head. Aroma has toffee, Caramel and roasted notes. Taste is similar with an added touch of maple syrup like sweetness. Wonderful classic doppelbock.

Flasche (50 cl). - Schwarzbraun, dunkler Schaum. - Antrunk sehr dunkelmalzig aber nur zurückhaltend röstig. Bitterschokolade, Kakao, Lakritz, Holznoten, pikante Säure.
