Die Malzsüße wirkt nirgends dick. Gut rezent, sehr vollmundig, samtiges Mundgefühl. Im Hintergrund leicht holzige, schwach grasige Herbe. Ausreichend bitterer Nachtrunk. - Vornehmer, außerordentlich harmonischer Doppelbock, der elegant die Kurve von der tiefen Malzigkeit zur holzigen Bittere schlägt, ohne dick oder fuselig zu wirken, trotz eines untergärig eingeschränkten Geschmacksprofils.

50cl bottle. Pours dark reddish brown with a fine creamy light beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, black bread, dark fruits, some spices. Taste is similar with some more roastiness, molasses, light coffee. Oily mouthfeel, light caramel aftertaste, very light bitterness. Light carbonation, medium to full body. Excellent.

Brown coloured beer with a off-white, very firm head. Madium carbonation. The Weizen background of this beerbrand is abundantley clear. The typical creamy taste is there. With a differrent sort of fruitiness (raisins?). Roasted malts and a smooth finish. Good beer, a bit to little character for a doppelbock.
Bottle from beersofeurope. Dark ruby brown beer with medium head. Aroma of roasted malts, toffee and dark fruits. Taste is dark malts, some fruit, raisins and brown bread. Medium bodied. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Leaves a very thick lace. Not quite as heavy as a celebrator. Still a good flavor. Dont know enough about the style to compare to others.

50 cl. Pours an abundant creamy and dense beige head, deep brown to black colour, showing some ruby reflexes. Smells toasted and dark malts, caramel, cocoa, bit of dark/dried fruit. Tastes super malty, crystal malts, caramel, raisins, chocolatey; extremly refined, smooth all malt sweetness, nearly no bitterness at all. Average carbonation, almost full bodied, but still quite very drinkable as in the best deutsch tradition. A really nice one !

Pours the color of Coca-Cola with a medium light tan head. Aroma is sweet malty grains and molasses. Taste is super smooth & creamy malts and mellow spices up throughout the palate with almost no aftertaste. Good!
from tap. dark brown to black pour with a tanned head. chocolate malts, bits of smoke, caramel, toffee, hints of espresso. dark dried forest fruits, biscuit, pretty nice full bodied mouthfeel!

Weihanstephans doesnt get nearly the attention they deserve. They run a brewing university in Germany, for Chrissakes. This beer isnt as chocolatey as the Ayinger Doppelbock, but its solid, nonetheless. Nice nose, but would be nicer likely if fresh as opposed to purchased at Specs in Houston. Solid flavor. Beautifully dark with garnett highlights. "Starkbier" must be another type of Doppelbock.
Clear dark brown beer with a white head, medium carbonation.Taste is caramel, nice bitter, chocolate, coffee and dried fruit.Nice doppelbock.
(Bue sur place en fût): Biscuit moelleux anisé, caramélisé et empreint de mélasse et dattes. Sa buvabilité est plus que décente pour le genre.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 To the ones (like me) that are not big fans of German beers and that think that the rauschbeers are the only ones that could be taken seriously, its a quite funny experience drinking a good and old Weihenstephaner. This has a red-brown crystal color and a well defined and mature taste. In the end, the lesson is quite simple: Dont underestimate the Germans, they can do, of course, excellent beers like this one... ;)
[ BA Review @ 10/30/2009 ]

Julie really likes it and gives it a 4. Andy isn't crazy about it. Rich and smooth not spicy or hoppy

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dunkelbraun, leichter Rotschimmer, schaumig. In der Nase Röstmalz, Schokolade, dunkle Früchte, dunkles Brot. m Gaumen röstig, malzig, brotig, schoko, dunkle Früchte. Ausfüllend, top.
"heres a nice bready, doughy, slightly spicy, slightly chocolatey treat! this one started nice and got better as i drank. smooth as hell, luscious flavor."

Bottle at home. Has a deep, reddish brown colour with a big, light brown, creamy head. Sweet and malty aroma of nuts, leather, caramel, wood, chocolate, coffee and dried fruit. Flavour of dried fruit, leather, wood and fudge. Has a slick mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A malty and sweet doppelbock. Solid.

Good dopplebock. Superspak sees them pleasing him this way, " 500 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 10/30/2012. Pours crystal clear deep reddish brown color with a 1-2 finger dense light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of apple, pear, caramel, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, floral, light pepper, nuttiness, light chocolate, and toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity esters and dark malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big apple, pear, caramel, brown sugar, toast, toffee, brown bread, nuttiness, light chocolate, biscuit, floral, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toffee, toast, light fruits, brown bread, biscuit, nuttiness, light chocolate, floral, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity of light fruity esters with a big dark malt balance; with big robustness and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a creamy and slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent doppelbock! Great complexity and balance of fruity ester and dark malt flavors; and very smooth to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering."
Having tasted many beers in my time, this beer contains the complement of excellent qualities, full bodied with wholesome aroma. A meal in itself.

Completely dark with brown hue, small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, brown sugar, alcohol and roasted malts. Medium to heavy sweetness. Medium body, soft carbonation, nice creamy texture. Long brown sugar finish. Nice, but a little bit too boozy for my taste. (0,5l bottle)
Dark brown in color with mininal tan head. Aroma is a bit alcoholic, malty, caramel. Sweet taste. Very good one.
Pours dark with a beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, dried fruit, lightly roasty and hints of wood. Taste is medium sweet leading to a malty finish. Excellent!
Rich malt aroma, clear mahogany with minimal head. Medium sweet with creamy mouthfeel and a lingering finish.

500ml bottle. Pours a dark mahogany color with a tan head and nice lacing. Aroma of malt, bit of caramel sweetness and bit of nut. Taste of roasted malt, bit of caramel sweetness and hint of spice. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Medium body, creamy with a nice malt feel that is well crafted. Enjoyable beer worth checking out

Somewhat different Doppelbock (label just says "dunkles Starkbier") with light beige, creamy, delicate head and dark coppery chestnut colour with ruby hue, clear. Powerful and complex aroma with impressions of coffee grounds, sherry, peat, blueberries, plums, chocolate, leather, cinnamon and cloves but also some oxidation (apparently the bottle has had its best time). Sweetish onset with caramelly and honeyish malt character, rich, drying and become bitterish after the middle with peppery hops, roasted coffee-like bitterness, a somewhat cloying candi sweetness and warming, little bit astringent alcohol. I should probably purchase a younger sample to get a better view on this.

great and smooth, love them German beers, caramel, bread, cereal, hay, chocolate, toast, alcohol, resin, floral, raisin, banana, red, clear, tan foam, light sweetness, not bitter, full body, creamy, soft carbonation,

03.09.2014, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, nuts, hay, grain, chocolate, grass, paper, coffee, alcohol, hints of licorice. Taste is slightly rich and sweet, "knekk", grass, caramel malts, coffee, nuts, dark sugar, hay, roasted grain, alcohol, hints of licorice. Medium bitterness, slightly dry grainy mouthfeel. Nice.
UPDATED: JUL 1, 2016 Botella de 50 cl, en Cerveceria Internacional. Color marron oscuro. Sabor a malta tostada, caramelo, dulce.

bottle bought at the Weihenstephaner bottle shop at the brewery in Freising/Germany. Overall a fantastic doppelbock with a lot of malt, caramel, sweetness, some roasted malt aroma and taste. A perfect winter beer!
500ml bottle. Aroma is malt, dark fruits, light caramel. Appearance is dark brown with a nice brown-ish head. Taste is light sweet and sour. A nice dryness. Soft carbonation. Great.
From bottle. Dark mahogany pour with a medium tan head. Taste is dark brown sugar and some spice, a bit of bananas, raisins, and dark fruits. Very nice.

Served on tap in a chalice glass
 Appearance  The beer is served a deep brown color with a one finger head of off white foam. The head has a good level of retention, slowly fading to leave a good level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is heaviest of a bready toasted malt smell along with a decent showing of some dark fruits of prune and raisin. Along with these aromas are some smells of cocoa, toffee, and caramel. A little bit of grass and some coffee are there as well, giving just a hint of bitterness to an otherwise sweet and roastey malted smelling brew. 
 Taste  The taste begins much crisper then I was anticipating, with a nice roasted malt base and a decent showing of some sweeter flavors of caramel and molasses. As the taste advances the roasted flavors remain rather strong while the initial caramel and molasses lose some ground, but with them being replaced by some light dark fruit flavors of plum and cherry. Some chocolate and a lighter coffee flavor work their way into the taste profile as well, and with a little bit of a grassy and herbal flavor coming to the tongue as well, one is left with a surprisingly crisper, but still quite roasty and sweet flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is slightly thinner and crisper side with a carbonation level that is on the average to slightly higher side. The slightly thinner body and higher carbonation actually work for this beer even though it is rather dark; as the feel really crates a crisp and very easy drinking but highly flavorful brew.
 Overall  This is a very flavorful doppelbock with a very easy drinking and crisp feel in light of its abv. of 7.4 %. This is one nice drinker and one I will certainly come back to again.
Shared a bottle at Plonk. Clear, dark brown, big malty flavours with little or no hop aromas and a sweetness with hints of chocolate and fruit. My first of the style. Pretty good.

Another in the long list of beers I should work into the rotation more frequently; cant believe this is the first Ive had since starting to use RateBeer! Aroma of caramel malt and molasses. Slightly syrupy but less sweet than that sounds.

Head is beige and quite big. A bold looking beer. Aroma has roasted malts, chocolate, toffee and a little bit of syrup. Taste has syrup and toffee sweetness, then lots of roasted malts but there is this slight alcohol that pops up in the end which is rather unpleasant. Medium+ body and medium carbonation.
Greit weizen doppelbock. Soft wheaty body, with a nice taste of smooth caramelised malt, fruity yeast and mild hops. Great.

Appearance is deep brown, opaque, with Reny highlights and a thick tan foam cap. Aroma is bready and roasted malt. No noticeable hop aroma or alcohol. Taste is rich caramel, dark fruit, molasses, and a hint of roasted malt on the back side. Hop bitterness is minimal. Mouthfeel is medium with a decent carbonation and slight alcohol warmth. Finished very malty with no noticeable hop character and leaves a thick caramel malt flavor on the tongue. Seems somewhat subdued and maltier than other doppelbocks, with less of a dark fruit/licorice character

Egészen mély, rubinvörös árnyalatú, a pohárban lévő mennyiség csökkenésével egyre átlátszóbbá válik. Illata borszerű, égetett cukor, mazsola és dió aromái kergetőznek benne, íze pedig nagyszerűen továbbviszi ezt a kissé fanyar, enyhén karcos vonulatot. A vártnál súlyosabb, égetett édesség, zserbó zamata bontakozik ki, melyhez idővel további, kisimultabb ízjegyek csatlakoznak némi tejszínes, vaníliás elemek formájában, így téve kiegyensúlyozottá az összhatást.
A solid malty dopplebock. It's got body, an array of malts, mineral content some European funk and a hint of chocolate.
Draft at Clinton hall NYC. Pours a dark brown color. Sweet bready wheat notes with banana , clove and spice

This beer is a strong dark tasting beer kind of a chemical taste also need to be served really cold. 
Good luck.

Dark copper color with a full, tan head that left lacing on the side of the glass. The aroma releases caramel, butterscotch, and just a hint of fresh coffee. The malts are delicious and rich but not overly sweet at all, and the beer itself doesnt seem heavy-bodied at all. Great beer for breakfast!
Pours a dark brown with off-white head. Earthy aromas and spices on the nose. Bready, hints of banana and molasses, lots of spice. A really nice doppelbock.

The body has a dark brown color with lighter brownish red highlights. On top sits a nice light tan head which was about two fingers thick right after it was poured. This head slowly fades but hangs on till the last sip, (not that it took me long it get there lol). There was some nice slick lacing, as well, which slid right down the glass as I drank. The aroma is pleasing and sweet with notes of dark sweet bread, cooked or burnt sugar, as well as some mellow notes of over ripe fruit and classic German hops. It has a firm, slick, full bodied palate with a flavor profile that matches its aroma. The flavor is full dark sweet bready malty goodness. There are some hints of nuts and fruit mixed into the mostly sweet malt along with some decent leafy/spicy, almost earthy hops for balance. The hops also add a nice balance to the finish making it quite drinkable.

From. 500ml into a we weizen glass. Very flavorful consisting of dark fruit and yeast. Yum. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Pours reddish brown with a ran head. Caramel and chocolate aromas are prominent. Sweet and sticky, dark fruits in the finish.
Bottle at Specialty Beer Cellar. Opaque dark brown pour with an off white head. Dark malt and coffee bouquet. Dark roasted malts with chocolates and caramels. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle at the Fiddler, Den Haag. Poured a clear dark brown with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is yeast, sweet malt, light fruit. The flavour is light sweet with a roasted malt liqourice bitter, earthy mineral, light alcohol palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Aromas of fruity esters, raisins, plums, some nuttiness, hints of chocolate, toast. Clear ruby with burnt orange highlights, and a mostly fading head. Initially malty and fruity, balanced by delicate earthy hops in the finish. Light-medium bodied, sticky.

Dark yellow brown pour. Aroma of milk caramel, toffee, acetate, trippel, hay.
Tastes straight of the the feedbag; oats. Sweet. Alcohol bite on the palate and some creaminess. Very loud flavor. Spritz carb dry finish elevates it above other doppels.

Bottle Pours very dark ruby red with a huge foamy head that fades very slowly and leaves a little lacing. Complex aroma of burnt dark bread, cherries, dark fruit, smoked meat, brown sugar, and a late hint of banana. Tastes good but not as good as the aroma. Comes off surprisingly watery. Very fruity with cherries and dark fruit, light raisin, light banana. Salty smoked meat in the finish. Medium body. Slight overcarbonation for my liking. Very good doppledock.

500 ml bottle at home. Pours caramel brown in color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have toasted bread, caramel, some dark fruit character, brown sugar, earthy notes, smooth, solid classic style doppelbock.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Roasty, a bit coffee note from it, but sharp roastiness with very little yeast aroma except aftertaste with some leathery earthy taste, quite good mouthfeel, very creamy, medium, a bit of licorice in the end.

Bamberg Jolly Day 3 26/01/2014. Bottle shared at the Weihenstephaner Am Dom in Freising. Dark mahogany brown with a creamy lasting head. Aroma is woody, berry, caramel. Flavour is sweet raisin, nutty caramel. Palate is pretty sweet slightly cloying. Some unrefined sugars.

BB 24.12.14. Poured a near opaque ruby brown colour with a two- to three-finger tan frothy head that diminished quickly (compared to other Weihenstephaner beers tasted recently) to a collar. Laced OK as spots and rings. Carbonation moderate to high. Aroma very subtly of sweet malt with a hint of sweet fruit; quite sweet. Taste quite sweet maltiness initially with a hint of sweet fruits but no hops bitterness evident Alcohol well hidden. Medium body. Smooth, clean and with a slightly sweet finish (not as sweet as the Tradition Bayrisch Dunkel).

Pours very dark brown to black with a thick khaki head that settles slowly to a thick ring and leaves some spotty lace. Nose involves dark chocolate, toasted malt, savory meat, dark dried fruit, some spice. Fairly sweet, decently bitter. Lighter medium body, active, crisp, finishing long with savory and toasted notes. If its possible for a doppelbock to be refreshing, this is refreshing. It also has lots to ruminate over, and is quite enjoyable.

Cloudy, and dark brown. With a big creamy head.
Aromas of malt, caramel, toast, and nuts are predominant, such as walnuts or hazelnuts. Some fruity notes are also seen, although more hidden.
Malt and caramel tastes, accompanied by hints of burnt sugar, nuts, chocolate.

Very creamy long lasting head. Malty aroma, hints of banana, raisins, roasted bread. Excellent alcohol masking, light to medium body, low carbonation, sweet warm finish. Taste is also very sweet, with licorice, caramel.

Pour is very deep mohagany with a sizeable, but quickly dissipating head. Takes on the appearance of beautiful dark marble when swirled in the glass. Aroma is roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is sweet upfront with malt and bittersweet chocolate. Just enough carbonation for a little tingle with each sip. Most beautiful looking beer I have had, but a bit too sweet. Very good, though it would have been even better with a little more age on it.

Cloudy brown color , big creamy head. Rich aroma of malt , raisins, toffee, caramel and fruits . Taste is malty sweet with notes of coffee , caramel and wheat . Full body , medium carbonation. Great beer!!!
Sweet. Nutty. Lingering body. Excellent beer for its high malt character. Overall very well balanced.

For my 1000th review on rate beer, I found the notes to this beautiful brew.
I poured this into a weizen glass.
The appearance was a dark murky brown almost close to black, but it had a nice settling off white to white foamy head that allows a nice dissipation at a nice pace.
The smell had a deep dark chocolate to banana maltiness invading my nose powerfully.
The taste was allocated well between the chocolate malts and the banana esters to produce an indulgent dessert-like flavoring. There is a nice chocolate banana like aftertaste with a quick dry finish.
On the palate, it sits about a medium on the body with a decent carbonation for its style and comes across well to me. Sessionability - maybe, but for me I tend to find this one more as a sipper and well worthy of a dessert in and of itself.
Overall, hmmm...I think I said what I needed to say other than dont pass this up if you see it. Such a wonderful brew!

Aroma is smoky, fruity, bread. Very dark ruby-brown when poured, with a thin, fading, light brown head. Taste is very malty, with bananas,caramel, coffee and citrus coming through, also a smokiness that is in no way acrid. Everything going on here is balanced perfectly. Palate is heavy, smoky sweet but not clingy. Excellent offering for this style, excellent price!

Poured from bottle. Dark brown offset with cream colored head. Aroma is fruit cake, toffee and raisins, washed in ash. Taste is buttered pumpernickel toast, molasses and candied fruits. Everything here points to the malts. Creamy mouthfeel. Enjoyed.
50cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is dark, dark red, dark brown. Head is thin to medium. Body is smooth. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Aroma is roasted, liquorish, chocolate, light smoke.

Bottle from Beers Of Europe [020514]
Dark chestnut brown, big frothy beige head
Aroma of caramel, yeast, slight spicy hops, sweet malts
Taste of sweet fruity caramel malts, slight spicy hops, touch of toffee, alcohol well hidden, straightforward malty beer
Palate - soft carb, medium body, oily, fairly sweet. Finish as main flavour, smooth sweet malts, slight toasted bitterness
Overall - Nice enough
Smells light and almost like a chocolate candy, and thats how it tastes, nice mellow full flavored brew excellence in a bottle

Bottle at Weihenstephaner Berlin am Hackeschen Markt.
Slightly hazy amber-brown with a nice beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, and dried fruits. Medium sweetness, with bread, dark dried fruits and roasted malts, low-medium bitterness, very rich flavors, long duration and light alcoholic warmth. Medium-full bodied, creamy and smooth on palate. Great beer.

500 mml bottle tasted on 23/04/2104. Dark brown ruby colour. Aroma is strong and sweet with caramel and sugar notes. Nice head and almost perfect carbonation. Roasted malt and brown sugar on the taste. Pretty taste with some caramel aftertaste. Nice Doppelbock for a nice price. Next one please!

500ml bottle. Dark ruby body, medium mocha head with good retention. Aroma of roasted malt and caramel, plums, a little woodsy, licorice and figs. Taste of sweet caramel malt, some berries, floral hops, well done toast, candy sugar. Light and refreshing for the abv.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Review according to BJCP2015 guidelines (style 9A). AROMA: strong sweet malt aroma with rich Maillard notes (bread crust) and moderate alcohol aroma with some faint dark fruits. APPEARANCE: translucent dark brown with ruby tint. persistent medium head of beige color. head retention reduced maybe because of high alcohol content. formation of some legs present. TASTE: rich malt flavour with bread crust notes. faint chocolate note. smooth impression from alcohol and no hop flavours. low bitterness with malt dominating the flavour. PALATE: medium-full body with moderate carbonation. smooth without astringency. slight alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a very nice doppelbock and silky smooth.

Pours dark ruby with thick white lingering head.
Aroma: coffee, chocolate, cinnamon and a bit of booze.
Taste: chocolate, cinnamon and coffee are prominent. Finish is not too boozy given the 7.4% abv.
Overall, good, but not great.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with orange hints. Nice off white head. Caramel is the main flavor I get.

Bottle from bier-deluxe.de.  Dark brown color with thick long lasting beige head. Dark malt in aroma, raisins, caramel, clove licorice. Roasted malt, caramel, brown sugar, clove, licorice, fruit syrup. Tasty.

Shared a 50cl bottle from Ruppert (Luxembourg). Pours a deep brown colour with a thin, persistent tan head. Aroma has roasted, chocolate, molasse and raisin notes. Some alcohol on the nose. Average to soft carbonation and medium to full oily body. Taste is a well balanced voyage between bitter, sweet and a roasted very dry finish. Overall, a meal with a few dimensions. Great beer!

Pours a caramel brown color with a khaki head. Malt, caramel, toffee, bread and brown sugar aroma. Toffee, caramel, malt, bread, brown sugar, raisin and slight chocolate flavors. Medium full body with moderate carbonation. Caramel malt and brown sugar finish.

Poured into a stein from a bottle. Pours a deep brown with an off white head. Small lacing as you drink. Tastes of roasted malt, caramel and a slight hint of cherry. Nice bite at the end, you will notice the stronger alcohol content after a few sips. Overall, I was slightly underwhelmed by this beer based on the previous reviews. Still enjoyable to drink, but nothing really stood out about it.
Brown pour with ample head. Aroma of toffee, brown sugar, and booze. Taste is caramel softness with toffee, brown sugar, and rock candy. Yum.

On tap at Huber Haus (Omaha). Brown appearance. Aroma of dark malts, wheat bread, rich chocolate, toasted grains, caramel and toffee. Similar flavor, malty medium sweetness and minimal bitterness. Medium body, pretty tasty.
On tap. Dark brown with off white head. Aroma malty, light roasted, toffee, bread, burnt sugar and light liquorice. Taste is malty, fairly sweet, liquorice and burnt sugar. Nice one

500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmmalzig, schokoladig, fruchtig. Geschmack röstmalzig süß mit leichter Fruchtigkeit, leicht schokoladig.

Mas info en http://www.encopasabemejor.com/2014/03/weihensteph aroma es fundamentalmente intenso, predominando notas maltosas, caramelo líquido (tostado como el que se usa en los flanes caseros) y un sutil punto a frutos secos.
Su sabor, al igual que su aroma, resulta bastante intenso: de primeras nos presenta unas notas maltosas y acarameladas junto a un tono de frutos secos para acabar con un fugaz punto de alcohol que apenas notamos su presencia.

Pours dark brown with perfect clarity and excites the eye with ruby hues glowing softly within the body of the beer like a jewel. Fat creamy persistent tan head. Nose is malty and rich with with bright plum and sweet chocolate. The drink is generous and smooth as silk with raisin and prune, a slight bit of chocolate, and an overall lightness from fresh plum. Softly breaddy with a full mouthfeel . Clean and with enough carbonation to lighten and excite the palate. This beer drinks as lightly as a much paler beer. 

Outstanding. A silken and ample malt with a perfect compliment of dark fruits and light chocolate. This is indeed liquid bread.

Poured into stein. A rusty brown with off white head. Aroma is a sweet mix of malts, woods, biscut and a little banana. Taste is malty, caramel and raisin. A med body and a bit sticky. Finish is roasted malts with a little alcohol hit at the end. Enjoyable.
Medium mokka brown head, dark brown colour with a red glow, warm coffee caramel ice cream smell, medium carbonation and bitter coffee fruity creamy
Surprisingly light for a dark beer. Im not fond of them but this one was very nice and easy to drink.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 Dark ruby pour with thick cream color head. Tastes of dark fruit and alcohol. Not my type of beer.
(bottle) clear dark reddish brown colour with a small brown head; aroma starts with soy sauce, smoked prunes, then toffee; creamy palate; balanced, gently sweet and rich flavour; very nice
Almost black pour with carmel head. Strong carmels and malt start with light refreshing finish.
Flaska @ Printz. Rödbrun vätska med massivt högt skum. Kraftig arom av fruktkaka, säd och honung. Djup komplex smak där sötman spelar förstafiolen. Medellång eftersmak.

How: Bottle.
Where: Weihenstephaner am Dom, Freising.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Malt, dark fruit, liquorice.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Liquorice, malt, hops, alcohol.

A dark rich beer that would be great in a beer hall setting hanging out with the guys friends eating brats and kraut

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

First time I can say Ive had 2 doplebocks in one day. Pours dark ruby/mahogany, wonderful tan head. Taste is a smooth mix of caramel, light raisin, fruity eaters, just a touch of banana. Significantly better than the paulener one I just had. Just comes of more well rounded.
Dark brown colour with a small cream-coloured head. Aroma of malts, nuts, caramel, dark fruits, raisins. Flavour is medium sweetness with a dry finish. Very enjoyable.
On tap at Der Biergarten, aroma is raisins, lots of caramel and sweetness, crisp palate.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark brown with off white head. Huge malty sweet aroma. Caramel, toffee, biscuits, syrup notes. Taste is definitely malt dominated. Toffee, caramel, maple syrup tastes. Sticky sweet mouthfeel. Medium to full bodied. Pretty solid doppelbock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Day 3 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, bottle at Weihenstephaner Am Dom - Freising, 26/01/14. 
Extremely dark mahogony brown with a moderate beige covering that thins to edgework and spotting.
Nose is dark toffee, lightly burn caramel, brown sugars, dark fruit tang, cocoa, light booze.
Taste comprises fruit cake, earthy cocoa, dark fruits, raisens.
Medium bodied with bite, fine carbonation, light booze in the last hurrah.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Color of grape soda with an off white head. Aroma is nutty with fruity esters of grape and banana. Taste follows suit and adds some roasty malt. Medium sticky palate and moderate carb. Pretty good.

Strong caramel sweet notes. Very drinkable. Pours light brown. Nice carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 January 29, 2014 - on tap at Hessen Haus. Dark brown pour with nice amount of head and some lacing. Nice aroma and taste of malt, caramel and toffee. A touch of spice in the finish as it warmed. Medium body and light carbonation.

Color is reddish-brown; decent finger of head. 

Aroma is sugary as hell; sweeeeet molasses. An interesting touch of red-wine grapes. Heavy cola aroma. Once you get past the initial saccharine sweetness, it mellows out lovely.

Flavor is tobacco and leather. Stone fruits and ashy mocha. Cola and candi-sugar sweetness, but in a way that is blunted somewhat by a mild sourness. 

Smooth, oily slickness. Buttery smooth; one of the smoothest beers I can imagine. Its got that Euro-sweetness, but the dry, ashy quality prevents it from being a sugarbomb.

Bottle. Pours a deep mahogany brown, smallish cream-colored head, okay retention and decent lacing. Nose is kinda faint, malty, some brown sugar, raisins. Mouth is thankfully much bigger than the sniffer... Malt forward, chewy pumpernickel bread crusts, dried fruits, hint of molasses, full bodied and light sweetness, creamy finish. Really nice dopplebock. Prost!

Bottle.

A- Dates, figs, cherries, caramel, brown sugar, plums.

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, off white head.

T- Medium maltiness, dark fruits, cherries, brown sugar, sweet bread.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, soft finish.

O- A very good beer from a very good brewery. The dark fruit aroma and taste was fantastic. Not quite what I was expecting...even better!

Clear dark brown, small greyish head and visible carbonation. Yeast, caramel, toast, coffee beans, some herbal, light medicinal notes. Medium sweet with roasted butter and dry finish. Medium-thin bodied, goes down well... Nice, but Weihenstephaner makes better stuff.

500ml served in an Allagash glass

A - Dark brown with a tight cream cap. Solid ring with minimal lacing.

S - Raisins, old cherries, brown sugar, sweet brown bread, wood, faint toasted bananas, red figs, toasted graham crackers.

T - Fruity malt, cherries, red fig puree, dates, raisins, toasted brown bananas, cocoa, has a simple syrup sweetness with an old woody character to it. Roasted caramel/toffee malts adds depth with chocolate and bananas coming out more as it warms. Finishes with sweet dark malts, and s slight cocoa bitterness.

M - Medium body, semi-creamy feel, low to medium carbonation.

Complex flavors that let the fruity esters sing while the malts are bold but in a delicate way. Alcohol is undetectable and this drinks smooth. Perfect for an April evening.

Serving type: bottle

04-27-2013
bread, toast, roasty, coffee, earthy, resin, licorice, brown, black, tan foam, brown foam, medium sweetness, umami, love it

A dark brown coloured beer with orange hints and a thick off white head. A light, vinous and malty aroma, roasted nuts, raisin fruit and a hint of chocolate. Medium-dry mouthfeel. A dry roasted malt taste, nutty, espresso coffee and bitter chocolate are matched by sweet raisin fruit and a touch of spice. The finish is dry, malty and fruity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

14.1, 0,5l, butelka. Niesamowity aromat koźlaków, świeżość, karmel, słodkie owoce, syropy, kandyzowane zapachy. Coś wspaniałego. Piana tworzy sie ochoczo, brudno-biała, estetyczna, utrzymuje się dośc długi okres. Kolor: jasno-czarny lub bardzo ciemny brąz. W smaku średnio-słodkie. Pozostawia cieprkawe odczucie w gardle. Po dłuższym ogrzaniu jakoś bardziej wytrawne, słodowe, gorzkawe? Zawsze trudno było mi zidentyfikowac smak koźlaków. Do głosu szybko dochodzi alkohol, nie można się rozpędzać z Korbinianem. Trochę za mało ciała. Podumowując: jedyny koźlak, który piłem przed Korbinianem to ten z Miłosława i polak wypada blado. Piwo prezentuje się świetnie, ma intrygujący aromat, ciekawy smak, który jawi mi się raz na pograniczu słodkości i karmelu (na początku degustacji), raz jako cierpki i gorzki. Na pewno pijalny i satysfakcjonujący. Nie dziwią mnie oceny tego piwa.

16.9 oz bottle pours hazy brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of sweet malts, dried fruit and toffee. Taste is malts, caramel, fruit and chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

P: Effervescent dark mahogany cola body with frothy cappuccino head that leaves lush lacing on the sides. 

S: Malt forward sweetness. Sweet toasted caramel malt, dark fruits, sugar plums, sugary pecan pound cake or fruit cake and caramelized brown sugar. A delicate spice character and chocolate syrup. 

T/M: A malt fest in my mouth that delivers a hefty palate of sweet flavor. Taste follows the nose and has a more developed bitter fruit peel and spice profile towards the end. Roasted malt creates a smokey undertone. Full velvety body with a sizzle of carbonation. Coffee, bourbon and baking cocoa in the back of the throat with a big swallow. 

O: I love this brewery. This is a huge explosion of malty goodness that leaves your palate wanting more. I would love to have this in a six pack. A beer I will surely revisit.
Havent tried many dopplebocks yet - but so far so good. Lots of sweetness, not as much yeast/bread as I expected. My new favorite "malt liquor" (can I buy it in a 40oz bottle?).

From 50 cl bottle. Deep brown color. Off white head. Aromas: sweet, herbal spicy, toffee. Retronasal theres drop/licorice, sweet malts, red fruit. Flavor is moderate to full sweet. Medium bodied. Flavor lingers. Too sweet (and not much else) for me.

Pours a deep ruby brown with a frothy cappuccino head that hangs around a while. Nose is malty. Tasty is nicely balanced malty sweetness with a hop accent that brings a nice finish. Medium body. Mild carbonation. Good brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The head is ok, the body black. It smells roasty, sweet, sour, old-cheese, strange. The taste is roasty, black-soft, sugary, strange, creamy, unbalanced.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2015 Korbinian boasts a whole lot of malty awesomeness. For a bock, its quite complex, too. Caramel sweetness makes the largest impression. The finish provides some nice variation. Its mildly hoppy and even a touch sour from the yeast. Weihenstephaners winter bock is a treat that deserves to be savored.

Poured from bottle to glass. Highly carbonated. Dark amber hue with off white fizzy head that dissipated to a thin ring. Aroma is floral, sugar, honey, banana, esters, caramel, yeast, bready. Mouthfeel is really nice with medium light body and good carbonation. Taste is sweet with a CO2 sharpness in the finish which really helps to round everything out. Overall this was a nice brew although it was bordering on being cloyingly sweet and a bit estery.
this is not my beer, I expected more bitterness / sweetnesss, henc it was sourish and way too fruity.

Malty aroma great taste for a doppelbock  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle @ home. Clear Nearly black color, brownish medium head. Aroma light caramel, strong malty, coffee, dark chocolate, roasty, dark fruit notes. Taste light sweetness, medium to heavy bitterness. Full body, lively carbon, fine medium lasting coffeeish bitter finish. Surprisingly good bock beer.

500ml bottle. Gently spiralling ruby supporting a fine tan collar. Heady black cherry, plum and chocolate aroma with subtle background shrub and leather. Boozy, peppery, slightly tongue-numbing on the palate with cocktail cherry, muscovado and yeast extract notes. Hot and sweet. Not bad.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish-brown with a tan head. Taste sweet, fruity, Carmel. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wasnt expecting so much resemblance in flavor to the Dutch double bock beers. Everything is in there, roasty and caramel flavors in a perfect balance of sweet and bitter. 0,5 liters of pleasure.

Bottle. Clear dark red pour with quickly receding tan foam. Aroma is fruity, cherry and toasted malt, light caramel notes, very clean. Taste is super clean, nice sweet caramel notes with a lasting toasty finish. Definitely on the doppelbock side of the strength spectrum without losing the drinkability of a lighter Bock bier. Very nice

Bottle on coldest night of year thus far. Pours brown with nice beige soapy head. Nose of sugar and malt. Tastes of figs, raisins, malty, toffee, licorice, and some earth. Light bitterness and smooth palate. Enjoyable even if Im pairing with a horrible football game.
Aroma: Hint of chocolate, malts, caramel Appearance: Dark brown, red glow, clear, off white head, full lace Taste: Caramel, roasted malts, no big body, little sweet after taste

Bottle. Dark brown color with a thin head. Aroma of sweet roasted malt and some peat. Sweet malty taste with salty licorice and syrup. Some bitterness in finish. Oily feel. Medium body.-- via beerbasher/winphone

On the bottle: 0442

Its brown with nice cherry tones and loosely packed large bubbles that are light tan and quick dissipating, leaving a lightly etched surface. Banana, vanilla, toast, caramel, touch of cola and gobs of nougat. Taste is plenty of malt, a touch of salinity, some sweet malts and bready dough. Seriously, this is a like a sweet dough pretzel - really dig the flavor, so unique and works really well. Medium on full bodied with moderate carb and a slightly wet finish. This is really well done.

Aroma is of caramel, chocolate, banana, dried fruits, and alcohol. Dark brown pour with a small tan head that is gone fast. It is a rich, satisfying, dessert style beer that is not too heavy. It has a complex malt character that would go well with many meat dishes. At 7.4% abv it packs a punch without being too much.
Dark brown color with a medium head. Yeast aroma, light banana and malty. Solid caramel and buttery malt flavor. Very thick feel.

Bottle from Bevmo. It pours a brown color with a fizzy tan head. The aroma is dark and bready with rich notes of cocoa, fig and very light roast. The flavor is the same. Rich and bready with raisins, cocoa, toast, fig and noticeable herbal noble hops. Full bodied, but more carbonation than I expected. Complex and tasty. Nice one.

0,5l bottle. Pours very dark red with beige head that doesnt stick around too long. Aroma of raisin, fig and candy fruites is not very strong. Flavour is similar, raisins and dry fruit. High levels of alcohol are felt (brandy flavour). Short predominantly sweet and a bit dry aftertaste.

Dark, ruby-red, yet clear beer with a nice slightly brown layer of foam. It has a sweet aroma of forest-fruits with a touch of alcohol. It tastes somewhat caramel-chocolate like and leaves an aftertaste of licorice.

Donker, robijnrood, doch helder bier met een lichtbruine schuimkraag. Het aroma is zoet als van bosvruchten, maar met een toets van alcohol. De smaak is caramel/chocolade achtig, en de nasmaak lijkt op die van drop.
Apart, maar wel lekker.

Bottle @ weihenstephaner, Berlin. Aroma piacevolmente tostato, sentori di caffè , di latte caldo zuccherato e frutta secca. Alcool presente non troppo pungente. Colore Marrone , riflessi rossi ramati / corvini , limpida. Schiuma beige abbastanza fine e persistente. Gusto abbastanza intenso, dolce, poi lievemente acidulo, poco amaro, solo un po tostato. Abbastanza calda, è una birra rotonda, di medio corpo, equilibrata nel nascondere il suo buon grado alcolico con buoni profumi e gusti tostati. Birra armonica

Appeareance is a deep brown reddish color. The aroma is sweet caramel, dried fruits, a little bit of alcohol. The taste follows the aroma, is sweet caramel, dried fruits, some bannana, and some earthy character in the finish. The mouthfeel is medium to full, kind of creamy. Overall, this is a very pleasant beer, first time and definitely not the last one, worth the money.

rood bruin helder met schuimige kaki kraag
aroma: caramout, gebrande mouten, chocolade
smaken: redelijk zoet, matig bitter, licht fruitig, redelijk moutig, zachte smaken, gebrande mout, caramel, rozijn
medium body, glad

Bottle - pours deep dark ruby with a big frothy off white head. Sweet malt aromas, getting a cola smell but that may be psychosomatic as it does have the same look as coke. Hints of molasses and burnt sugar. Smooth sweet taste with the sweetness from the malt coming through. Really nice smooth mouthfeel.
Middelmatig bokbier. Helder en kastanjebruin. Aroma van caramel, mouten. Bitterzoet. Zacht in de mond, laag co2, medium body.
Bottle at The Ale House, Chelmsford. Pours a dark brown colour, with a good size light brown head. Malt and dried fruit - raisin and prune - aromas. Medium body. Enjoable beer, very drinkable...

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is spicy, herbal, floral, yeast, vegetables, caramel and raisin. Taste is quite sweet. Not too sweet, luckily. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Decent doppelbock.

Great beer. Compared to the Schneider Aventinus, this is a bit heavier & a bit maltier to me. Just as good though!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
For lovers of strong and clean aromas of cereal and yeast, great taste and incredible and lasting aftertaste.
Blindprovad. Bra kropp. Knäckig och fin. Inslag av lite kolatoner. På provnng med "Janko"

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 Bottle: brown on the pour, closer to black in the glass with a light-tan head that fades slowly to a swampy & bubbly skin. Aroma is super sweet malt; cocoa powder, caramel, sticky molasses, hints of brown sugar coated dates, plums, and bruised raisins. Kiss of smoke in the finish with a light touch of anise. Taste is similar in complexity, with sweet & malty caramel, toffee, brown sugar & burnt molasses. Good amounts of mid-palate anise, black licorice, plums, dates, sugar-y raisins and quite a bit of finishing cocoa powder. Body is sticky and oily at the same time, just short of a creamy mouth feel. Well crafted doppelbock, Im just not the biggest fan of the style. Tasty, intriguing, complex, nebulous.
So easy to drink - not at all cloying - impressive dobbelbock for me - fruity aftertaste which pleases me - not over malty.
Transferring Beer Advocate rating here. I dont think this style is for me. I was not the biggest fan.

smells of grapes and strong dark fruits....(prunish)...great dark red color, taste is bold malt, medium-strong alcohol, lighter on fruits than smell perceived, slightly sour finish...not sweet at all...which hurts it a tad in my book
Donker wit. Ruikt lekker, maar smaakt beetje licht en niet heel lekker. Tijdens popquiz

Good sweet and dark German beer.............................................
 via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice roasty malty aroma. Smooth taste of malt, caramel, alcohol a tad. Mild carbonation to the finish. Good doppelbock specimen.
Pours clear dark brown with red hue. Aroma of chocolate malts, dark fruit, and booze. Taste is the same. Medium to full-bodied and sticky.

A true doppelbock without a doubt. Nice dark red nearly black color, almost the color of a raisin. Incidentally, the aroma is strong on fruit, reminds me of raisins or figs or something similar. Tasty is full and complex, seems to hit you in stages: begins with a strong straightforward malt flavor, then some coffee and/or toffee notes, concludes with a heavy fruit aftertaste. If you love a dominant but not overwhelming malty flavor you will love this beer. I personally don't care for the fruity flavors present in this beer, but I'm sure others will. Probably best paired with a meal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Dark brown-red bpdy, medium sized light tan head, spotty lacing. Caramel, prine, dark fruit, and some raisin notes. Medium bodied, gentle carbonation, semi-sweet finish.
August 2010. Redbrown color with a tan head. Sweet malty aromas with alcohol, fruit, spice and caramel. Balance is perfect.

A very nice doppelbock. Pours a beautiful deep red-black with a thick tan head. Smells like figs and some malt liquor. Taste is very thick, has some malt liquor up front and a smooth finish. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours reddish brown with a big off white head. Notes of toffee, vanilla and dark fruits in aroma. Somewhat perfumed. Heavy toffee notes in taste. Also notes of raisin, colve and cream with a herbal hoppy finish. A malt monster! Thick and smooth mouthfeel.

Aroma is full toasty malts and caramel. Excellent. Appearance is a dark mahogany with a nice big tan head. Beautiful. Taste starts out sweet and ends with malty undertones. Delicious. Palate is medium bodied that lasts on the tongue for awhile. Savory. Overall this beer completely lives up to the hype. Very well done. Outstanding
500 mL bottle into a pint mug at home. Very dark brown-black with a fine creamy head. Nice roasted malt aroma. Malty, smooth sweet chocolate roast, with a hint of smoked cheese.

Pours very dark brown with medium pale tan head. Aroma is light, sweet, very mild coffee. Tastes sweet, bread with little hops. Very good, not bitter. Full mouthfeel, very pleasant. Overall one of my favorite dopplebock style beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown body, light brown head. Aroma of malts, apples, peach, fig, cookies with a bit of bitterness. Taste is medium sweet, full-bodied, a bit cookie-like with roasted notes of coffee and caramel. The alcohol adds a fruity aftertaste.

Pint nine bottle poured dark brown with off white head that doesnt linger. Nice aroma of roasted malts, bread, sweet caramel. Medium bodied, flavor,was very good nice roasted malt flavor mixed with some sweetness. Flavor wise its not really caramel though, joust sweet from the malt. Very well balanced and delicious.

Bought a bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Has a dark brown colar and a large cream colored head, is highly carbonated. Aroma of caramel, bread and some dark fruits. Taste is a little sweet and creamy and has a light bitter in the aftertaste. I would definitely drink this one again. I my opion one of the better Doppelbocks.
Just had my first one. I will certainly get this again when I have a taste for a real good Bock. Love their original brew better, but this is a excellent change of pace beer.
Bottle pours deep brown, decent carbonation. Figgy malty aroma yields a similar flavor profile. Sweet but not cloying, earthy malty finish. Good hearty dopplebock, but not too heavy as some are.
Excellant full flavor, malty. A little alcohol aroma, slight in taste like a smooth bourbon. Sweet finish.

Color Rubí oscuro casi negro, espuma beige. Agradables aromas dulces y frutales
 En boca predominan las maltas tostadas, azúcar moreno y frutos rojos. Muy rica
Pours dark with an off white head that doesnt stick around too long. Nice rich caramel smell. Taste is a lovely roasted malt and caramel. Lovely texture.
Draught @ the German Club in RI. This is a serious doppel with lots of awesomeness.

Bottled October 20, 2012.
Appearance: The body has a beautiful color, crystal clear and garnet. The head is tall with moderate density, slowly settling into a dense light tan coating.
Aroma: Deep caramel and biscuit malt notes are backed by hints of raspberry and apple. The aroma is mild in presence, but smells malty with hints of fruit, perfect.
Taste: Bready and caramel malts are on the intro that become rather prominent by the end of the mid-taste where they are met by hints of cherry and apple by the finish. Nice!
Palate: Thick with mild carbonation.
Overall: This is a great doppelbock, I would love to try this fresher! Ill buy this often!

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a clear but deep brown with a thin latter colouted head. Aromas of fig, raisin, allspice, cinnamon, burnt sugar and dates. Taste starts off with dark fruit and rich malt, before a roasty bitterness kicks in. Richly sweet fruity finish thats just short of cloying. Medium to heavy body. A big beer but a good one.

16.9oz bottle poured into snifter. Pours mahogany brown (but not opaque) with a finger-thick head which reduces to a large ring. Aroma is of dried grapes, nutmeg, fruitcake and other indistinguishable dried fruits. Taste is heavily sweet, and finish is strangely a bit astringent...? Body is medium-full with light carbonation. This is my first true German doppelbock and I although I did choose a top rated brew on purpose, I still have to say that this is a pleasant surprise! Then again, theyve been brewing since 1040 soooo.....! You have to try this at least once!
Mucho aroma y sabor a café, pero no excesivo. No es una maravilla pero si os gustan este tipo de cervezas merece la pena probarla.
half liter bottle - pours brown with tan head and sparse lacing. Nose is caramel and toast. Flavor adds light chocolate. straight up malt. dry and goes down easy. light to medium sweet. short finish.
Room temp bottle. Dark orange brown, big head. Dirty liquorice coffee smell. Taste is old ale, frothy in the mouth with a raisin finish. Semi-sweet. OK, but nothing special.
Dark amber/brown with beautiful brown head. Aroma is malts, dark sugar. Taste is sweet, roasty, caramel. Good dubbelbock.
Bottle. Pours clear ruby, small tan head, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, toffee, touch of smoke, molasses. Flavor about the same, medium sweet, very low bitter. Medium body

The color is a very dark brown with a large off-white head, and the aroma is reminiscent of caramel and roasted malts, dough yeast, and smoke. The taste fuses a mildly umami flavor with a slightly sweet one, and the palate combines a medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, and a long, hearty finish.
Strong malty beer. Not cloingly sweet, but good malt backbone. Bready clean aroma. Toasty flavor well balanced against German hops. Good heady buzz from a pint on a hot day.

phenomenal, it pretty much tastes like christmas cake to me. its got the currants and other dark fruits, its got the deep, kinda brown sugaryness, its got the bready yeastiness, and its even got the alcoholism that every christmas cake must have. om nom nom!

First Doppelbock. Pleasantly surprised, totally understand why they call it "liquid bread" as it tastes like molasses and bread. Very sweet and heavy. I will probably wait til the the fall and winter months to try it again as it wasnt the best beer to have in the summer but still a very good beer.
Pours dark brown. Delicious, creamy and superb carbo. Very smooth and well-balanced. An outstanding beer.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Splendid deep brown colour, medium thin white foam. Deep malty flavour. Malt loaf. Full flavour. Some balancing hop in the finish, less cloying than many doppelbocks. Some rye bread and biscuits. Smooth. Enjoyable.

Delicious smell of fruity sweetness with a caramel chocolate bread overtone. The flavor is that of a delicious chocolate with dried plum. The head is tan and frothy. The palate is silky smooth with very little carbonation. Overall a delicious beer before bed or with a heavy dinner.

Pours a dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma is sweet and rich; a few notes of chocolate lightly alcoholic. Flavor is rich. chocolate along with dark fruits...raisins and prunes. Very smooth and creamy texture though. Fantastic.

50cl bottle from the brewery. Pours a deep brown colored body with a very slight ruby hue. Inch thick, dense, creamy and frothy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma has a really nice malt backing with roasts, caramels, and chocolates. Some raisin dark fruits, nuts, bananas, and bread. Flavor is similar. Caramels and chocolates, roasts, raisins, plums, banana-bread, nuts, and hints of vanilla. Finishes very smooth and clean with a light sweetness and a touch of toast. Lengthy aftertaste following a very smooth, medium body and a soft, creamy, moderate carbonation. Overall, an excellent doppelbock. So smooth and soft with an excellent balance. Great beer.

One of the best beers I have ever had. A rich copper coloured pour, clear, with a tan head. The aroma is dark malt, caramel, plums, and spices. Flavour is nicely balanced with a sweet malty tone, followed by toffee and a bitter finish.
Doppelbock, buen sabor y cuerpo con graduacion pero no dura de beber. Me gusta bastante

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2013 Pours a dark clear Brown off white head. Aroma is chocolate and nutty with a slight coffee note roasted malty note.  Taste follows the aroma with a medium smooth mouth feel. Nice lacing on the glass. Amazing Brown Ale!
Mooi donker bier. Tikkeltje zoet. Lekker bier. Caramel, chocolade, koffie. Verder niet heel bijzonder.

Pours a brons amber beer with a good white head. Smells pretty sweet. Some kind of fruit. Taste is also pretty sweet but not overpowering other flavours. I tast a bit coffee. A bit stoutish. I like the texture. Bit oily. Good carbo.
Dark brown pour with light tan head. Aroma is sweet brown sugar and raisin. Taste is malty and sweet. Creamy on the palate.
For a doppelbock this is a very good beer. Sweet, but not cloying. Honey and brown sugar. Excellent mouthfeel.

from bottle. pours a clear dark brown colour with a huge frothy tanned head. wonderful and complex aroma of roasted malts, caramel, brittle, brown sugar, hints of coffee and a touch of dark fruits. rather low carbonation, medium body and kind of oily mouthfeel. flavours of roasted malts, caramel and coffee with a high sweetness. maybe it is just a little bit to sweet, but that does not diminish the overall great impression. fantastic doppelbock!
Mild malty nose. Pale beige fast disappearing head. Clear red color. Malty and roasty caramel taste. Some hints of berries too. Bitterness at the end.
Dark reddish brown with a tan head. Smooth, sweet malty flavor with hints of caramel and nuts.

16.9oz bottle at Biergarten Haus in DC.  Pours a hazy, garnet amber with some thin, lacing, creamy , slightly off white head.  Nose was a nice balance of fruit and malt, dried fruits, raisins, prunes, caramel, a little booze, some tropical fruit, wet bread, nougat, some light cocoa powder.  Flavor is very similar, some brandy, bread, nougat, light chocolate, wet cracker, lots of prune, mixed fruit juice.  Full, sticky finish.  I really enjoyed this.
Deliciously sweet flavor with a little bit of smokey flavor.  This is a great beer for a cool day or as a dessert beer.  One of my favorite Weihenstephan beers.

Appears dark Burgundy in colour with a voluminous orange-cream coloured head. Gorgeous, full chocolately aromas with dates and carob (I hate carob). It is like taking a sniff of a chocolate cake with dark fruits in it. Utterly more-ish and I wish I could share this with my beloved mother who adores such things. The flavour is marked first by prickly sharp carbonation and then sharp astringent juiciness. It wasnt what I was expecting at all, not to say that I am disappointed. It has a just-ripening plumminess about it and then it sucks the liquid out of your mouth revealing tart redcurrant, raspberry and rhubarb. This mellows somewhat into dates, red apples, unripe apricot and thin treacle. An intriguing beer not for the faint of heart. A second taste uncovers chocolate and dusty cocoa. What an intrigue.

Draft at Bierstube. One of the best Dobbelbocks I have had. Silky black pour. Lasting foamy off-white head. Rotted pit fruit. Heather. Burnt Challah bread. Molasses. Cloves. Toffee. Sugar plums. Tootsie Rolls. Dark and juicy. Thick and sweet. Great stuff.

Dobry, smaczny i tresciwy ciemny podwojny kozlak. Czerwone odcienie i bezowa trwala piana. Karmelowy smak i nuta rodzynek orzecha i sliwki suszonej. Aromat gozdzikowo karmelowy. Smak pelny. Piwo bardzo tresciwe i troche ciezkie. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Receptura klasztorna dopieszczona do perfekcji. Polecam.
Dark amber pour with a big frothy head. Wonderful malty, caramel aromas. Big rich malt flavor. Abv is well hidden. Awesome dopplebock

Head: beige, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: really dark amber-brown.

Aroma: strong caramel, somewhat grassy? Taste: caramel, somewhat spicy  an pleasant alcohol background.
pretty good...  the sweet toffeed nose was my fave element here. nice clean dark lager shows some nice hops at the back. makes me hungry....

Cerveza muy oscura, con una densa corona de espuma. Olor afrutado. Sabor acaramelado, malteado, café, regaliz. Gran cuerpo y a pesar de no tener una muy alta graduación el alcohol está presenten en cada sorbo.

16.9 fl oz / 500mL bottle into a glass mug. Served chilled.

Aroma: Caramel, malt, maybe a little sweet milk chocolate. The smell reminds me of the Cadbury caramel eggs, but its nowhere near that sweet-smelling. Its just pretty strong caramel and malt.

Appearance: Very dark. Only translucent when held up to the light, where its revealed that this beer is truly a dark ruby red. Tan head that dissipates into nothing.

Taste: Sweet malt and caramel. Maybe just the tiniest hint of cream.

Palate: Creamy and smooth. Coats the palate, and flavors linger a little bit. You can feel the alcohol presence: this one warms quite a bit. Personally, I like a little more subtlety.

Overall: Pretty great doppelbock. Not a whole lot of diversity as far as flavors go. The Devastator by Wasatch definitely had a lot more flavors in it. This one is quite good though.
Dark brown, white foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma with notes of chocolate, honey, dark fruit. Sweet bitter aftertaste.

Pours dark ruby red with thick tan head. Aroma of dark rich malt with a bit of cider.  Taste is sweet and malty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

European beers are very different to the tongue of an American. We are all about our malts and hops, so much so that we forget about all the other wonderful ingredients and tastes that can make a beer.

Dark brown pour. Almost black. Small tan head that fades fast. No lacing. Malt and mineral aroma. Malty flavor with some notes of raisin. Sweet. Nice finish with some warmth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden syrup, molasses, treacle, raisin. Estery hint of banana. Holds the alcohol amazingly well
Brown pour with an off/white head. Aramo is sweet and malty with hints of fruit. Taste is sweet, malty, caramel and a bit of fruit. Decent beer.
Golden syrup aroma, sweet and smooth taste, cant believe its 7.4%, this ones a winner!
Bottle.  Molasses, black bread, prune aroma.  Chestnut brown with a large tan head. Sweet black bread, barley malt, and prune, and light spice flavor. Medium body, moderate carbonation.  Very tasty.
50cl bottle at home. An okay double bock, but I expected more from a Weihenstephanen. Too much carbonation I guess.

Bottle. Clear ruby colour with cream colour head. Spicy aroma - malt, wood, a little timber. Tastes very malty, deep, woody taste. Medium-to-full body, smooth yet carbonated. Very malty finish. Quite amazing.

This was a really good Doppelbock. Some have overpowering malt flavors and this was well balanced. Sweet malt smell of heavy grain. Deep chocolate color with a foamy head. Medium weight palate that was smooth and a little creamy. Moderate carbonation. Good roasted grains with a chocolate essence and some wood. There was a hops bitterness that finished it out. Give me another.

Malt is caramel, bread, toast, 
taste of dark plums sweet brown sugar/molasses.  A very nice body

Nice!  Pours a very dark brown with a off white head that last thru the beer.  A light aroma of malt.  First taste is sweet malt and roasted malt.  It is full and soft in your mouth.  Goes down easy with a malty aftertaste.  A very good beer!

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100220.
Pours dark brown color with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, some fruity notes and yeast. Flavor of roasted malts, caramel, yeast and toffee.

Presentation: One pint brown bottle served in a steidel.

Appearance: Beautiful, deep, rich, dark brown color that looks almost black. Turns a dark reddish hue when held up to the light. Develops a one and a half finger tan colored head that fizzles out into a thin ring. Very nice lacing throughout. 

Smell: Smells mainly of malt, and a bit of pie crust. Its a very pleasing aroma thats not overpowering.

Taste: Very smokey, with a lot of malt in there. Caramel and chocolate can be tasted as well. Its quite sweet. The mix and complexity of flavors is very nice.

Mouthfeel: Its strong and full-bodied, but very creamy and smooth to drink. Theres little carbonation and it has a sticky sweet finish.

Overall: Its a good beer to have with sweet desserts or to sip at night and enjoy it all by itself. A very interesting and complex taste, plus great texture make for a wonderful experience. Another high quality product from "The Worlds Oldest Brewery".
dark brown colour; brownish creamy head; aroma of roasted sugar and malt with hint of banana; taste of caramel, sweet bread, and coffee with some sourishness. OK beer from Germany
Rich malty with essence of chocolate and vanilla.  Sweet flavors of coffee and bananas.  Wonderful dark color with some carbonation and nice light brown head with good retention.

Much like the hefeweizen, the doppelbock is a style the Germans do best. I was excited to try Weihenstephaner Korbinian since its the doppelbock made by the worlds oldest brewery - how much more authentic can you get? And while its a good beer for sure, its not quite a great one. Still, theres a lot to enjoy and appreciate here.

I poured a 500ml bottle into a lager glass.

Appearance: Seemingly opaque brown hue, but actually a deep violet or ruby red. Forms a large, tan, soapy head which leaves some lacing and never completely dissipates.

Smell: Classic doppelbock aroma of pure malt essence, but milder than most. Dark fruit notes, but no alcohol. 

Taste: Weihenstephaner Korbinian starts out with a gentle delivery of dark fruit, molasses and a hint of chocolate on the finish. Its sweet, yes, but not cloying or sticky compared to some of the syrup-like bombs out there. A touch of bitterness or tang right on the finish, but not much in the way of actual hop character. Thats fine by me because its still a flavorful, appealing palate overall.

Its quite possible my bottle was a vintage, which might explain the surprising mildness of this brew. Thats not to excuse it for being less robust than I prefer, though. The palate still works well for what it is and what it should be. 

Drinkability: Though technically a lager, Weihenstephaner Korbinian drinks not only like an ale, but a cask ale. Amazingly soft and comfortable in the mouth with a smooth texture and ridiculously easy finish. A slightly sweet aftertaste, but nothing overbearing. The 7.4% ABV is well hidden, making this drink and feel like a lighter beer than it is. Still, one 500ml serving is the perfect amount.

0,5 l bottle from Ambrosetti, Berlin. Enjoyed at home. Clear, deep ruby colored body with a large, lasting, light brown, dense head. Good lacing. Rich, malty, wooden, pine-ish, boozy nose. Full bodied and a malty raisin sweetness. Well balanced bitterness. Refreshingly carbonated. Smooth to drink.

The beer is chestnut brown with a thin khaki hued collar. The aroma brings malt, yeast, light spice, brown bread. Rich and smooth with a mild sweetness. Hints of plums and raisins. A beautiful beer. Like every other Weihenstephaner brew I have tried, Korbinian delivers the goods. A great example of the style. A pleasure to sip and savor. I'll definitely be having this one again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer smells like a mash tun. Very malty and sweet. Pours almost black (slight brown hue) with white lacing head. Flavour is sweet with toasty notes

Slight coffee tones, lots of booze. Low carbonation with very syrupy consistency. Sweet aftertaste and malt in the aroma. Didnt like this as some of the companys other lines. Pours with no head, no lacing - dark syrupy black. Bottle at Taberna Lupulo

Bottle. Pours opaque deep cola brown with big light tan head and good lace. Nutty grainy malt characters over a light noble hop aroma. The malt character is up there with the best. Weve got a complex slick medium body of nuts, chocolate, toffee and grain, milky creamy mouthfeel and a satisfying finish that lingers. Medium carbonation, clean profile. beautiful beer.

Very nice. Dark color. Smooth taste. Pleasing aroma. I have found a new favorite.

0.5L bottle.  Dark cherry-cola color, clear, small persistent head, little lacing.  Aroma is candies, malts, and sweetbreads.  Mouthfeel is pleasant, full-bodied, and a little dry at the end.  The taste is predominantly sweet, a little too sweet for me, but definitely drinkable.  Evidently well-brewed - you might love it!

Pours a large frothy light brown head that mostly diminishes. Body is flat black. Aroma contains hay, roasted and nutty malts, molasses, orange, lemon, leather, grape, raisin, cherry, cassis, ruby port, brown sugar, licorice, forest fruits and spices. Flavor starts off acidic, to go to sweet and very light bitter. Body isedium, with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Good and refreshing!

Pours deep dark brown with an off white head.  Aroma is roast, dark chocolate and herbal.  Taste is sweet with some bitterness on the finish.  Smooth and slick texture, medium bodied with lighter carbonation then expected.
Bottle at hua hin, thailand. Clear and dark reddish brown color, big white head. Sweet malty and roasty aroma, yeast. Balanced taste, some hops, sweetness, roasted malts.
From bottle. Really flavorful dopplebock with strong chocolate hints and malty, almost grape tasting finish.
Bottle. Clear, dark brown color. Firm off-white head, stays. Caramel, sugary, malty, grainy aroma. Very lively mouthfeel. Caramel extract?, yeasty, malty flavor. Very messy beer.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016 Brown/black with thin, silky beige head. Strong aroma of roasted malt with very potent taste of chocolate and some espresso bitterness. Nice dry, lingering aftertaste, and no hint of the higher ABV. Delicious!

WoW! I really start to enjoy german dark riders. Malty, roasted, chocolate in aroma. Close to full body. Cherry, deep red, clear it looks, with medium creamy top, even leaving lacies. Taste - sweet, medium roast bitter. Very malty flavor. Dry finish, creamy texture,not simple flavor but not overcomplex to me. Overall - dark, malty breakfast in german manner, liked a lot.

50 cl. split with Kraddel. Reddish brown, off-white head. Smell is caramel, iron, sugar, age taking its toll on the beer, malts and some sweet wild herbs. Aroma is malty with syrupy notes, some caramel and chocolate. Flavour has caramel, some toffee, malty notes, syrup and raisins. Solid doppelbock without flaws, almost as good as Asam Bock.
Hell of a dopplebock full of malty aromas and delicious caramel notes. Pours a fizzy, thin brown without much viscosity to go around, but plenty of flavor. Nice job!

Aroma. .rich sweet malt, caramel, bready, ripe fruits.
Sweet with light bitter finish. Sticky mouth.
Nice beer, good brew. Bit too sweet thou - sweetness dominates other aspects

50cl bottle - sampled this the same day as Andechser Doppelbock - what an improvement: nice balance between malt caramel and roast, medium-full creamy mouthfeel, well-hidden ABV, eminently drinkable. One-dimensional like a traditional German Doppelbock, yes (it confidently belongs to a segregating beer era, that hadnt heard about layered Belgian dark ales and imperial stouts), but very enjoyable! Wish this was more easy to find at my local REWE/Edeka.

Poured a mahogany, almost black color with about a finger of khaki tan head that dissipated rather quickly. Very light lacing on the sides, pretty weak retention on the top.

Smelled a sharp whiff of malty alcohol right away. Very malty, including roasty, nutty, dark chocolate, toffee, dark fruit and some kind of liquor (maybe rum?) Late I got some smoky fire and coffee beans. Despite the high presence of alcohol, the flavors work together in the nose. 

Just a fantastic first taste. Still heavy with the malts, mainly dark fruit (cherry, plum, raisin, fig) and chocolate (not as dark as the smell). A little bit roasty and toffee, ending with a lingering bitter but smooth finish.

Medium body. Slick texture. Soft (below average) carbonation. Long bitter and smooth finish.

Flavor is lightly sweet burnt biscuit, light roasted malt, and toffee.  Finishes relatively dry, toasty, and somewhat nutty.  Very much on the dark side of a the doppelbock scale.  Smooth but relatively lackluster in character.

Bottle. Pours chestnut brown with an off-white head. Aroma is of bready yeast and sweet, sweet candy. The flavour has dried pruney sweetness and lots of caramel. Its a boozy effort and yet very smooth. There was lots going on with this one and it didnt disappoint. Very tasty.

Pours rich dark brown with a slight amber Hugh and supports a small, but lasting tan head.

The aroma is decidedly malty with hints of chocolate caramel, and roasted coffee.  The flavor is a clean, intense maltiness that lingers and fades into a very nice toasty, malty aftertaste.  This is a cold weather brew with a 7.4% abv that would be a good choice for a brew to enjoy with  sizzling, broiled steak!
Poured dark brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of sweet roast caramel malt, flavour similar with a hint of coffee.
Draught at Black Door, Helsinki. Colour is reddish copper with tiny white head. Aromas and flavours are plums, raisins and sweet malts. Strange, quite belgish without Belgian yeast.
This is one of the most flavorful Dunkels I have ever came on contact with.  Smooth with a lovely aftertaste. I would highly recommend this brew.

Very mellow, a well rounded beer that tastes a little like au jus (but i mean that in a positive way - sweet and savory)-which could be why it goes so well with steak and roast beef. It poured a dark reddish/brown color with a small white head. The aroma was roasty with some dark fruit, nuts and caramel. The taste was similar to the aroma, with some lingering sweetness. It was a full body beer with soft carbonation. Very complex and enjoyable. Good stuff.

Bottle (500 ml). Dark amber with a small beige head and little lacing. Aroma of malt and dark fruits with notes of smoke, roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is of chocolate, malt,caramel, dark fruits and nuts. Both taste and aroma are smooth and delicate. Slight warming alcohol feeling. This beer is all about balance and quite different from other great beer of the same style (Ayinger, Trois Mousquetaires). Very good doppelbock!
This is a ridiculously good beer, tan pour white head, slight yeast vegemite aroma. Nice dark sugar/toffee flavor with a mid bitter finish and has a small amount of heat.

I love the doppelbock style, and I think that this beer is one of the best. Perfectly balanced, its very dark amber colour, its small but steady head and its almost oily texture announces to the perfection what comes afterwards: full bodied, mouthfeel and aromas to caramel, coffee, roasted malts and toffee...Great beer, though a little bit complex (as it must be!).

ABV 7,4%. Bottle of 500 ml. Made of water, barleymalt and hops.
Poured into a weizen glass. Very dark brown colour, two and a half fingers of off-white head with average retention.Lots of activity in the glass.
Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, toffee.
A great taste of toffee, quite sweet and malty. Roasted malts on the aftertaste, along with bitter dark chocolate.
Full body and although when I poured it seemed to have a hell of a carbonation, the fact is carbonation is just as much as its needed.
Very nice beer, I was a bit disappointed by the foams retention, as I wasnt expecting to go down that fast, but everything else is making up for it.

Bottle from Market of Choice, Eugene. Pours a reddish brown with slight head, medium tan in color. Sweet, powerfully malty aroma. Creamy body and well balanced, not nearly as sweet as the aroma might have you guessing. Smooth and delicious, really one of the best Ive had of the style.

Dark redish brown, clear, with huge beige foam head. Lacing to glass. Aroma is dark chocolate barley, malty with traces of toffee. Taste is not sweet, but also not too bitter. Coffee, toffee, but again not sweet at all. Short dry aftertaste, a decent beer. (Velp 201211)
This is a very good beer just too raisiny for my liking. Everything else is great, mouthfeel, appearance, you name it. Probably needs to go with food.

Dark brown with nice white head.  Musty barnyard funk smell. Smooth taste and nice funk and brown sugar a little dark fruit. Nice. Enjoyed.

Dark brown small head dissipates. Aromas of bread dough, chocolate, dark red fruit cherry. Very doughy taste full mouth feel sticky sweet but goes with the style. Great on a cold fall night.

From 50cl bottle bought @ La Birrreria (Andorra). Clear ruby brown body with a small noisy beige head that doesnt last long, leaving little lacing. Roasted malt, bread, caramel, plum, raisin, licorice in the aroma. Lots of complexity that evolves with temperature, coffee and chocolate appearing when warmer. Medium sweet, light bitter. Full body wih a creamy texture and soft carbonation. It hides its alcohol content quite well and provides with a long coffee finish. A brilliant doppelbock, with lots of body, complexity and character, but also very drinkable which sometimes is a problem for such strong beers. Ill be back to it!
Aroma of licorice, raisins, prunes and chocolate.   Pours black with beige head.  Taste is classic doppelbock.  Notes of ginger snap, dark fruits, slight smokey chocolate.  Great beer!

500ml bottle served in a pilsner glass.

A: Pours a very dark brown with a one finger light tan head forming on the pour. The head recedes to a thick collar and thin film.

S: Thick bready malts, a little bit of toasted biscuit, brown sugar and molasses all fill the nose. Very rich. A touch nutty as well.

T: Dark bready malts with a nice wave of burnt brown sugar and molasses. A raisin bread like taste lingers on the backend and there is a hint of spice as well.

M: Heavy bodied and creamy with a coating quality to it. The carbonation is low, but not lacking.

O: The raisin bread like taste is a nice touch and it is just overall a very solid beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-08-2012

16.9 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear, very dark red.  So dark, it is almost black.  Head is light-tan and almost non-existent.  Aroma is subdued with hints of sweet licorice and cookie dough.  Taste is sweet with flavors of molasses, coffee, and caramel.  Full-bodied with a slightly creamy texture.  Carbonation is soft and the finish is long but not overpowering.

Due to its sweetness, this is not a beer that I would recommend to have more than one at a time.  However, that doesnt mean that I wont be drinking this again.  This is a great beer and I look forward to having another one in the very near future.
On tap. Very dark brown with a fizzy off white head. Sweet brown sugar and molasses malty aroma and taste with dry roasted cereal grain notes. Very good.

16.9 oz bottle. Gorgeous pour, off white head, very mild. Aroma is sweet - Licorice and dark fruit. Deep red color, black in dim light. Taste is an immediate complexity. Malty, caramel, bread.  Comes together perfectly for a smooth finish. 

A triumph of a Dopplebock from the oldest brewery on the planet. Bravo.

500ml bottle. Pours dark dark copper, clear, lively off-white head, spotty lacing. Aroma is dark fruits, little yeast, brown sugar. Flavor is sugary, malty. Creamy mouthfeel and a middling carbonation. A little alcohol burn on the end. Another good one from Veyenstefaner.
16.9oz bottle. Excellent example of a doppelbock.  Love that malt backbone!  Some dough is evident on the back end.  Little hot.

Pours a copper-ruby with tints of brown and rose, and its head was silky, three-to-four fingers in length and had the texture of old milk. Smelt of heat, traditional yeast, dark fruits, burnt sugar, and black olive juice on the finish. Tastes of light candi sugar right away, followed by cucumber, yeast, plum meat, cardboard, aged wood and with a lingering alcohol presence. Not too bad.

Bottle at BeerStore, Thessaloniki: Dark red colour with medium, tanned head. Aroma of caramel, butterscotch, bread, cereals. Taste of butterscotch, nuts, toast. A bread-y taste, I would say. Medium carbonation with medium body and long aftertaste. Overall, I loved this Doppelbock. Ill try it again for sure.

Aroma is malt forward - dark fruit and roasted malts. A dark brown pour with a mostly diminishing tan head. Taste is nutty, roasted malts and a bready quality. Medium bodied with minimal carbonation. Overall, this is a a very smooth and enjoyable Doppelbock.. Would drink again.
Bottle. Pours brown orange with good white head. Good aroma with hints of yeast and banana. Good aftertaste. A good beer

A strong presence of sweet brown sugar, roasted malts and hop in the taste. A good warm and dry finish. I liked it.

Medium-bodied with smooth, almost buttery carbonation on the palate.. well-balanced.. good stuff!

Head: delicate beige colored foam. Color: dark brown. Aroma: roasted malt, coffee candy. Taste: roasted malt, sweet, some bitter, coffee candy. Palate: medium bitter-sweet finish, low CO2. Overall: very nice

Shared tall brown bottle from Whole Foods into half-pint glasses. It poured a nice dark reddish-brown color with creamy, somewhat persistent tan foam and a little lace. Sweet grains, caramel, faint noble hops, slightly earthy and peppery. Balance definitely tips toward sweetness. Overall effect was suprisingly neutral. Some alcohol heat, but not offensive. True-to-style doppelbock. No flaws. Undoubtedly well-crafted, but perhaps not as distinctive and delicious as Id hoped.

Pours dark mahogany with a small khaki head. Smells malty, of dark fruits, candy sugar, and hints of caramel. Taste is sweet, but not overly so, dark fruits, and caramel. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Weihenstephaner Korbinian finishes with a little lingering sweetness.
0.5l bottle. Dark ruby body, off-white head. Reisiny, caramelly, coffeeish aroma. Plums, reisins, dark malt in the flavor. A very good beer.

Dark red brown body, off white head. Nice malty aroma with smoke, caramel, licorice, brown sugar, a hint of smoked meat. Incredibly easy drinking and soft palate, alcohol very well hidden. Great sweet flavour with caramel, some chocolate and cereal, that doesnt go overboard. Excellent.
