UPDATED: DEC 18, 2015 Aroma has lots sweet malting, butterscotch, vanilla, milk chocolate, ash, fruits under this. Nuanced and great aroma. Dark red/brown, almost black, creamy beige head is one finger and long and leaves nice lacing. Taste has chocolate, butter, fruit, mocca, caramel, lightly roasted coffee, ash, alcohol as warmth mostly. Medium body and soft carbonation, sweet, long and tasty finish, creamy soft palate. Retasted as tap version this time. D*mn good beer. Recommended warmly. Advent calendar beer 18.

500 ml bottle from Whole Foods Market, SoMa, San Francisco, CA. Pours a dark brown/mahogany color with a creamy tan head with medium retention. Aroma is malty with a noble hop balance. Notes of caramel, cherries, burnt sugar, caramelized apples and liquor cherry-chocolate. Taste is sweet with some fruitiness. Light herbal notes appear in the back. Great, sligthly subdued finish but lingering and gorgeous aftertaste. Medium to big body, alcohol finely concealed. Low carbonation. Highly refined, uncovering new flavors until the last sip.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 Goed dat dit bier in een halve liter fles zit.....  Een behoorlijke bom dit. Donker, goede kraag. Ruikt naar stroop, cacao, koffie. Smaakt dik en zwaar,veel body. Ik proef stroop, Koffie, donkergebrande mout. Lekker bier, maar niet eentje die je goed doordrinkt.
Dark and smooth with roasted chocolate notes.  Rich, sweet malt flavor. Light bitterness and carbonation.

Bottle 500ml @ CBF 2012
Pours deep amber/brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, chocolate, bread, caramel and wheat. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long malty sweet finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle: Be blessed: Saint Corbinian (c. 670  September 8, c. 730) was a Frankish bishop. His feast day is September 8. The commemoration of the translation of his relics is November 20.

Found some old phone ratings. Pours a deep brown/mahogany with a small white head. Nose is chocolate malts, nuts, caramel, bread, and touches of dark fruits. Medium-full bodied with chocolate, roast, bread and lighter touches of dark fruit. Light bitterness in the finish. Mighty tasty beer.

Pours deep brown with a sturdy tan head.
Nose is caramel, breadheel, plum, dark fruit....quite a lot going on....
Taste is raisin, breads, brown sugar,
roasted malt, a little chocolate/coffee.
Very complex......
An after-dinner treat if there ever was one.
Absolutely wonderful.

Bottle, from Auchan Titan, Bucharest.

Dark brown colour, long beige head.

Aroma has notes of coffee, caramel, dried plums, raisins, fresh bread, bitter cherries jam, buckthorn syrup, baked apples.

Sweety  taste, creamy texture, full body, perfect carbonation, bittersweet aftertaste.

The alchohol is hidden very well.

Thats an extraordinary beer!

03-JUN-2012, bottle @home, from "Fish @ Beer", thx Minitøser. 
Dark but clear brown with lasting creamy head. 
Quite roasted with coffee and chocolate. Malty bready with a little sweetness. Creamy and full. Finish a little bitter  very tasty:-)

Bottle from Purvis in a tulip glass.

Dark brown with medium head, good retention.

Olives on the nose. Roast malt and some berry on the palate.

Bottle from Total Wine. Deep ruby colour with thin deep beige head. Lovely fruity malt aroma. Good dark beer with good dark cherry/plum/grapey flavour. Bit bready, some roasty toasty malts. full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish.
Bottle 50cl. Dark ruby coloured oily brew with small but very firm head. Wonderful complex aroma, dark raisins, nuts, dark chocolate. Wonderful brew from this great brewery!
Some brown head, dark brown colour. Very light nose. Soft and medium body and some length. Chockolate and soft espresso.
Full of dark, roasty fruit.  Its heavy and delicious.  Brings forth the saying "a meal in a bottle"

Very good. The nose is caramel toward the burnt sugar range. There are also notes of roast nuts and a touch of chocolate. The neer is the deepest brown with a fading fizzy head. The taste is sweet with only a mild touch of bitterness. The beer is full bodied and very smooth. Fantastic.
Bottle poured a dark red brown color, aromas of roast, nuts,dark fruit, some caramel.  Flavors are the same with some bozzy aftertaste. Decent beer overall.
Hazy dark brown, nice light brown head. Great roasted malts, caramel sweetness and some banana.  Tastes better than it smell, smell is too sweet. Ok body (bit sticky), soft carbo.
Dark brown with small head. Aroma roast malt, coffee, chocolate. Taste sweet roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. Light/ Medium body, text smooth. A bit thin in character.

From 0.5l bottle @ Ølfestival København 2012. A deep deep ruby beer, quickly sidesticking off-white. Aroma is light burned and caramel sweet, some cold coffee. It has a average carbo level and a oily to sticky Texture. Light sweet flavors with dark caramel and some nice suiting fruity and boozy warming tones in the finish. Yupp, I liked this! 10.05.2012
Bottle at DØE. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and fruit.

Pours a deep nearly opaquee chestnut brown that when held to light has a beet purple high lights.Sitting on top youll find pretty tall dense fluffy cloud of foam. Carbs were a bit average. Aroma is rich and malty with some candied sugar, dark fruits, molasses, licorise. Taste is of robust malts, some roasted, fruits candied plums, chocolate and pumpernickel.
Very smooth and easy drinking, clean and soft on the palette.
An excellent, excellant beer

Dark reddish brown with a tiny head that doesnt last. Roasty aroma with dark fruit, nuts, and caramel. Bold flavor which is similar to the aroma, with some lingering sweetness. Full body with soft carbonation. Very complex and enjoyable. Great doppelbock.

Sharp, estery aroma of dark fruits (plums, figs), a bit of booze, sapote, raisins, yeasty undertones, and dark malts. It pours a see-through, dark brown with a big, fizzy head that deflates quickly. The palate is sleek and smooth. The taste is like the aroma, only with a more pronounced roasted character. Tasty and balanced.
Tap at doner - I forgot to write my review at the time, but I enjoyed the meatiness of the dobbelbock. Went perfectly with the brat I had at Mai Fest.

Bottle 0,5 l at "La 100 de beri" 
Appearance: Clear dark brown color with a small, frothy, good lacing, beige head. 
Aroma: -moderate to high- roasted malts, loads of caramel, chocolate, dried fruits  
Taste:high sweet with a moderate bitter finish 
Palate:Body is full, texture is syrupy, carbonation is average.
Overall: Too much on the sweet side.

Dark brown pour with a very light head. Doesnt look overly impressive. Smells like a malt heavy brew with some pleasant spice and caramel. Tastes good. Not a malt bomb at all. Refreshing. Good palate. Not heavy. Almost light for a doppelbock but I like it. Pretty easy to drink. I prefer a bigger style, but this is pretty freaking good.

pours opaque brown with thin tan head.not much lacing on the glass,aroma is faint but has some malt,smoke and cherries.flavor is roasted malt,candied sugar and soy sauce.moderate carbonation with a 
dry bitter finish.starts off sweet and becomes rather dry.flavor seems to be a little flat for me but nothing to complain about.
Pours brown ..foamy brown head...aroma of raisen and coffee..taste is good..very smooth  ..some coffe and fruit ..would do again ..interesting
Pours dark brown and clear with a moderate-sized head. Great malty notes to it with a strong malty taste, but clean finish.

Brown half litre bottle, obtained in Berlin earlier in the year, best before 30th July 2009, drank on a sunny warm evening in late June 2009.

Poured into huge glass mug.

Teak wood red, a deep mahogany brown, you choose the colour you like best. A thick tan coloured head sat on top. Held to the light it showed a clear body with bubbles rising to the head.

Liquorice aroma and taste, with Victoria Plums and dates in both the smell and taste too. A sweetness is also present, mixed in with a dark chocolate aftertaste.

This a very complex beer, the 7.4% is well hidden, the beer being very more-ish, I wanted another as soon as Id finished this one.

This is very close to beer heaven for me, a rich, creamy, well balanced strong Doppelbock that just rolls down the tongue and screams drink me!

The beer pours a dark brown color with an off-white head. The aroma has a great mix of fruit and malt. I get some nice cherry, grape and prune notes, as well as some heavy toffee. The flavor is very similar. There is a ton of toffee and caramel as well as some cherry and grape characteristics. The body is a little thinner than I expected, but it does have a very nice, clean lager taste. Medium carbonation.
Tap. Red brown pour with a dissappearing tan head. Malt and dark fruit on the nose. Chocolate, prune and figs.

Pretty good. Almost seemed like a stout to me. Chocolatey. 

Bottle from wine expo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mocha aroma and taste -- full and slightly creamy, almost an ale-like quality to this.  Lacks the bitterness of some other doppelbocks, but this one is top-quality.
Bottle at the fiddler.  Brown clear pour with a tan head.  Aroma is sweet malt, caramel and raisins.  Flavour dominated by sweetness, some malt and overripe fruit with a long sweet cloying finish.

[ASPETTO] 			
marrone scuro, con  un leggero tono porpora controluce, limpida senza residui			
[SCHIUMA]			
color beige, media presenza, fine e buona persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
profumi di malto tostato, con sentori di miele, melassa; tra le righe si avverte qualche nota torrefatta che ricorda caffè. Accompagna una soave fruttato, tendente verso frutta secca, un leggerissimo sentore alcolico chiude il cerchio.			
[GUSTO]			
tendenzialmente dominata da note dolci, ancora zucchero candito, miele, cioccolato . In un secondo momento calano parzialemte i toni, lasciando trapelare una leggera astringenza futtale con toni di frutta sottospitiro, complice una alcolicità presente ma rispettosa. sul finale si avvertono maggiormente le sfumature tostate avvertite anche la naso, lasciando un finale che comparte il residuo dolce iniziale con  una timido amaro che ricorda caffè e cioccolato amaro. si accodano sentori spaziati e una alcolicità liquorosa.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, vellutata, carbonazione media che alleggerisce in parte il palato, alcohol presente			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
doppelbock complessa e dinamica. Giustamente ben maltata, dolce ma che grazie a toni tostati e una speziatura finale mantiene un certo dinamismo in bocca senza stancare. Birra consistente, il mezzo litro si gode fino in fondo ma è più che sufficente in quanto il buon corpo riempe e impasta la bocca. qualche nota amara in più ed un dolce zuccheroso meno evidente la avvicinerebbero alla perfezione.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2012 Dark ruby color with a tall tan head. Malty aroma. Taste is caramel, ripe fruits. Medium body, lively carbonation. Dry finish. What a beer! Long Live Germany! Thanks cesaro202 for sharing

Excellent brew from the worlds oldest brewery. Solid beer that is not for those who dont want to relax and enjoy their beer instead of downing 3 or 4 in a sitting. Very drinkable, definitely looking forward to another go at this one.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2016 On tap at Hofbraukeller in Munich. Sampled at Starkbierzet 2012. Served in a dumpled mug. Deep dark ruby colour, light sweetiness, well-hidden alcohol. Great one dedicated to the woman like Charlie. Revisited at Starkbierzeit 2016. Feketére pörkölt dió utóíze van. Közbe is az, hosszan tartó.

Pours a dark cola brown with a two finger tan head. Smell malty with notes of sweet wood. Taste is toasty, malty sweet, and bit of smoke. Med-light bodied. Sweet after taste with some toasty bitterness. Smooth, tasty, and unique amongst other beer styles.

500ml bottle from "Lifesource",Salem. $3.49
Cant believe this is another "classic" I have not rated yet.
Gorgeous looking beer..dark brown body( slightly hazy) with a terrific thick,tight creamy tan head.
Very malt driven aromas..caramel,chocolate,rum soaked figs,chesnuts.
Taste is the same..but with added double creaminess.
Great smooth and luscious palate on this baby!
Excellent dopplebock and at an excellent price!
Bottle from Ale Yeah! in Decatur, GA. Deliciously dark, full flavored, and dry.

Weihenstephaner Korbinian has a thin, beige head and an opaque, dark, reddish-brown appearance. The aroma is an initial rush of banana, but then one picks up dark fruit and malt. Taste is of dark, over-ripe fruit, malt, figs, and just a touch of bitterness (did not seem as bitter as a 32 IBU). Mouthfeel is medium to heavy, and Weihenstephaner Korbinian finishes wet and dense. RJT
caramel, chocolate, roasty, floral, alcohol, black, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle from Mike12da. Thanks. Yeasty with a deep pleasant roastiness. Dark brown with ruby highlights. Thick, slowly diminishing head. Mild, buttery sweet malt flavors. Medium chewy body. A very solid doppelbock, malty and sweet.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2012 This is my type of doppelbock.  A wheat doppelbock at that.  What I am learning about Doppelbocks (in general) is that many places dont view it the same as what I, Ayinger, Weihenstephaner, Spaten, et al. do.  Many so called doppelbocks are nothing more than slightly hearty bocks...if that.  This is a great example of how to make a wheat version.

For Number 300 we require something special. This big German bock ought to do it. This beer self identifies as dunkles starckbier, but also says malt liquor on the label. It has the aroma of chocolate bread, brown sugar, stewed vegetables and licorice. Very imposing, though not that appetizing. Its ruby brown and an aggressive pour couldnt produce a head. Flavor is delicious bitter chocolate and maybe marzipan. Very thick and filling, not overwhelmingly strong for a doppel. A great representative of the style.
50 cl. bottle @ home. red brown with a dense tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Bit of a stout like experience to me but richer and more fullfilling.  Another great German beer.
Here is what you can hope for.  Maltiness balanced by hops, smooth & tasty. Not a quick beer to drink but absolutely delicious.

NCAA 2012
Aroma - Slight malt
Appearance - Very dark, clear, no head
Taste - strong flavor, well balanced doppelbock
Palate - Slightly bitter finish
Overall - A very good doppelbock
Pour is dark brown with tan head nose is caramel, bready,light malts..Taste is bready, caramel, spice, earth..palate is light , with bready, caramel after taste

Bottle. Rating #1058. Hazy dark brown pour with a nice tan head. Odd aroma, seems a little off to me, kind of a metallic fruitiness. Sweet up front but it had a bit of a light sourness. Something is not right. (2257)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Pours a dark brown with thick beige head.  Strong coffee malty aroma.  Sweet flavor.  Nice creamy mouthfeel with a smooth finish.  This is pretty good.
Brown in colour with off white head. Sweet roasted malts flavour. A touch of coffee. Sweet and tasty. Nice beer.

Bottle.  Appearance is a dark brownish red with a big tan head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is plum, dark cherry and sweet malts.  Taste is sweet malts, and tartness among other things.   The level of carbonation and body are at a medium level.  On a side note, a lager cleanliness is also evident.
Draft pours dark brown to black little to no head slight chocolate aroma rich malty flavor dark cherry and chocolate medium to full body

Bottle. Clear, deep, dark brown with a foamy, light tan head. Aroma is rich and malty, dark bread, molasses and some light chocolate notes. Flavor is rich, dark, malt without being too sweet, minimal hop bitterness and alcohol is well hidden. Medium to full body with average carbonation and a smooth, thick mouth feel. Great beer, like bread in a glass.
Een donker en zoet bier met weinig complexiteit, weinig aroma en weinig nasmaak. Vrij rechttoe rechtaan.
Dark colour. Chocolate aroma. Taste is caramel and dark fruits. Alchohol is not detectable. Nice beer.

pours the darkest of ambers with a fluffy off white head that dissipates rather quickly, aromas are roasted malts and that beautiful weihenstephaner yeast. the taste magnifies the aroma, with biscuity and caramel malt flavors without being overly heavy and rich like other beers in ths style. even my wife who doesnt like dark beers enjoyed this one.
Wonderful dark beer, perfect and heavy for a cold winters night. Ideal for rich dinners or to relax by the fire.

Pours a dark color with a good head.
Aromas of caramel and dark fruits. 
Sweet taste with all the dark fruits and caramel.
Nice on the palate as well. Alcohol is hidden good.
Nice beer.
Pours a deep red-brown with a large tan head.  Smells of bread, nuts, roasty.   Tastes malty-sweet, like a sweetened whole grain bread.  Delicious

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2012 Poured from a bottle into a goblet.  From notes.  Originally reviewed 12/9/2008.

Chocolate and chestnut colors with a good-sized tan colored head. Midway through the glass, a dark cherry color appears as well.

Roasted malt is the most predominant smell, along with figs and molasses. A very pleasant aroma.

The malt is the overpowering taste at first, with its roasted flavors. Then figs, raisins, and molasses come along for the ride. A small amount of alcohol and hops sneak in toward the end, but at the end the malt reminds you it is in charge.

This is one very smooth. It is definitely carbonated enough to keep a good head, but it has such a creamy finish. Wonderful. 

With the great smooth taste, it is the type of beer that can quickly disappear from your reserves. A good job making it full enough to counteract the higher alcohol.

(bottle)  Poured a black-ruby (think Cola..but I prefer to think of a Schwarzbier!)  Initially had a rich sweet aroma and creamy head.  The head soon subsided leaving a few sparse bubbles of carbonation.  This was to be expected in a beer of this gravity.  Insanely sweet malt up front.  Almost grapelike. Smooth.  First half of the glass was very pleasant.  The finish was initially smooth also but faded to reveal a faint hop bitterness.
No wonder the monks liked their Doppelbocks...

Appearance was clear blackish with red hues around the edges,3 finger head with lasting lacing creamy foam.Aroma was heavenly with touches of caramel, choco with slights hops.Taste was about the malts with a feel of bready pumpkinickel.Mouthfeel was smooth creamy carbonation with a rich full brew thats hard to be beat.7.4% alcohol was hard to find.  Smooth and thick...

Korbinian pours a deep mahogany with ruby edges. The aroma is caramel and a hint of raisin. The first sip, and you know this is special. Remarkably smooth, full, and creamy, the caramel, dark chocolate, and toffee flavors completely coat the mouth. The hops make a bit of an appearance, but this is, as it should be, a beer that is all about the malt. The 7.4% ABV warms just a bit as it goes down.

Love this beer. Full of delicious flavor, creamy mouthfeel, nicely balanced with the hops. Flawless.

On draft at the Ratskellar - Pawtucket, RI. A pleasing pilsner malt and crisp lager nose supported with a great dark roast character. Flavors roll out with dry chocolate, bits of coffee, and fantastic roasted nuts. Rich and brown. Dry and balanced. A really smooth and refined doppelbock with great toasted and roasted malt flavors. So nice to have it fresh on draught.

black/ super dark brown with small tan head. aroma of sweet malt and dried figs. taste is sweet with dried fruit flavors, smooth. sweetness is just right. finish is moderate with the sweetness dissipating nicely. overall a very solid doppelbock but doesnt have the complexity of Ayingers Celebrator.

50cl bottle. Dark brown coloured with a creamy tan head. Aroma is caramelish, sweet, moderate toasty. Flavour has buttery notes, slightly burnt sugar, sweet at the beginning the final is moderate bittery. Some chocolate and bread traces are present. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium to high. Texture is oily.

The first time I saw this in a store, I was turned off by the bottle that says "contains 1 pint, 0.9 oz, MALT LIQUOR"  It is really a doppelbock, which is becoming my favorite style. Pours a very dark brown with a little red coming through when you hold it to a light.  Creamy tan head lingers and laces.  Smells of caramel and roasted malts. Aroma is the same, with hints of chocolate, bread, and dark fruits (which is unusual for this style).  Taste is both bitter and sweet but not extreme in either direction.  Mouthfeel is very creamy with just enough carbonation to tingle the tongue a bit.  Aftertaste is minimal but very satisfying. I will definitely check this one out again.

Bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours unclear dark brown with a big creamy off-white head.Aroma of sweet dark malts and caramel. Taste is sweet malty, light roasted. dark dried fruits. Smooth and super soft mouthfeel. Light syrupy turns more light roasted, delicious Doppel

On tap at Jackie-Os, for $6 a pint. Deep, dark red/brown color. Creamy-looking tan head. Lighter, crisp carbonation. Bigger, creamier body, but its very smooth. Nice, smoky malty aroma, with dark fruit, dates. Very good in the nose, lasting through the aftertaste for quite a bit. Nice savory taste, little bitterness.
Dark amber color. Tastes sweet with caramel and strong maltiness. Pretty good, but I might need to try more doppelbocks to become accustomed to this taste.

Pours the color of burnt caramel. Creamy off white head which dissipates into nice lacing. Aromas include coffee, but on the palate, there is an earthiness and a dark chocolate bitter finish along with very nice roasted malts. Sweetness reminiscent of dark chocolate frosting. Definitely some complexity to this awesome beer. I could drink this all night long.

(Flasche) Es hat eine sehr, sehr dunkle, braune Färbung, mit einem kleinen Rotstich. Es scheint klar filtriert zu sein und es hat eine weiße Schaumkrone. Beim Aroma kommt einem zuerst eine Röstnote entgegen, gefolgt von einem karamellig-malzigen Hintergrund. Der Geschmack ist sehr Volllmundig, malzig bis süß mit einer leichten Bittere. Der Abgang ist leicht adstringierend und bitter. Es ist überraschend spritzig karbonisiert. Zusammengefasst; ein deftig gutes Bier für einen defitg, guten Abend.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2012 2012-09-21
50cl. Bottle.
Poors dark brown/amber with almost white head.
Aroma malts, yeast, dome banana, caramel, dark dried fruits.
Taste brown sugar dark sweet, small bitter.
Mouth-feel creamy.
Great doppelbock to start the autumn.

2012-01-14
Aroma sweet. Nice bockbeer sweet little bitter nice finish. Clear dark amber color. At het brouwcafe

Bottle.  Pours dark orange/amber with a large, beige head.  Sweet aroma with notes of overripe fruit, caramel and roasted malts.  Sweet and bready flavor with caramel, roasted malt and dark, overripe fruit notes.  Some alcohol in the finish, but decent.

Clear dark amber with a huge beige good lasting head. Sweet aroma with overripe rotten fruits, roasted malt and caramel notes. Sweet flavour with roasted malt, rye bread, caramel and overripe fruits. Warming alcohol towards the end.

3/I/2012 50cl bottle @ Klaas place - BB: 8/VI/12 (2012-5) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark purple to deep ruby brown beer, small beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: overripe and (dark) dried fruits, chocolate, caramel, bit earthy, elderberries syrup, ripe dark red fruits. MF: bit too much carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sweet, caramel, nuts, some fruitiness, bitter touches and dried fruits. Aftertaste: dark caramel, mocha, roasted almonds, some hops leaving a nice dry mouth feel.

Bottle - Pours mahogany with a thin tan head. Caramelly sweet yeasty malt, boozy dark bread, with an off-note of metal. Only a hint of herbal hopping. Molasses is strong on the taste, with a touch of soy sauce and lots of dark bread/chocolate notes. Decent amount of roast. Finishes fizzy and metallic. Wow...was something off with this one? I expected this to be really good but was really disappointed. Maybe I got an old bottle?

Waited too long to open this one.  Oxidized and flat.  :-(    Malty sweet with heavy caramel notes.  Plum and raisins in the nose and taste a bit of yeast flavor and alcohol.  Sadly just cant get beyond the age here.   Dark brown, slight haze.

Bottle. Poured a very very dark amber almost brown color with a two finger tan head that retained throughout the entire beer. Aroma was malts,candies, molasses, and brown sugar. Flavor was brown sugar, dark plum, other fruits and molasses. Longer finish. Dark fruit aftertaste.  Great beer.???????

Pours Dark amber brown, small head. Dark sweet maple & carmel aroma. Taste is malt and caramel, some chocolate/toffee. 

Probably one of the best dopplebocks Ive had. Will be purchasing this again.

Bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty dark fruit and caramel aroma. Sweetish malty spicy caramel and dark fruit flavor. Has a sweetish malty caramel and dark fruit finish with bready hints.

pours hazy dark brown with a nice beige head, good retention and lacing. aroma is sweet dark caramel maple syrup raisin malts, light smoke. yeasts, nice roastiness, sweetness greatly balanced by grassy-resinous hops. malted depth. soft and lively carbonation, medium body, nice grassy finish. great brew.
Pours a dark mahogany with sticky brown head. Smell is malt, bread, and caramel. Taste malt, yeast, and some nice caramel sweetness. Great mouthfeel.

500 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7.4%. Mahogany coloured beer, huge and lasting beige head. Lovely aroma of medium dark malts, bakery (esp. fresh brown bread) and caramel, hints of oak and dark dried fruits. Rich mouthfeel. Distinctly malty and rich flavour, sweet but not too much. Caramel and brown bread baked with syrup, dark dried fruits, moderate hops. Well balanced and truly enjoyable.

Bottle.  Brown-red in color with a thin tan head.  Sweet aromas of caramel, chocolate and raisin.  Nutty coffee flavor with a hint of cocoa.  Very smooth for the alcohol content and a little thinner than I expected.  Creamy texture with mild carbonation.  Very easy drinking brew.
Good beer with a medium brown color. the flavor rich in caramel and the sweet malt scents good. nice!

0,5l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Beautiful clear dark reddish brown color with frothy medium head. Chocolate, coffee, nuts aroma. First it tastes drought and bitter-sour coffee, but later it becomes sweeter, and I can feel the density and the strenght. Full body with creamy oily texture and average carbonation. Strong coffee finish, which hold on for a long time. A very delicious doppelbock, it reminds me of Irish stouts. A good choice for everybody, who like dark strong "coffee-like" beers.

15 Nov 2011, bottle. dark ruby, clear, no bubbles, head immediately fades to thin lacing. big bready and slightly meaty nose. med body and almost flat. rich meaty raisin flavor. really fun. alcohol certainly contributes to body and bolsters the sweet raisin flavor but doesnt dominate. i like this.
Not a great representative of a Bock. There is a cereal malt flavor with a light touch of hops

16.9 ounce bottle.  Pours dark brown with an average tan head.  Aroma of roasted malt and caramel.  Taste is sweet malt, caramel, dark fruit and a bit of chocolate. Alcohol is well hidden.  Very nice.

Clear reddish brown colour, fluffy beige head. Aroma of malts, sweet malts, walnuts, cocoa beans, slight porto wine, caramel, slight apple and kvass. Flavour of sweet malts, quite balanced. Nuts, some milky coffee and slight apple with raisins. Malty finish. For someone who doesnt like doppelbocks that much, I really dig this one.
(From 0.5L bottle @ home)
Wow this beer is delicious very sweet with subtle chocolate and coffee notes, finishes very smooth.

500ml bottle poured dark brown in color with a nice tan head and some thin lacing.  Aroma is dark roasted malts and chocolate with a trace of hops.  Taste is malty sweet with some chocolate and a pleasing hop bitterness underneath.  Medium to heavy body and some nice carbonation make this a pleasant tasting experience.

Pours deep brown with a fluffy light tan head.  Smoky aroma with molasses and spice.  Creamy and chocolately, with subtle dark fruits, cloves, and caramel malt.  Medium viscosity and light carbonation.  I wish this beer was a little more full bodied, but thats my only complaint.
Bottle. Really good beer. I love this styleof beer. Nice dark color. Easy, sweet malt flovor. Aroma of raisins, slightly nutty Just really good.

Bottle, thanks to tkrjukoff. Dark amber/mahogany color, nice beige head. Bready aroma with fruity notes. Malty flavor,a bit roasted, chocolate, sweetish, cocoa, fruity notes, milky. Roasted malt finish.

Dark brown with small tan head.  Powerful malty/brown sugar aroma.  Medium full body, malty/chalky texture, no alcohol, tiny carbonation.  Flavor is pretty sweet, brown sugar, dark dried fruits.  Mildly dry finish.  Very enjoyable.

Bottle. Nice, rusty red colour with a creamy, tanned head. Head lasts long, releasing dark fruity aroma with fruity yeasts. Bit of alcohol present in aroma. Flavour is nice, full of taste. Some ripe fruit, sugary sweetness and alcoholic sweetness finishes. Really good carbonation going on. Nice one.

Botle 50 cl, Alko Arkadia. Pours cloudy mahogany with a good tanned bubbly and creamy lasting head. Aroma is malty, fruity, bready, hay and sweet. Flavor is sweet, very malty, fruity, roasted and hoppy; all in well balance. Finishes sweet malty with a pleasant bitterness.

Silky smooth, sweet and sublime from start to finish. Definitely one of the finest doppelbocks from the worlds oldest brewery and one heck of a fine slow-sippin beer! Perfect as a dessert brew. This is one brew that makes me yearn for a trip to Germany to try this brew at its freshest, especially at Oktoberfest!! I can see my "combat-mug" being filled and emptied many times with this delicious beer! Prosit!!

Pours a clear brown with a decent sized off white head that sticks around for a while.  Malty and apples in the nose.  Caramel, apple juice, roasted malts in the taste.  Perhaps a little brown sugar.  Moderate mouthfeel, seems a little low on carbonation.  Not my favorite style, but this is a great beer.

Clear brown cola colored pour with a pleasing khaki head.  Wonderful malty aroma of chocolate, figs and bread.  Chocolate sweetness up front and hints of graham cracker with a smooth very mild round bitterness at the finish.  "Tingly" finish contrasts nicely with the thick sweet malt flavors.  Medium/full bodied mouthfeel with ample carbonation and no astringency.  Wow!  What an interesting and well balanced beer!  I guys the guys at Weihenstephaner have had a bit of time to perfect this since theyve been at it since the Dark Ages.  Great to taste history.

very impressed, pour from a bottle. Pours very dark with off white creamy head. Aroma of some chocolate and nutty with some scent of hops. great texture and smooth on the after bite overall very impressed

500ml bottle in a stem glass.  Pours brown with a thick, lacy, cream-colored head.  Aroma strong of lightly roasted malts with some chocolate and nutty notes and light floral hops.  Flavor about the same with the strong malt presence.  Average texture.  A really good beer of this style.

Big malt nose; sweet caramel, toffee, chocolate, bread, incredibly rich aroma.  Pours dark brown/black, almost opaque, big tan head with good retention and lacing.  Flavor follows the nose; big chewy, rich malts, toffee, molasses, some chocolate, moderately sweet, slightly warming but no hot alcohol.  Full body, medium carbonation, very smooth.  Great beer, a nice rich cool-weather brew.
What a fantastic smoky dark brew. Extremely smooth for a doppelbock. Delicious and malty.

500 ml bottle.  Pours dark red-brownish hue with a tanned, long lasting head.  Aroma is of caramel, floral hops and hints of cherry.  Medium, velvety body.  Toasted malt, caramel and cherry fruit balanced on the palate by floral hops and burned coffee.  Long, dry, coffee finish.  It is not the best German Dopple bock but it is definitely up there.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 500 mL bottle. Pours dark ruby with a minimal head. The aroma is biscuity yeast with lots of molasses, caramel, bread, and some coffee. The flavor is very sweet, with coffee bitterness. The palate is heavy, syrupy and sticky. Overall, this is a delicious, almost stout-like, doppelbock. 

500 mL bottle, aged for 14 months. The aroma is still very malty, but has picked up some light vinous notes, and a touch of tannin. The coffee and chocolate notes have all but disappeared. The flavor has soured, but only just a little, and it adds a nice new dimension.

06/09/2011 500ml bottle. Meraviglioso color legno di ciliegio, scuro e intenso, con riflessi color miele di castagno, schiuma bianco sporca, non molto abbondante e poco persistente. Aroma magnifico, intenso e complesso, di malto caramellato, spezie, con note di liquirizia e affumicate. In bocca è dolcissima (anche troppo!), caramellata, con un discreto finale amarognolo. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Non sono un amante del genere, ma questa è senza dubbio una doppelbock eccellente.
Nice brown colored pour with a tan head.  Taste is malt, roasted nuts and black licorice.  Smooth finish.  Very good.

16.9 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with amber highlights with a medium beige head with decent retention. Aroma consists of overripe fruit, brown sugar. Taste is sweet and roasty with a light bitterness; has a lightly tart finish. Carbonation is high and the body is medium; has a sticky mouthfeel. Its alright, but nothing Id go out of my way to buy again. I have to add that it went awesome with a hot dog smothered in sauerkraut and yellow mustard.
Brown with a sudsy diminishing head; rich raisin smell; malty with a sweet finish; luscious raisiny palate.

Strong caramel and toasted malt aroma with a buttery undertone. dark amber in colour but not cloudy or hazy. contrary to some other tasters, i found a thin head when poured (weather may have been a factor here). The sweetness with lite bitters is exactly what was ordered for some beef stew. Medium to full body on the palate with a long caramel finish puts this beer in my highest rated category.  Coming from the worlds oldest operating brewery and the 7.4% abv helps put the charisma in this delectable brew.
Pours dark brown with little head which disappears rapidly. Aroma of caramels. Sweet taste that goes down smoothly.
Dark and roasted. The taste is strong but couldve been even stronger. Yet another rock solid choice from Weihenstephaner.

16oz bottle from Picks poured into my Weihenstephaner glass. 

Pours a very dark nut brown with about 1 finger of light tan head. 

Aroma is banana bread and cloves cigarettes. Slight grassy hop smell as well.  

Taste is medium sweet and lightly bitter. Slight aftertaste of coffee. 

Medium bodied with a thin texture. Average carbonation and a nice, slightly bitter finish. 

Overall, its a pretty good beer. Probably the best dopplebock Ive had to date. Ill most likely be picking this one up again some time in the future.

bottled. pours dark but clear mohogany. small light tan head. subdued aromas of roasted malt, chocolate and leather. tastes of sweet malt and mocha. medium bodied with a smooth texture and a lasting astringent finish. pretty decent beer.
Pretty good for a doppelbock. Brown color, smal white head. Smell not so good, average decent bitter taste with hints of caramel and sweetness. Medium carbo and body.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2015 Bottle @ Whole Foods, Sarasota, FL.
Just tried this amazing beer for the first time today (2013). WOW! Never thought i could find a beer as good as (or even better than), Spaten Optimator. Well, today i did. This beer is just plain delicious! Everythings the same...just a little bit smoother & creamier ;) Chocolate, fruit cake, plums, nutty, malty, yummy...
Like Christmas in a bottle! You wont regret trying this.

Bottle from Thai supermarket. Another legendary beer up for rating that I stumbled across in Hua Hin. Pours a near-black, deep nut brown color with a big, creamy off-white head. Nice. Nose is roasted malts, licorice, leather and hints of tar. Wow. For a dobbelbock this is very close to the scent of an imperial stout. Taste is equally imperial: strong roasty malt tones going hand in hand with a solid dose of licorice, leather and hints of tar coming through in the finish. Full-bodied and smooth as hell. A powerhouse of a bock beer, and one I will definitely drink again on any occasion I can dig it up!
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, roasted notes, alcohol, raisin, plum and fruity notes. Flavour follows the nose.

Pours reddish-brown with a 1" head that settled to a thin ring. Shows some lacing and has a sweet, malty nose with hints of dark chocolate and berries. Somewhat malty intro with a soft, syrupy mouthfeel that finishes with some chocolate, raisins, alcohol warming, and a dry afterpalate.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest

Egészen sötét, vörösesbarna színe van, amin koronaként ül a drapp színű, kemény, tömör és szinte örök életű hab. Igen átható, erős illata van, likőrbe áztatott és karamellával leöntött aszalt gyümölcsök egy kis "bocskorszíj" cukorral körítve. Aszalt szilva, füge, mazsola, fekete cseresznye, egy nagy adag égetett cukor és fűszerek jönnek először az ízben. Aztán ez kiegészül egy tekintélyes porciónyi szurokfűvel, ürömmel és más gyomorerősítő gyógyfüvekkel és egy kis komlóval. Olajos, nehéz teste van és tele van apró, csípős kis buborékokkal. Utóíze medvecukros, keserédes és hosszú ideig kitölti a szánkat. A magas alkoholtartalom szépen rejtve marad, csak a fogyasztása utána enyhe nyelvzsibbadás figyelmeztet bennünket rá egy kicsit. Nagyon szépen kiegyensúlyozott és a legtöbb fajtársával ellentétben, nagyon simán csúszó, könnyen fogyasztható dupla bak.  Klasszikus!

Bottle from Csakajósör. Poured deep ruby color and a lively beige foam that quickly reduced to a lacing one. Dark fruity aroma with tons of caramel, honey, hints of earth, vanilla, and floral parfume. Very sweet, with more fruitiness of plums, greengage, and peach. Dense, heavy, oily body with lots of carbonation. Sweet, long lasting finish, with somewhat burnt notes to tickle the tastebuds. Overall, outstanding!

Draught @ OBM11:
Small off white lacing on top of a clear brown colored beer.
Smell some barleys, sweets and malts.
Taste honey, barleys, hops, malts, caramel, bit sweet but more bitter.
Low carbo, medium body, soft mouthfeel and a watery texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
0.5  l bottle from Csakajósör, Bp.
Clear dark brown/ruby colour with a medium sized, pale brown head on its top, which leaves a thin film behind.
Sweet, dried fruity nose.
Light sharp start followed by an oily mouthfeel with a sweet-sour aroma of caramel and raisins escorted by roasty undertones, flavours of dried plums and raisins.
It finishes moderately warming with grassy hops, roasted malt and light alcohol, which leaves a long, sweet-roasty aftertaste behind.
Serious and delicious brew with a well hidden alc.content.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest. Tükrös, barnás árnyalattal bíró mélyvörös színű duplabak, melynek bézs habja tömör és krémes egyszerre, apró buborékokban és viszonylag lassan bomlik le. Illata édes, maláta, aszalt gyümölcsök és jó adag medvecukor érződik. Az íze szinte teljesen tükrözi ezt, de a medvecukor még erősebben érződik, az utóíze pedig malátás és szintén medvecukros. Mindezek az ízek kitűnő összhangban vannak egymással, és szinte egybeolvadnak az olajos, nehézkes testben. Alkoholtartalma alig érződik, jól el van rejtve. Igen édes baksör, ám mégis nagyon jól fogyasztható, akár hosszabb kortyokban is, ízlett.

0,5 l bottle, Csakajosor.hu
Deep ruby bodied one with a superb longlasting foamy beige head. Pleasure aroma with malt, caramel, dark fruits)plum, raisins), some spicies. Very powerful but not overpowered aroma like the flavor profile...Oily body, balanced power based on malt and caramel, fruity character of the strong fermentation with plum and raisins, easy hops in the finish. Small bubbles brings the power of this wonder...

Clear ruby red, sticky, frothy head. Malty, dark fruit aroma with some spicy hops. Big and malty, fruity and sweet with excellent dark caramel malt flavor. Huge, soft palate. Finishes very delicate for such a large beer. Quite graceful.

~Strong toasty bready malt aroma with plenty of creamy melanoidin character, caramel, chocolate and prune like fruitiness.
~Pours a dark reddish brown color with small lasting off white head.
~Toasty bready malt character, light chocolate and prune. Light spicy hops. Also getting stale character of cardboard and glass bottle...stupid BevMo.
~Medium full bodied with medium CO2. Sweet toasty and roasty finish. Some alcohol warmth.
~I bet this would be phenomenal fresh. Too bad I got an older unproperly stored bottle. Still great stuff minus the aging flaws. Probably could have bumped the tasting score up if beer was fresher.basement aromas,

Apperance is clear dark coca cola brown with a tan head and remarkable head retention.  Smell is toffee, caramel, nuts, and a hint of chocolate.  Taste is incredibly rich caramel, nuts, bread, and a mild noble hop finish.  Body is medium-full, creamy, and with below average carbonation.  Overall, an old world gem that has incredible depth of malt flavor; very distinctive. Fantastic.

Poured a dark and clear reddish-brown with a large light-tan head.  Aroma has lots of spices with malty notes.  Some apples and skunk as well.  Taste is thick and creamy with loads of flavor.  At first slightly roasted and nutty.  The finish is fantastic.  Lots of caramel and chocolatey tastes.  Slightly sweet, but with a lot of bitter roasted flavors.  Really good.
I was happy for the smoked flavors. The pour was beautiful into my Weihenstephaner glass. Very dark brown and full bodied.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Very dark red body and solid tan head. Raisin, cereal, basement, toffee and red fruit jam. Delicious! Really nice rich sweet and spicy taste, with a lingering bitterness to give it a good character. Spot on carbonation and mouthfeel. Surprisingly easy drink and happy to have a still moderate ABV. Will absolutely get more of these. (50cl bottle, 2,30 EUR?) (Rating re-indexed)
500 ml bottle.  Golden amber in color with a full pure white head.  Full body, but not heavy.  Easy to drink.  Fruity malts with a touch of caramel.  Delicious.

Pours a dark brown color that reveals itself to be the deepest of rubys in the light. A nice, thick head that reminds me of pancake batter (although obviously not quite as thick). Smells sweet and malty with a strong vege aroma and tastes similarly sweet and malty with hints of caramel, fruit and toffy. A thin, slightly bitter finish.
Clear dark reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, heavy malty, caramel and dried fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. Smooth. 270511

Bottle:  Pours a clear dark browney orange with a thick off-white head, dark malts, caramel, dark fruits, and brown sugar in the aroma, starts and ends lightly sweet with a malty smoke aftertaste, full bodied with mellow carbonation.  I need to try this side-by-side with Celebrator.
Pours a brown color with a light brown head.  Smells a bit like burnt brown sugar and chocolate.  Slightly burnt coffee flavors as well i think?  Pretty good beer.

Der Antrunk begeistert sofort, noch etwas mild startet hier ein malziger, zunehmend röstmalziger süßer Ton, ab dem Mittelteil wird es würzig. Dabei wirkt das Bier für ein Doppelbock ab und an etwas zu mild, einer der wenigen Kritikpunkte. Zum Nachgeschmack wird man von dem sich nun verbundenen Aroma aus Malz- Würze und Süße fast erschlagen, da man damit kaum noch rechnet. Der Nachgeschmack ist so das Prachtstück der Bieres, der Rest scheint oft zu mild. Sehr gut, aber nicht perfekt! 	 
Test vom 23.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,12,12,14,13,13 - 12,85

Probably the closest to claiming the Doppelbock throne from Celebrator, this fruity, hefty brew makes for a good pint, if one needed only once and a while.  Thick yet thoroughly carbonated, Korbinian puts on a show of malted barley, filling your palate with caramel and toffee and cherries and apple cider and cloves and warmth.   Yet, as big of a sugar-bomb as this brew sounds, the flavors all move along briskly thanks to the ample carbonation.  Grows trying towards the end of the bottle, but a solid German brew to use as an example towards import haters.  (12/08)
Bottle. Brown with medium tan head. Flavour is malt, yeast, little sweet, fruit, caramel and hops.

Dark reddish brown with a generous three-finger foamy head that lasted a long time and left strong lace. Strong malty aromas with a caramel, almost prune-like smell. Malt sweetness is the predominant flavor, accompanied by fig-like fruits, brown sugar, and mild black pepper. Alcohol is evident. Creamy mouthfeel, lively carbonation, and the sweetness lingers.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2012 Bottle @ home. Deep brown body with a two finger brown head. Roasty, a touch smoky, dark brown malty Bock aroma. Sweet, fairly thick, dark brown malty, Bock, lager, slight chocolate, and a touch of peat in the flavor with a somewhat bitter malty finish. Last time I had this on tap in Freising, it was a 4.5-4.6. This time its closer to a 3.9-4.1. Ill be sure to make a more detailed, accurate rating next time Im in Germany. Update: Just tried it at the brewery in Freising and it was a 4.1.

Pours a beautifully clear darkest shade of black cherry with a huge creamy/frothy head that slowly dissipates to a cap but leaves incredible lacing all the way down. Smells of caramel, brown bread, figs, prunes, dark fruit. Lots of sweet malty aromas ticket the nose. Taste is sweet with malts. Dark fruits, prunes, figs, burnt brown sugar, a touch of alcohol about midway and a long lingering molasses and dark fruit finish. Sweet sticky mouthfeel, light to medium carbonation, thick body. This is a great dopplebock. A malt heads dream with great complexity and an abv that is well hidden.

Bottle. Cloudy brown pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of caramel, faint yeast and malt. Great medium to full bodied taste of caramel, roasted malt and bread. Nice even finish that completely masks the alcohol

From bottle bought in Carterville, IL.
Appearance: pours a beautiful nutty brown body with a thick, creamy head which is an off white to tan color.  Very carbonated with a head that lasts a few minutes and laces the glass.
Nose: no alcohol.  Strong caramel-bread notes with a slight dark chocolate.
Taste: quite subtle compared to their hefe-weizen; rich but not cloying hints of caramel-bread with slight dark chocolate.  Very well balanced between malt and hops.
Mouthfeel: watery
Overall: Great session beer (if you can handle the alcohol).  Very well balanced.  Very enjoyable.  Not as much flavor as a hefe-weizen or weisbock, but good.  Reminiscent of an Irish Dry Stout because it is rich and creamy but the flavors are more nuanced.

500 mL bottle. Pours translucent medium brown with a medium size head. Aroma and flavor are a bit flat and watered down, but just a bit. Good maltiness and typical dark fruity flavors. A lot of earthiness and dark roasty flavors. Almost seems like a cross between a doppelbock and a dunkel.

50 cl, bottled. Pours clear deep red with a sandstone head. Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, rye pudding, raspberry. Taste: Sweet. Rye pudding in flavours and coffee. Little too sweet for my liking, should have more bitterness for balancing. Palate: Soft bodied, oily. Overall: Too bad its in such a high level in sweetness. Minimal soapiness.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. My favourite Weihenstephan. Pours a deep ruby brown with a small white head. Sweet raisins and smoke on the nose. Lots of earthy notes come through in the flavour as well as notible nuts. Great beer
Smoky caramel aroma. Thick light brown head. Very very dark brown in appearance. Taste is hoppy with a caramel aftertaste, a bit fizzy. Delicious.
Bottled.  A black headless beer which is oily looking.  Strong, rich and sweet.  Coal, licquorice, molasses and soy.  Deep dark gollpy and tasty.  A superior doppelbock.
500 ml bottle.  Pours deep ruby-brown in colour, with nice super fine, frothy mocha coloured head.  Aroma and taste are sweet raisiny malt, slightly nutty, slightly smoky.  Really good Doppelbock!!

Draft at The Royale. Pours a mostly clear, bright chestnut brown color with amber highlights and a finger-thick off-white head. Nice aroma of nuts, toasty caramel, bready, doughy, and munich malts, and brown sugar. Flavor of nuts, the same slate of malts, earthy and vegetal notes, and brown sugar. Medium-bodied, with a toasty, malty mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Hell of a doppelbock.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle. Dark brown color, with red hues. Thin small white head. Left spotty lacing. Aroma of dark fruit and robust malt. Taste is toasted malt with big caramel Flavor. Finish is smooth and the ABV is hidden well. A fine brew from a Great brewery. Shared bottle with LiteWait.
On tap at Beer Geeks. Very dark beer. Smells fanastic. I taste dark fruits in this. First stab at a doppelbock. Damn good. =)

Poured from a 500 ml bottle. Dark brown color, with red hues. Thin small white head. Left spotty lacing. Aroma of dark fruit and robust malt. Taste is toasted malt with big caramel Flavor. Finish is smooth and the ABV is hidden well. A fine brew from a Great brewery.  Shared bottle with AirForceHops.

dark brown with a glassy amber shine, a big light beige head, good retention and lace... the nose is really sweet, prunes, molasses, bready backbone a little alcohol on the back... the taste is sweet prunes and brown sugar with a hop alcohol finish, not bad... the mouthfeel is way to light but alcohol is hidden great... just had the Andechs a couple days before so this doesnt compare at all, but for something that costs $3 and is widely available worth trying if you like this style

Very aromatic with lots of flavor of fruit, honey and light toffee notes.  The beer pours a beautiful dark red color, with a nice size head.  Taste was traditional European, with lots of honey flavors.  Very aromatic and robust, and delicate.  You could tell someone really cared brewing this beer.  I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Very dark red-brown, slightly translucent in the glass with a tall bubbly head like root beer.  Aroma is rich and sweet, like molasses and toast.  The beer is warming and spicy, rich and sweet but balanced with enough hop and tang.  Quite tasty and warms the belly.
This is a great tasting beer. Right on the mark for a Doppelbock. So good I bought another today. The German beers have me hooked.

Bready malty aroma of chocolate biscuits. Brown, ruby red color with very thin layer of white foam. Initial taste is quite sweet and malty. Its got a very  nice honey flavor with notes of caramel and candy.

Aroma: Fresh bread and nuts, faintest hints of vegetables--leeks? onions?
Appearance: Clear reddish brown with a thick white head that dissipates quickly.
Taste: Medium sweetness tinged with a light bitterness in the finish, and very slight hint of salt on the back of the tongue. Really well balanced.
Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: Not a big fan of the style in general, but this is a really tasty beer. It certainly stands up against other heavy hitters, but theres no blatant alcohol taste, just a malty creaminess that works well. This will certainly find itself on my table come grilling season, especially with smoked Cornish game hen or something similar.

500 ml bottle purchased at Royal in KCMO. 1350 stamped on the bottle. Pour is a dark ruby and brown, mostly clear with a big three inch tan head that is quite lasting. When it falls, there is nice etched lacing. Aroma is cracked grain maltiness, some dark dried fruit sweetness, and a very small bit of garlic and clove yeast. Taste is very much about the malt, which presents cleaner than the nose - just a very full mildly sweet cracker toasty maltiness. The raisin and yeast is present as well, particularly in the long finish. Chocolate cocoa notes are in here. There is something of a honey floral aspect that is drying and lightly bitter in the aftertaste as well.  Much going on in the taste, with interesting transitions.  Palate is medium to full bodied, active carbonation and the really long dry finish.  Nice beer, would be really interesting paired with heavier meats.

500 ml bottle purchased at Major Market in Escondido a year ago ($2.99).  Pours dark brown with some brilliant dark ruby highlights and two fingers of beige foam.  Aroma of raisin and other dark fruit, toasted bready malts, grain, caramel, and some light spice.  Flavor of smooth caramel, dark fruit (raisin and a hint of cherry), light chocolate, and some molasses.  Nicely sweet and far from cloying.  Tingly carbonation on the tongue.  Nice doppelbock.  (942, 484)
Pours a medium-dark color with a thick, resilient off-white head. Aroma is clean, crisp, champagne-like; fruity. Taste is fruity with some caramel notes.  Very mild and drinkable.
Poured from bottle nice very dark brown and that great Weihenstephaner head in tan color. Nice taste of malt & caramel slight bitterness, flavor lingers for quite a while. Good tasting beer.

The description in the beer menu is spot on. If coca-cola were a beer it would taste like this. Pours with same brown blackness of coke. The aroma has hints of raisin and licorice. Mouthfeel is fairly dense and the taste lingers for hours.
Very dark brown, but clear and with a tan head.   Aroma is of dark bread with a hint of molasses.  Taste is a bit sweet but smooth with more dark bread.

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours dark brown to black with a thin tan head, aroma is caramel malt, very subdued. The taste is mellow caramel and almost no bitterness. Medium body, medium/high carbonation, creamy finish. Overall a very mellow creamy smooth brew.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 0.9 ounce, purchased at Bangor Wine and Cheese on August 17 2010, savoured on March 1 2011; eye: mahogany, clear, minimal effervescence, really tiny ring of khaki head, slight lacing; nose: spent grains, grain, light roasted malt; mouth: light, light roasted malt, light spent grains, slight chocolate, hint of alcohol, finale in spent grains with presence of grain, medium body, lightly sweet, grainy texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 0,9 once, achetée chez Bangor Wine and Cheese le 1er mars 2010, savourée le 26 février 2011; il : acajou, claire, effervescence minime, très petit anneau de mousse kaki, très légère dentelle; nez : drèche, grain, léger malt torréfié; bouche : léger, léger malt torréfié, léger drèche, très léger chocolat, pointe dalcool, finale en drèche avec présence de grain, corps moyen, légèrement sucrée, texture granuleuse; en résumé : bien
Pours very dark brown with a thick creamy tan head.  Aroma of malt and yeast.  Moderately thick mouth.  Surprisingly robust and complex maltiness.  I enjoyed it quite a lot.
Dark brown beer, medium head that should hold a bit longer. Sweet red fruits, yeast, caramel at both the taste and smell.

Nice black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, dark fruit, & caramel; Flavor of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, dark fruit (notably plums), and some chocolate; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, great brew.

On draught at Gourmet Haus.  Great sweet malt with a touch of corn and fresh hay. Great clear, ruby color with full brown head of medium bubbles slowly turning chunky. Flavor is a little rough, like the grain husks are still in the beer. Malt is slightly restrained in a nice way. A spike of bitterness on the finish makes this a pleasurable beer.

Comes in an eloquently decorated bottle. Brewed around November of 08, I dont feel like deciphering their date code.

Pours a nice dark color with hints of ruby and a compact but creamy looking off white head that fades rather quickly.

Smell isnt very pungent, some malty sweetness is there and that is basically it. Much malt, but it is still faint malt.

Wonderful mouthfeel and taste to make up for the weaker scent. The carbonation bites the tounge and really opens up the palate for the sweet, but roasty malt flavor. Hints of dark fruit and alcohol tag along. Hint of metallic flavor puts a small damper on the taste.

Its a good Bavarian doppelbock. On the level of say a Maximator, not bad, not good, not average, just slightly above in a highly competitive and well done style. Nice price on it htough, as with all Weihenstephaner products, they are priced right.
excellent malt profile, very well made doublebock. Excellent balance, highly recommended
Awsome beer if your a fan of darks. This beer is at first sweet. Than it turns bitter. This beer has a 2 toned head. Great beer!
Pours reddish black with thick foamy head and lacing.  Notes of fvanilla and banana.  Well balanced taste with a slight metallic hint.  Smooth and creamy.

Very good beer. Like previously said along with Celebrator ... Doppelbocks are the greatest creation. Very creamy and soft body. Does not taste like 7.4%. Decent palate. Aroma of wood, bread, hay, chocolate, whiskey.
Aftertaste very pleasant inviting for more brew.

Bottle. The smell from the glass is very malty, some bitter chocolate. The medium large beige head has a normal duration, the body is nearly black. The taste is very malty, milk chocolate with a light bitter finish. The body is medium strong, creamy with a light watery finish and a normal carbonation.

Pours pretty much black with off-white head. Strong aroma of molasses and dark corn syrup and a little cedar/mesquite smoke. Full-bodied, thick and full of molasses flavor. Lengthy finish. This is a perfect winter warmer

Deep brown in the glass with a tan head that begins slightly thick and thins out as you go.  Malty aroma of dried fruits and roasted malt.  Medium-full bodied on the palate.  Malt on the palate shows caramel sweetness and more of the dark fruit character, a slight roasted note, and a touch of a nutty flavor.  Just enough hop bitterness to balance out the malt.
Good appearence, aroma, taste, etc.  Among Weihenstephaners best beers ever.

Poured into a dimpled mug. Appearance: pours dark ruby red to brown with a two finger tan head that lingers around nicely. Aroma: sweet malts dominate the nose with some fruity alcohol esters lingering in there. Taste: this is a malt bomb. Layers of malt sweetness roll over the palate (doppelbocks always remind me of red licorice for some reason) while the finish is pleasantly semi dry with some bready, toasty, malt sweetness lingering. Hops are mostly absent but are working in the background along with the relatively high alcohol content to keep the beer from being cloyingly sweet. Overall: this beer is fantastic. Stands toe-to-toe with some of the greatest doppelbocks (Celebrator in particular but also Salvator). And, for 2.99 at a local beer warehouse, what a steal! Prost!

Now heres a dark lager you can set your watch to. Very dark ruby pour with a short tan head cameo. This one is a malt bomb: assertive notes of brown sugar, butter, vanilla and honeycomb, with a roasty twang not unlike that of a good Baltic porter. Subtle bitterness in the finish and perhaps a miniscule pinch of smoke. Creamy body and very easy to drink.

This beer is very malt forward with hops playing a relatively small part. Color is that of a pretty dark brown ale. Flavor is potent with a somewhat syrupy quality and a bit of caramel. Nose is mostly from the malt aspect of the beer with some noble hopping showing through. Syrupy character of dopplebocks often put me off, but this one is more subdued and is a good example of the style.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2011 Pours bright and brown with a plumy tan head.  Aroma is of tasty caramel.  Flavor is incredibly malty, sweet and caramelly but well-infusted.  Slight-to-moderate hop bitterness (also well-infused) with considerable grainy coarseness getting larger near the end.  Almost a slight hint of roasted grain in the finish.  Delicious- I could not slow down!
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Chestnut colored pour. Sweeter  rather than the huge roastiness of Celebrator. Notes of toffee, caramel maltiness. light butterscotch. Creamy mouthfeel. Nice beer

500ml bottle from Bevmo. Pours a nice chestnut brown color with a big foamy beige head that has very good retention. The aroma is mild with sweet roasted malts, earthy yeasts, dust and molasses. The flavor is more of the same sensations as the nose; molasses, sweet malts, yeast, brown sugar and roasted grains. The palate is full and creamy with soft carbonation. The finish is long and slightly sweet. Overall: me likey.
24th March 2008  Rich smooth dark brown beer. Plenty of malt with a mild and non bitter marmite streak. Mildy yeasty finish.

A - Aromas of caramel, malt, and yeast predominant. Ap - Dark, cola color with a moderate beige head (1.5 finger) that hung around for awhile. Little lacing in the glass. T - Sweet, bready, very little bitterness. Very rich and complements other savory flavors very well. Alcohol is very well-masked and makes for an exceedingly enjoyable drink. P - Lighter than I expected, but still has a little of the "chewiness" I like in a good doppel. O - 2nd place for me, right behind Ayingers Celebrator - an excellent beer and the price is amazing, too.

Aroma of molasses, leather and burnt sugar.  Some soy sauce notes as well.  Red/brown the color of coca cola with a generous tan head.  Decidedly sweet with well-hidden alcohol.  No appreciable hop flavor but does finish with some bitterness on the back..  All carmel malt flavors.  Creamy to oily mouth.
Dark brown in color with very small tan head. Aroma is light and malty. Flavor is very malty with a light sweetness, roastyness, and light caramel flavor. Smooth and easy to drink but very flavorful

Pours a deep, yet clear amber.  Minimal dark tan head, diminishing to oily surface.  Let me cut to the chase:  This is an excellent doppelbock that has a GREAT mouthfeel and taste throughout.  A bit of smoke - but not overwhelming.  Truly a great beer of this style - Prost!
Bottle. Black with a red hue and a medium lasting off-white head. Strong malty aroma. Smooth feel with dark caramel and chocolate. Finish is roasted malt.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 A much better hit-out this time around. Quite fresh and this always helps. Vegemite and funky chocolate, as expected, and the palate shows some genuine power and length. Has about the body youd expect at 7.4%. Low fizz.

[3523-20101228] Tap. Mild grassy lawnmower oil aroma has a mild wheat note. Hazy, light brown orange body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Light fruity flavour has a nice nutty aftertaste and good wheat notes throughout. Medium body has a nice light bitterness. Very pleasant, sessionable.
(@ Coles, Buffalo, NY)

A solid doppelbock.  Starts big with caramel malt, stays big with the same to a lightly bittered, carbonated finish.  Could be even higher rated - suffers because flavor is somewhat one-dimensional....but what a good flavor!

Pours a dark brown, with a light tan head.  Aroma of fruit, roasted malts and caramel.  Flavor is well balanced with caramel, fruit and chocolate and an underlying woodsy tastes.  Very nice and balanced.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2011 Bottle pours medium brown with thick light tan head.  Aroma of malts and a little sourness.  taste dark malts, caramel, a little dark fruit and vanilla, mild hops.  Brief finish of slight hops and roast.  Palate thin but not watery, carbonated.  Alcohol not apparent.

Kind of wish it had more flavor but good beer that I think would go particularly well with food.

Bottle. Pours clear reddish brown with a creamy light tan head. The aroma is heavy malty and bready with notes of wood and caramel. Sweet caramel and malt in the flavour with some notes of tobacco and dark fruit.
alot darker then sum of the other weihenstephaners brown roasted flavor to it good and cheap
bottle.  Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Nose is of banana, bread, roast malt and nut.  Taste is roast malt and nut.  Mouthfeel is medium.  Decent.

Pours rich dark brown with luscious creme head; smooth, charcoal sweet with hints of molasses and toffee.  Very malty, light mouth feel with modest finish but lacks serious kick.  Very good vs. spicy wings.  A great dopple, up there with the best of them, must have w/ bbq sometime.

A: The pour is a dark cola color with a minimal khaki colored head forming.

S: Nose is very sweet with nice chocolate and intense caramel. A bit of a dark fruit profile with cherries and plums, potentially raisins as well. Some bready notes as well as a bit of banana and spice.

T: Sweet cherries, bananas, plums, and raisins to start this one off. Theres a touch of roasted malt followed by chocolate, molasses, toffee, and brown sugar. Just a touch of bitterness for some balance.

M: The body is medium with a moderate to high level of carbonation.

D: A very solid doppelbock. Great flavors and deceptively easy to drink, despite a pretty sizable ABV.

On tap at a German restaurant in SF 
Appearance: Medium brown with a beige head and some lacing 
Aroma: Fruity, caramel and sweet malts 
Taste: Caramel and sweet malts 
OK
2010 - 12 - 12 500ml bottle. brown colour. creme colour head. nice deep taste. alcohol present. good value for money.

2009 Vintage tasted on draft at Fountainhead.  Pours a very dark but clear amber with a thick white head that leaves a sold lace collar.  The nose is dark malt with a good amount of brown sugar and chocolate with just a hint of spicy yeast.  The flavor is a little lighter and more nuanced with milk chocolate and malty bitterness and the same yeast flavor displayed on the nose.  The body is medium with average carbonation and a long bitter and chocolate finish.

2009 version on tap at Fountainhead. Dark brown body with a decent beige head. Fruity, raisiny notes over a sweet malty aroma. Flavour is sweetly malty with just a touch of balancing bitterness that lingers a bit. Nice medium palate, could be more full bodied for my liking. Nice beer.

Bottle: Aroma is fruity and vinous, some malts. Sweet. Color of ruby and mahoghany with a nice beige head. Tastes sweet, but with a husky malt presence. Wheat tones and a little dark fruit. Some alcohol can be detected, but not in a distracting manner.

A: Pours a nice dark brown with a few crimson highlights and a dark tan head.

S: Loads of dark fruit along with caramel and a bit of chocolate.

T: Just like a doppelbock should be. Loads of malt without being too sweet and finishing with some nice chocolate and dark fruity, figgy notes.

M: Medium body and quite thick. Strong taste and presence without being too alcoholic.

D: Very drinkable. A great beer to pair with a wide array of foods.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-15-2010
Nice chocolate aroma. Im new to this style, but the flavor reminds me of a porter a bit. The flavor is nutty with hints of chocolate.
Roasted rye bread, wood, maple syrup with a sweet malt back. Some floral hops and a nice texture. excellent bock.

thanks to The_Hopster; murky cola color, creamy short-lived head, aroma of chocolate, molasses, honey, spices, coffe with bready and doughy strong malt profile, hops to the backgound but theyre there, smooth palate, lower than average carbonation, pretty long finish, heavier sweet taste, a nice example of a doppelbock

From a bottle. Appearance is dark translucent brown with a fluffy cream colored head. Aroma is mostly malt with a touch of nuts and toffee. Taste is much like the nose with the malt being the main taste and the toffee and nuts coming through after the beverage has been swallowed. For all the more this beer costs, its a very good one.
Delicious with generous layers of complex flavors: nutty, sweet fruit, bitter spice and a wonderful nose as well.  One of the most interesting doppelbocks Ive ever tried, perfect for roasted meats.

Poured from a 16.9 oz. bottle into a pilsner glass.

Pours a deep cherry wood color with ruby highlights and a 3-4 finger creamy khaki colored head. Excellent lacing.

Smell: Caramel malt with dried fruits and a mild nutty aroma.

Taste: Bready malt and dried fruits up front followed by caramel malt and nuts in the middle then finishing with a very mild hoppy bitterness. Aftertaste is fairly dry with a hint of fruitiness. Extremely well balanced. Delicious.

Mouthfeel: Light-to-medium-bodied with a low amount of carbonation. Very smooth and somewhat creamy.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. The alcohol is completely hidden by the excellent flavor.

Overall: Excellent beer overall. One of the best doppelbocks in the world and another fine offering from the worlds oldest brewery.
(bottle)  Mahogany colored and richly flavored.  Malty with coffee flavors at first with a sweet clinging aftertaste of prunes.  Very sophisticated, but not a particular style for me.

Bottle.  Pours dark mahogany with a small beige head.  Aroma is of sweet malt, caramel, molasses, a little spice, and some alcohol.  Initial flavor was metallic but that quickly passed.  Flavor is quite sweet, lots of caramel and molasses, a bit of nuts, some smoke.   Mouthfeel is on the heavy side with a nice creaminess.  A very tasty doppelbock that hits every element of the styles profile.

On tap at Brauerei Weihenstephan. Pours darkbrown colour with a nice head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and some caramel. Flavour is light roasted malt, smooth fruitiness with some fudgy taste as well.

Bottle 50cl. A clear dark beer with good head. Smell is on malt, caramel and toasted notes. A very nice beer, quite creamy, sweet, very malty with brown notes, good dopplebock more on brownish notes than usual ones. Finish is very long, alcohol is properly hidden, even chocolate notes, a pleasure.
Bottle from the new Majestic on Pioneer.Dark brown pour with a frothy brown head.  Aroma is malty, dry, and some faint dark fruit.  Taste is more dark fruit, roasted, and chocolate.

Bottle.

Brownish red with a medium slightly tan head. Chocolate, roasted malt. Sweet both in the aroma and taste. I like it!

Pours dark brown with a small brown head and good lacing. Nose is strong and malty with plenty of brown sugary goodness and a touch of bittering hops. Flavor is deep and lead by very strong brown sugar, maple, raisins, and licorice, balanced by moderate but not overly strong hops. Very thick and sticky. Finish is long and earthy. An excellent example of the style.

On tap at the paas in the Hague.
Dark ruby beer. Nice aftertaste. Good beer.

color is dark brown with a hint of red. head is a creamy beige. aroma is heavy on the caramel malt with a bit of smokiness and hints of beef jerky. flavor is less on the caramel and stronger on the smoke. there is a very slight hint of alcohol on the tongue. finishes nice and malty. pretty good.
Murky brown with a light brown head. Powerful flavours in this beer, lots of roasted malts, chocolate, leather, caramel smoke and a little hint of coffee.

bottle pours ruby brown with a medium tan head.  Aroma is near perfect.  Soft caramel and toffee notes with light coffee and dark cane sugar in the background.  Flavor is semi-sweet caramel malt with equal parts bitter coffee ending mellow with light spicing and doughy yeast.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is huge caramel, malt, spices, smoke and roasted malt.
Flavour is malt, caramel and loads of roasted malt.
Quite nice.

Quite a tasty and well made brew! A very dark reddish brown with good tan head and medium-to-low carbonation. This one is all about the roasty sweetness and fine hoppy balance. Still on the sweet side. Finish is of lingering roasty malts.

In bottle; pours dark brown. Aroma of malts, almost sweet with a roasty/coffee scent. Taste is quite mild bodied, but good caramel and espresso notes with more subtle chocolate notes. Some subtle bitterness at the end. Overall, a very good beer.
Everything it should be from one of the oldest breweries in the planet.  Lightly nutty while remaining pleasantly malted...this one hits the spot, every time.

Bottle. Great nose that puts me in mind of pumpkin pie -- the spice with the underlying sweetness and brown sugar notes. Color is translucent brown-red with a cappucino head. Great palate of milk chocolate, spice, roasted notes, and an almost lactic mouthfeel. Crisp carbonation keeps it from being unctuous. I like it.
Snifter. Pours a dark red beer with some caramel coloured head. Nose is soy and chocolate. Tastes like coffee, caramel and syrup. A bi tof raosted malts. Medium hoppiness. A sweet beer.
Dark brown body, cremey head. Caramalisation, toffy, chocolate, roasty, slight bitter finish just for the balance.

Bottle from Alko, 2010-10-01, Göteborg
AR: wee toffee with some chocolate, the wee aromas are growing awfter being poured
AP: dark brown body, high creamy light browm head
F: toffee, soft round fudgeiness, perfect swetness

Pours a dark ruby red with a tan head.The aroma is a very nice brown sugar with notes of chocolate.The taste is a sweet malty flavor.The body is thiner than I like but the finish was smooth.Overall another good German beer.
Dark red pour. Faint aroma, caramel. Cant smell much over the smoke at the bar Im in. Flavor is lighter than expected. Some malts with a lingering bitterness.
Brown sugar aroma. Lasting tan head. Honey bread, brown sugar, raisins, chocolate wafer, Graham cracker.

Pours dark brown with reddish hues. Tan head with a little lacing.
Nose is smoke with a  little banana. Taste is smoke dark malt, banana. Medium body. Finish is a little bitter with lingering sweetness.

Appearance:  dark brown with lovely ruby highlights, nice foamy, creamy head that shrank to a nice lacing.  Aroma:  very rich and malty, lots of sweetness, some chocolate, molasses, cinnamon.  Taste:  a little like chocolate milk and ginger snaps; nicely sweet and a strong toasted malt profile; maybe some nuts? Finish:  sweet, with lingering roasted malts and chocolate.  Notes:  This was a fantastic example of the style.  Very drinkable and rich in the mouth, with nonetheless pleasantly refreshing carbonation.

500. Pours a near black with golden brown edges. Loose light tan head. Creamy medium body, just exceptionally silky and dimensional for a lager. Toast, nuts, caramel, and yeasty spice on the mid palate. Like a really rich brown bread you could still use for sandwiches. Long bready spicy finish. Really delicious.

500 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 20.2.2010.
Pours a brown colour with a off-white frothy head. Roasted malts, dark fruits and bread on the nose. Sweet flavour of malts, dried fruits, wood and toffee. Earthy notes too. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Very nice brew and goes well with different kinds of meat.

Weihenstephaner
Korbinian
Pours medium to dark brown with a medium brown head and good retention. Aroma of brown sugar, caramel, chocolate and spices. Smells yummy. Tastes full bodied with sweet caramel and chocolate. Clovey spiciness and some bready malts. Good dopplebock!

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2010 Bottle.

A - Dark cherry walnut with some dark ruby hue. Just larger than average, thick, creamy, fluffy, sticky, toasted marshmallow color head. Very good retention with 

S - Nice tart/tangy dark fruit with plums being strongest and some fig, date, and raisin along with some dark cherry. Nice dark bready aroma, pumpernickel like, as well. Touches of dark chocolate/cocoa and earthy nuttiness. 

T - Plenty of dark fruit with plum having a slight edge toward the beginning then fig and then cherry toward the finish, but other dark fruit flavors are present in the background. Some apple as well. Good amount of dark, toasted bread flavors as well. A touch of caramel toward the finish. Hints of dark chocolate, some malty flavors, and a touch of sugar like sweetness.

M - Medium body with a bit above average carbonation. Pretty smooth, but a touch thin and not quite as creamy as I was expecting. However it is still pretty good body.

D - Easy to drink with a good balance between some roasted flavors and some dark fruit, along with some malt/bready flavors. Not overly tart, nor sweet, but a well balanced and tasty beer.

Notes: Very nice doppelbock with a good balance with dark fruit and tart/sour flavors along with a nice sweet flavor and some dark bready flavors. Just an overall nice beer to drink and a solid example of the style.
Slightly roasty, moderate dark cocoa powder.  Clean, pretty crisp, well-bodied. Not unbelievably flavorful and not as interesting as my favorites in the style, but tasty nonetheless.

From the bottle, pours a dark deep crimson with a thick foamy tan head.  Aroma is malty, with a hint of alcohol.  Taste is thick and almost creamy, light notes of malts, copper, hint of banana and dunkel flavors, bready, clean finish, thins out.  Pretty good.

Bottle: Pours a dark amber/brown, with a decent off white head. Smell and flavors of various fruits, distinctly, with a caramel malt feel. Sweetness dominates the taste overall, for me. I found it to be a little boring, honestly.

(Bottle) Pours dark mahogany brown with red highlight. Creamy, off-white head. Fat aroma of bread syrup, herbs and dark fudge. The maltiness is fantastic and creamy. Maybe some milk chocolate. The flavour is medium sweet with light to no bitterness. Mild bread syrup, herbs, spices, earth, fudge, caramel, heavy malt and mild hops. The mouthfeel is round, smooth and light carbonated. Heavy caramelly malt finish. Medium to full bodied.

Bottle at Frog & Monkey.  Pours a deep amber-brown color with a nice thick head and decent retention.  Plenty of dark fruits to go along with licorice, sweet dried fruit, burnt sugar, and caramel.  The alcohol isnt completely hidden as there is a slight sting there to let  you know its there.  Overall this beer is quite solid.  Nothing spectacular but very enjoyable and something thats widely available.  Ill get it again.
From a bottle ,molasses ,dark fruit notes ,dark red in color,white head,light sweetness, slick feel, full body, soft carbonation.
Very malty and sweet, drinking one now and Im not dissappointed, this beer is like candy.

Brown semi clear with notes of red, sustained brownish head...  aroma is roasty, malty, not much hop at all, toasted notes... malty, not over the top, drinkable, nice finish, dry, kinda lively, nice flavor, long lingering sweetness, decent, not my favorite, but very very good...
Excellent sweet malty aroma and taste to accompany a very nice body and enticing look. A fine specimen of a doppelbock

500ml bottle. Pours an opaque dark brown, verging on black, with a creamy biege head. The aroma is dark and luscious, blending coffee and chocolate into a lovely roast mixture.
